loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, four of whom are in school.   Christine has a business as a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Christine sells her products in a shop by means of retail.    

Christine has requested  for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of soap, cans of cooking oil, cartons of salt, bags of rice and sugar.  She also generates additional income through selling piped water and a bar.The main business challenge for Christine include the rainy season because the place where she works from is prone to floods and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own home and business premise and someday owning a whole sale shop.   Christine lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and has  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cans of cooking oil and boxes of soap

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Poni is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en: Pamella N. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Pamella lives with her family in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or running water.  Pamella has a business selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works every day of the week. Pamella sells her products in a retail shop.  Pamella has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves and other cosmetics.  Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business location and feeding her family.  The main business challenges for Pamella include thieves and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and also to own a bridal salon.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha está separada del esposo el cual la abandono con un bebé, que ahora tiene cuatro años; vive en alquiler en la zona de Pasankery  de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente cuenta con un ambiente el cual utiliza como taller de costura de trajes, abrigos, pantalones para varón y mujer, dejando sus trabajos en tiendas de la zona Sur de la ciudad de la Paz y  es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de dos maquinas de coser rectas industriales  y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is separated from her husband, who abandoned her with their baby, now 4 years old; she lives in a rented house in Pasankery, a neighborhood of La Paz.
She has a room she uses as sewing workshop, where she sews dresses, coats, men and women’s trousers; she then sells her clothes to shops located in the southern area of La Paz. This is how she earns money to provide for her family.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two sewing machines in order to increase her earnings.
This is her first loan, and according to the socio-economic analysis carried out on her she is positively qualified to be granted a loan.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Peter Wahome

texts.en:
Peter, 35 years old, has practiced farming in Olkalou since 2004.  He plants potatoes and sells them in the local market.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to plant more potatoes on his farm, including preparing the land and planting the seedlings. 

In future, Peter plans to have sufficient savings to enable him to build houses to rent in Olaklou.

loans.use: To plant more potatoes on his farm, including preparing the land and planting the seedlings.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (harina, fideo, pan. Soda, cerveza. Dulces, detergentes y otros, empezó su tienda desde muy pequeñita ahora ya esta mas surtida el crédito que solicito es para comprar otro estante y llenarlo de mercadería para la venta, Ella tiene 3 hijos por los cuales ella esta todo el día en casa de donde le surgió la idea de poner un kiosco. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa de medio uso en el mercado Los Lotes donde no le fue muy bien pero no se desanimo y ahora es dueña de su propia venta, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Francisca makes a living by selling groceries (flour, noodles, bread, soft drinks, beer, sweets, detergent, etc.).  She started her store when she was very young, and now that it is better stocked, she is requesting a loan to buy another display case and to fill it with merchandise to sell.  She has 3 children, which is why she is at home every day and why she had the idea to start a kiosk.  She is a very enterprising woman.  She previously sold used clothing in the Los Lotes markets.  It didn't go very well, but she didn't lose hope, and now she is the owner of her own business. She is very thankful to the organization for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To buy a display case

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka is 48 years old and married; her husband is a businessman. She has nine children, three of whom go to school.  Maka B. is currently in the business of making and selling ice cream.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Brayan Josue

texts.es:
Brayan es un comerciante de ropa y empleado de una funeraria, tiene 22 años y reside en el departamento de San Miguel; Él vive con su esposa y su hija de 6 años. Comercializa ropa con la ayuda de su esposa los fines de semana y durante los días lunes a viernes trabaja en una funeraria en el área de ventas desde hace ya vario tiempo.
El solita un préstamo pues se ve en la necesidad de adquirir más ropa para la venta, por lo que este préstamo le servirá para hacer la inversión y contar con mas prendas de vestir para ofrecer a los clientes quienes siempre buscan nuevos estilos y colores de moda, satisfaciendo así la demanda y la preferencia de estos.
Los objetivos de Brayan son contar con un negocio estable y propio, que le genere los ingresos necesarios para dar a su familia una mejor vida con las condiciones adecuadas para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Brayan is a clothing merchant and a funeral parlor employee. He is 22 years old and lives in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and 6 year old daughter. He sells clothing with the help of his wife on weekends. Monday through Friday he works in a funeral parlor in the area of sales. He has done this for some time.  

He is asking for a loan because he sees the need to acquire more clothing. This loan will be used for investment and to have more clothing items to offer his customers because they are always looking for new styles and colors and he wants to satisfy their demand and preference.   

Brayan's objectives are having his own stable business that makes enough income to give his family a better life with the adequate conditions for their development.

loans.use: Buying clothes

loans.name: Siphora Wanjiku

texts.en:
Siphora has practiced farming in Naivasha since 1983.  She is 41 years old, married to Stephen Mundia, and they have six children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid all the previous loans well and in good time. She will use the new  loan to plant potatoes on her farm.

In the future, Siphora hopes to build rental houses.

loans.use: To plant potatoes on her farm.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is single and she is a seamstress. Her business is in the Boqueron neighborhood of the city. She likes her job and has a number of clients that help her have a good income. Thanks to her sister's help, along with a good attitude and hard work, she has been able to improve her livelihood.
Isabel has always been aware of her obligations and commitments. Today she thinks of herself as a successful micro-entrepreneur and she is always looking to progress.

loans.use: Fabric and supplies for dressmaking

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  “Las Esforzadas” se conforma por 21 socias, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Sus principales negocios son de almacenes de abarrotes, arriendo de disfraces, fotografías, artesanías en vidrio y cerámica, producción y venta de sillones, venta de pinches y frutos secos.

Marisol, quien es la secretaria de este grupo, se ubica en la foto en 1º fila, en 2º lugar de izquierda a derecha. Ella vende ropa de guagua, niño y adulto, por encargos en su casa y a domicilio, hace 4 años. Viaja a comprar su mercadería a Santiago (capital de Chile) 2 veces al mes. Tiene un hijo de 6 años. 

Con este préstamo comprará la ropa encargada y además ropa de temporada primavera – verano. 
Está contenta, debido a que a contar de fin de año arrendará 2 puestos en un centro comercial nuevo. En uno venderá ropa de niño y en el otro, ropa de adulto. Su sueño es seguir ampliando su negocio hasta llegar a no depender de los préstamos para crecer.  
Marisol ha sentido un gran apoyo y preocupación de parte de la asesora de Fondo Esperanza. Además agradece  los préstamos, los cuales le han servido para mantener y hacer crecer su negocio.
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la Región del Biobío, al sur de Chile.Es conocida como primer puerto militar, industrial y pesquero del país. Su nombre en mapudungun significa "Cielo Tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a dos puertos, la Base Naval, y un Barrio Industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc. 

La foto pequeña fue agregada porque la cara de una socia no se veía bien en la foto grupal.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Esforzadas" [Determined Women] is made up of 21 members belonging to the city of Talcahuano. Their primary businesses are grocery stores, costume rental, photography, glass and ceramic handicrafts, the production and sale of sofa chairs, hair accessory sales and dried fruit. 

Marisol, who is the group's secretary, is the located in the photo in the first row, second place from right to left. She sells clothing for babies, children and adults, by special order at her home and also by delivery which she has done for four years. She travels to purchase her merchandise in Santiago (capital of Chile) twice a month. She has a six-year-old son. 

With this loan she will purchase the clothing that has been ordered and additional clothing for the spring-summer season. She is happy because as of the end of the year she will be renting two posts in a new shopping center. At one she will sell children's clothing and at the other, clothing for adults. Her dream is to continue growing her business to the point at which she no longer needs the loans in order to grow. 

Marisol has felt tremendous support and caring on the part of the consultant from Fondo Esperanza. Furthermore she appreciates the loans which have allowed her to maintain and expand her business. 
 
Talcahuano is a municipality and port city of the Region of Biobío, in the southern part of Chile. It is known for being the country's first military, industrial and fishing port. Its name in mapudungun means "Thundering Sky". It is possessed of a very attractive natural landscape, owing to the combination of rivers, ocean, fertile plains and meadows and the mountains arrayed in beautiful vegetation. Its economy revolves around two ports, the Naval Base and an Industrial zone with iron and steel companies, petroleum refineries, petrochemical activity, cement, natural gas, etc. 

The small photo in the corner was added because one group member's face was not clearly visible in the group photo.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for the spring-summer season

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita resiD. en Santiago D. María, departamento D. Usulután,  tiene 48 años D. edad, es una comerciante D. verduras y frutas; vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. las edades D. 18 y 24 años.
Ella inicio el negocio desD. hace 12 años por iniciativa propia, atendiéndolo desD. las 7:30 D. la mañana hasta 4:30 D. la tarD. en el mercado municipal D. Santiago D. María. Margarita desea invertir en su negocio para ello solicita un préstamo que le ayuD. a obtener más verduras y frutas para la venta, como tomates, chiles, papas, cebollas, piñas, bananos, melones entre otros que le son demandados por los clientes. Con este préstamo fortalecerá el puesto D. venta atenderá mejor a las personas que transitan por el mercado en busca D. estos productos.
Su trabajo lo desea mejorar cada día, el servicio al cliente, el ofrecer productos frescos, para generar ingresos que le den estabilidad a su hogar y mejorar la condición D. vida con la que cuentan.
texts.en:
Margarita, 48, lives in Santiago D. María, Usulután department.  She is a fruit and vegetable merchant.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 18 and 24 years old.

She started the business on her own 12 years ago.  She is open for business from 7:30am until 4:30pm in Santiago D. María’s Municipal Market.  Margarita wants to invest in her business so is asking for a loan that will help her obtain more vegetables and fruit to sell like, tomatoes, chilies, potatoes, onion, pineapples, plantains and melons, among others, that her customers ask for.  The loan will strengthen her sales stand so that she can better tend to people who wander through the market in search of these products.

She wants to improve her business and customer service every day, offering fresh products to generate income that will proviD. stability to her home and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.   Jesca has a business of a food stall. She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days every week. Jesca sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Jesca has requested  for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cassava and yams. The main business challenges for Jesca include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to educate her children up to university and to buy a plot of land. Jesca lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of yams and cassava.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es: La Sra. Palmira vive en la localidad de el Torno, es nacida en la provincia Florida, de los valles cruceños, se dedica a la venta de patos, gallina, chancho, otros animales domésticos en el mercado de la comunidad, hace tres año que se dedica a esta actividad, vive en la casa de su hermana, ya que es separada de su esposo, no tiene hijos pequeño, el destino del crédito es para comprar animales, ya que se acerca las fiestas de fin de año y muchas personas compran pavos para la fiestas navideñas, también perritos y gatitos para regalar como mascotas,  esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Palmira lives in El Torno.  She was born in Florida province, in the Santa Cruz valley.  She sells ducks, chickens, pigs and other domestic animals in her community’s market.  She has been in this line of work for three years.  She lives in her sister’s house because she’s separated from her husband.  She does not have little children.

The loan will be used to buy animals because the end of year festivities are approaching and many people buy turkeys for Christmas as well as kittens and puppies to give away as pets.

She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy domestic animals.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school. Eunice has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Eunice sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Eunice has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cartons of salt and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Eunice include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to build her own business premises. Eunice lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Franciso is married and has four children, all attending school. He has a small convenience store in the San Rafael neighborhood. Sales have been increasing and generating a better income. Thanks to his wife and family, hard work and constant effort, they have been able to improve their livelihood. 
Francisco has a successful business with a good number of customers that come back because of his friendly attitude. As a microentrepreneur he's been successful because he's honest, responsible and honors his commitments.

loans.use: Milk products, rice, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se por la invitación de la Señora Juana C.  quien conocía el Programa Comité de Mujeres, y de esta forma se realizó la reunión donde decidieron  concretar el comité para  recibir capacitaciones y  los créditos.
El comité se Denomina “Amigas ”  están  en el Tercer  Ciclo   con 17  integrantes , el  grupo  se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas y responsables en la comunidad, ya que realizan obras de caridad y actividades para el fondo del grupo  ,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor y cuentan con un ingreso fijo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sergia quien se destaca por ser una señora muy emprenderá.
Ella hace poco decidió tomar un curso de manicura y pedicuro, para poder hacer servicios de belleza y por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de las herramientas que le hace falta para trabajar bien.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the invitation of Mrs. Juana C. who knew about the Women’s Committee Program and organized a get-together where they decided to form a committee in order to receive training and loans.

The committee is called “Amigas” (Friends) and is in its third cycle with 17 members.  The group stands out in the neighborhood for being very unified and responsible in the community in that they undertake charitable events and activities to raise funds for the group.  They are involved in a variety of activities while some are starting off in new work directions and have steady income.

One of the members is Sergia who is noted for being very enterprising.  A short while ago she took a manicure and pedicure course to provide beauty services and is asking for a loan to buy the tools she needs to work properly.

loans.use: To buy manicure and pedicure tools and supplies.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María es una comerciante de frutas, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas; La venta de frutas está ubicada frente al mercado municipal de El Transito y lleva dedicándose a este negocio desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, las frutas que ella ofrece a las personas que circulan por esta zona son mangos, jocotes, sandias, pepino y aquellas que son de temporada.
Ella quiere invertir en su negocio comprando aquellas frutas de más duración adquiriéndolas por una mayor cantidad y se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para esta inversión; este préstamo ayudara a su crecimiento con el negocio y posiblemente aumente las ventas.
Su Objetivo es crecer como comerciante y generar los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de sus hijas y su esposo.
texts.en:
Luz María is a fruit merchant.  She lives in El Transito, San Miguel department.  She’s 28 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters.  Her fruit stand is located in front of the El Transito Municipal Market.  She has been in this business for about 5 years.  The fruit she sells to people passing by are: mangoes, jocote (a tropical fruit known as Red Mombin, Purple Mombin, Hog Plum, and Sineguela), watermelon, cucumber and whatever is in season.

She wants to invest in her business buying at wholesale fruits that last longer.  She needs to request a loan for this investment.  The loan will help her business grow and possibly lead to increased sales.

Her goal is to grow as a merchant and generate the necessary income for her husband’s and daughters’ wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet M. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  Harriet has a business of selling new clothes. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothes. She also generates additional income by selling charcoal and tomatoes.

The main business challenges for Harriet  include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to buy a plot of land. Harriet lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of new clothes.

loans.name: Hope Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en: J. Jude belongs to Hope Development Group-Mpigi. He is 34 years old. It is now close to 7 years since he began his clothing sales business in the town of Mpigi. He sells mostly ladies clothes and he rationalizes that women are people of flamboyance and sassiness who always want to look good.  He therefore thinks that selling ladies clothes would fetch him more money. Jude supplements his boutique profits with money from working at a petrol station. Jude is married with 3 kids. With this loan, he says he is going to re-energize his business by making bulk purchases of new ladies clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to resell

loans.name: Ingrid Nelly

texts.es: La Sra. Ingrid Vive en la localidad de Torno, es nacida en el departamento de Potosí Patrimonio De la Humanidad por su Historia,  considerada la capital minera de Bolivia, su actividad es la venta de frutas de temporada, hace 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para la compra de frutillas que es una fruta muy requerida, vive en la casa de sus padres,  su esposo es mecánico, en una empresa, tienen cuatro hijos en edad escolar, es muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ingrid lives in Torno.  She was born in Potosí, considered to be Bolivia’s mining capital, and a Patrimony of Humanity for its history.

She sells seasonal fruit.  She’s been in this line of work for 18 months.  She will use the loan to buy strawberries which is a fruit in high demand.

She lives in the home of her parents.  Her husband is a mechanic in a firm and they have four school aged children.  

She is very hard working and is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy strawberries.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Mr. Eligio has a convenience store in the Santa Ana neighborhood. Through several years he's built a good customer base and a stable income. 

Thanks to his family's support and teamwork they have been able to progress and make the business grow. 

As a client with Fundacion Paraguaya, Mr. Eligio has demonstrated to be an honest, responsible person and worthy of support.

loans.use: Bread, coffee, milk products, pasta, flour.

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora, es una comerciante, tiene 42 años, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos David de 16 años y Vanessa de 14 años de edad. Ella tiene un puesto de venta de pupusas en el parqueo municipal donde se reúnen todas las líneas de autobuses de los municipios cercanos, lugar estratégico para realizar la venta de estos alimentos ya que es el plato típico de El Salvador y todas las personas las consumen. 
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Chicharrón, quesillo y bebidas, esta inversión la hará con la intención de preparar más pupusas y atender  toda la demanda de los clientes.
Su Propósito es mantener este negocio por muchos años para ayudar con los ingresos que recibe a sus hijos y estos puedan desarrollarse.
texts.en: Dora is a storekeeper. She's 42-years-old and lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband and two children, David (16-years-old), and Vanessa (14-years-old). She has a pupusa (Central American pastry filled with meat) stand in the municipal parking lot, where all the bus lines from the surrounding towns converge. This is a strategic place to sell food because it's the typical dish of El Salvador and everyone eats it. She needs a loan to buy corn, meat, cheese, and drinks. She'll use the money to make more pupusas to meet the demand of her customers. Her goal is to maintain this business for many years to help with her family's income and to help her children develop.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, meat, cheese, and, and drinks

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
In 2007, when Leslie C.’s father died, Leslie took a leave of absence from his job at a freight company in Abilene, Texas. When he returned ready to work, they had replaced him. It was then that Leslie decided to start his own business, Ridgewood Transport, which transports “anything but people and hazardous materials”. He bought a diesel truck and a trailer and started transporting alfalfa hay and other agricultural products. He has since moved to the commercial sector, bought another truck and hired two employees. 

Leslie was at a sink-or-swim point when he asked ACCION Texas-Louisiana for a microloan. Leslie was voluntarily transporting donated aid supplies from his church to Venice, Florida, destined for Haiti, when his main truck’s engine blew out on the return trip. Leslie’s brother transported him and his truck back to Abilene. Leslie plans to use this loan to fix his truck and also have additional cushioning in his bank account to pay for gas. Many times, the companies he transports for do not pay him until weeks after the completed transport, so Leslie has to front the gas payments. 

Leslie loves his business because he gets to travel and see new places all the time. Leslie says, “In one week I can go fly-fishing in Colorado and deep-sea fishing in Victoria, Texas”. His ultimate goal is to buy a piece of property in Colorado where he can take groups of people fly-fishing in the summer time and hunting in the winter time. Furthermore, with one child as a sophomore at Texas Tech and the other a senior in high school, Leslie’s goal is to put both of them through college. 

Leslie says, "Organizations like ACCION can help people like me who do not have a credit history. I've always believed that if you don't have the money for it, you don't need it.  But that's not always the smartest thinking when you have a business. A microloan is a great and only option for folks like me."

loans.use: New engine and other repairs

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La  señora Epifania es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijas mayores de las cuales 2 están trabando en España y una de ellas es la que le ayuda en su negocio.
           Epifania  se dedica a la venta de  frazadas sabanas, toallas en un puesto que tiene en el micro centro
       Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería   poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años.
            Hoy día ella tiene muchas mercaderías  bien surtidas ella tiene una clientela  bien formada.
                 Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frazadas.
texts.en:
Epifania is a single mother of three adult daughters two of whom are working in Spain and one who helps her with her business.

Epifania sells blankets, sheets and towels in a stall she has at the Micro Centro.

She started her business several years ago with very little merchandise but gradually increased her stock as time went by.

Today she has lots of well stocked merchandise and a well established customer base.

She is a very responsible person who very much wants to get ahead in life.  She has a cheerful, enterprising disposition and there is no doubt that she will reach all the goals she has set for herself.

She is asking for funds to buy blankets.

loans.use: To buy blankets.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. 

Ruth has a business of selling yellow bananas. She has been in this business for seven years and she works seven days out of every week. Ruth sells her products at the market on a retail basis.    

Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of yellow bananas. The main business challenges for Ruth include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers directly.   .   

Ruth lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria reside en vivienda alquilada en la zona de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y  tiene una hija en 6 años; ella es empelada de limpieza en una vivienda particular así como tambien se dedica a la recolección de material para reciclaje, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia; el crédito que saco anteriormente fue para el capital que le permitiera trabajar con reciclados, es cliente de Impro con 5 créditos. La señora se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que le otorgamos.

El crédito que ahora solicita es para un contrato de anticrético de dos habitaciones para tener mayor comodidad y ahorrar un poco de dinero para en el futuro tener un anticrético de tres o más habitaciones o un dinero guardado para emergencias.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
María lives in a rented house in the Las Lomas sector in the west side of La Paz.  She is single and has a 6 year old daughter.  She is employed as a cleaning lady in a private home but she also collects recyclables.  Income from these activities is used to support her family.

The loan she got previously was for capital to make it possible for her to work with recyclable items.  She has had 5 Impro loans and she is very satisfied with the loans we provide.

The loan she’s asking for now is for a two-bedroom anticrético contract in order to live more comfortably and save some money in order to have a three or more bedroom anticrético in the future as well as savings for emergencies. (Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you)

Her credit history qualifies her for a new loan because she’s considered to be a good client.

loans.use: For cost of a two-bedroom “anticrético” contract. (Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you)

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
R. B. is in his late thirties. He is married and has four children. Two years ago, R. began making pool tables. He also buys and sells pool tables that are already made. He operates his business from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily. His business earns him a good monthly profit.

This will be R.'s third Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. R.'s previous loans, which he has since repaid, were used to increase his inventory of materials to be used for building the pool tables. He plans to use this loan to increase his business capital.

R. will share this loan with his loan group, Muheza, which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, R. is first on the right, standing in the back row.

loans.use: To increase capital for pool-table manufacturing business

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco, reside en el Municipio de Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 34 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa, siembra de hortalizas y además cría cerdos para comercializarlos. Él vive con su esposa y sus hijos, Josué Edenilson de 9 años, Fátima de 6 años y Juan Osmin de 5 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en la escuela; Marco dice que su labor comienza muy temprano cuando sale de su casa a vender la ropa de forma ambulante recorriendo varios kilómetros de Corinto ofreciendo la mercadería y por la tarde cuando regresa a su hogar le dedica tiempo a las actividades agropecuarias.
El solicita un préstamo del cual desea invertir un 50% en siembra de hortalizas y el otro 50% en compra de mercadería, específicamente en ropa, con esta inversión él espera atender de una mejor manera la demanda de sus clientes y con la siembra espera tener lista la cosecha para diciembre y comercializarla en el mercado municipal, esperando que le resulten los planes que tiene para poder generar mayores ingresos a su familia.
Marco tiene la esperanza de seguir contando con esta ayuda para continuar progresando con sus negocios y así contribuir al bienestar de su familia mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco, 34, lives in Corinto, Morazán department.  He sells clothes and farms vegetables.  He also raises pigs to sell. He lives with his wife and children: Josué Edenilson, 9, Fátima, 6 and Juan Osmin, 5. The two eldest are in school.

Marco says that his work day starts very early in the morning when he leaves home to sell clothes throughout Corinto’s many kilometers of streets.  When he returns home he spends the afternoons in his farming activities.

He is asking for a loan that will be used 50% in the vegetable crops and 50% to buy merchandise, specifically clothes.  He hopes this investment will help him better meet customer demand and that he will have his crops ready to harvest in December to sell in the municipal market.  He hopes his plans pan out so that he can earn higher income for his family.

Marco hopes to continue relying on this help in order to continue progressing with his businesses thus contributing to his family’s wellbeing improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and supplies for vegetable farming.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. 

Susan has a beauty-salon business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Susan sells her products in a shop on a retail basis.    

Susan has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream, braids and weaves. She also generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle.

The main business challenges for Susan include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a bridal salon. She also would like to build her own house.  

Susan lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar has been a client of Fundacion Paraguaya for a few years and lives in Ciudad del Este with his wife Margarita, they have two children. 
He’s in the business of buying and selling grains like corn and beans; he has built a good customer base that is distributed around the city. He is an honest and entrepreneurial person with excellent work ethics. 
As a client of Fundacion Paraguaya, Cesar has no late payments; in addition, he has excellent commercial references. 
He thanks Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunities he’s had and looks forward to keep on growing his business.
texts.en:
Cesar has been a client of Fundacion Paraguaya for a few years and lives in Ciudad del Este with his wife Margarita, they have two children. 
He’s in the business of buying and selling grains like corn and beans; he has built a good customer base that is distributed around the city. He is an honest and entrepreneurial person with excellent work ethics. 
As a client of Fundacion Paraguaya, Cesar has no late payments; in addition, he has excellent commercial references. 
He thanks Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunities he’s had and looks forward to keep on growing his business.

loans.use: Corn, beans and other grains

loans.name: Alva Luz

texts.es:
Alva Luz, tiene 35 años, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y medicina, reside en el Cantón El Aceituno del municipio de Yoloaiquin, en Morazán donde vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad.
Alva atiende la pupuseria desde hace más de un año y además se dedica a la venta de medicina la cual realiza desde hace cinco meses, atendiendo ambos negocios por la necesidad económica que enfrenta junto a su familia; Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la preparación de las pupusas como chicharrón, maíz, quesillo y aceite, además comprara medicinas para abastecer a sus clientes.
Este préstamo ayudara a fortalecer sus negocios y a que tenga mejores oportunidades de obtener ingresos que tanto necesita para su hogar.
Ella quiere continuar con sus negocios y que estos le den la estabilidad económica para sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios y estos puedan optar por un futuro diferente.
texts.en:
Alva Luz, 35, makes a living selling "pupusas" (a maize-based tortilla) and medicines.  She lives in Morazan with her husband and their two children who are 8- and 3-years old, respectively.  
Alva has operated her "pupuseria" (a shop that specializes in sales of pupusas) for more than a year.  Five months ago, she started selling medicines, too, tending both businesses because she needed the extra income to support her family.  She is applying for a loan to buy supplies for making pupusas: crackling, maize, cheese and cooking oil.  She will also buy medicines that she will stock for her customers.
Alva will use this loan to make her business stronger and, in turn, improve her income, something that she needs to better support her family.
Alva wants to continue operating the business and create the economic stablity that she needs to help her children go to school.  She wants them to have the change for a better future.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Blanca Janeth

texts.es:
Blanca Janeth E. L. tiene 30 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 16, 11, y 2 anos. 
  
Blanca es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas en Babahoyo. Vende cada 6 meses después de la cosecha. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maiz y cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito, podría mejorar más sus cultivos. Su sueno es que sus hijos estudien o hacen algo en la vida. Dice que este ano ha sido más o menos con sus cultivos, y espera que la próxima cosecha sea mejor. 

Le gusta leer en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Blanca Janeth E. L., 30, lives in the Ecuadorean town of Chillanes.  She is married and has 3 children who are 13-, 11- and 2-years old.

Blanca is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos ("The Comfort of Having Friends") community bank, located about 20 minutes from San Jose del Tambo.  The group has 15 members, most of whom make a living growing cocoa or operating small businesses.

Blanca is a farmer.  She grows maize and cocoa.  She buys and sells in Babahoyo.  She sells every 6 months, after a harvest.  She will use this loan to buy seeds for growing maize and cocoa.  The loan will make it possible for her to improve her yields.  Her greatest hope is that her children can study and make something of their lives.  She says that her crop yields this year have been so-so and she hopes the next crop will be better.

Blanca likes to read in her spare time.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Galilaya Group

texts.en: Beatrice J. is in her late thirties and is married with one daughter. Five years ago, she opened her own beauty salon. She also sells kanga (sarongs) and kitenge (fabrics) that are used as women's clothing. Her business is open daily between 8:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m. and earns Beatrice a good monthly profit. This will be Beatrice's first loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Beatrice aims to increase her inventory of kanga and kitenge, as well as buy equipment for her beauty salon. Beatrice will share this loan with her loan group, Galilaya, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the picture, Beatrice can be seen in the second row, first on the right.

loans.use: To increase inventory of kanga and kitenge (sarongs and fabrics)

loans.name: Vilma Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, es una señora trabajadora con deseos D. progresar cada día, tiene 64 años y resiD. en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, vive junto a su esposo don Félix Vásquez y tienen dos hijas Yanira D. 30 años y Flor D. María D. 21 años D. edad.
Doña Vilma se dedica a la venta D. ropa y floristería desD. hace 2 años atendiendo su negocio todos los días ocho horas diarias, la floristería la aprendió en unas clases impartidas cerca D. su casa, ella necesita un préstamo pues quiere invertir en la compra D. prendas D. vestir y  en materiales para la elaboración D. flores pero esta inversión solo la pueD. hacer por la obtención del préstamo ya que su intención es proporcionar a sus clientes una diversidad D. artículos y D. esta manera que sus ingresos aumenten.
Diversificar el negocio es el principal objetivo D. esta señora pues así atraerá a los clientes y aumentaran las ventas significando un progreso para este hogar.
texts.en:
Dona Vilma is a woman who works hard every day to get ahead.  She is 64 years old and lives in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Morazan with her husband, Don Felix V..  They have two daughters: Yanira, 30, and Flor D. Maria, 21.  
Dona Vilma has maD. a living selling clothing and flowers for 2 years.  She tends the business eight hours a day, every day.  She took classes to become a florist.  She needs a loan now because she wants to buy articles of clothing for her clothing business and supplies for her florist business.  This investment is only a begining, though, because her intention is to proviD. a range of products to her customers so that she can maximize her earnings.  
Dona Vilma's first goal is to diversify her business so that she can attract more customers and increase her sales, a process that will lead to helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for clothing business.

loans.name: Ancelo Abel

texts.es:
Ancelo Abel B. D. tiene 23 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene una hija de 10 anos. 

Ancelo es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.
  
Ancelo se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz y maracuya. Vende sus productos en Mata de Cacao y vende sus maracuyas en Matilde. Solicita el crédito para aumentar lo que tiene sembrado, y posiblemente criar pollos. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría seguir adelante y hacer algo nuevo como criar pollos. Su sueno es seguir cultivando su terreno. 

Se dedica a trabajar todos los días, así que no tiene mucho tiempo libre
texts.en:
Ancelo Abel B. D. is 23 years old, and lives with his companion in the Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.  He has a 10-year-old daughter.

Ancelo is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos rural bank (the pleasure of friendship), located 20 minutes from the San Jose del Tambo parish.  There are 15 members in all, and most of them grow cacao or have their own small businesses.

Ancelo works in agriculture, growing corn and passion fruit.  He sells his products in Mata de Cacao, and sells his passion fruit in Matilde.  He requests this loan in order to expand his crop, and possibly raise chickens.  The loan will allow him to get ahead and do something new such as raising chickens.  His dream is to continue to farm his land.

He works every day, and thus has little free time.

loans.use: aumentar lo que tiene sembrado

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah N. lives in the Naguru neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 5 children, five of whom are in school.   She lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.  

Robinah has a business selling sweet and Irish potatoes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and works 6 days a week. Her main business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She sells her products as a retailer at the market.  She also generates additional income through tailoring, when the need arises.  

Robinah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes.  Her goal for her business is to start selling wholesale only. She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest they charge.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ndiomdy Ngor Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NDIOMDY NGOR N. est créé le 15 octobre 2010. Il est composé de 45 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Ces femmes se sont organisées par liens de parenté et de voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame FATOU GNILANE D. levant la main et mise en médaillon, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a la responsabilité de ses deux neveux.

Elle fait du petit commerce de denrées alimentaires (oignons, tomates, riz etc.)

Et avec son nouveau crédit de 50.000 francs CFA elle va elle va mieux organiser son petit commerce afin de pouvoir l'étendre et accroitre ses bénéfices.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettra de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ndiomdy Ngor N. solidarity group was created on 15th October 2010. It is made up of 45 women who all come from the same village, and who know each other through relatives and neighbors. Their principal activity is small business.  

Mrs. Fatou Gnilane D., who is raising her hand and is also in the inset picture, is in charge of the group. She is 54 years old, married and mother to two children. She also has responsibility for her two nephews.

She has a small food products business (onions, tomatoes, rice, etc.). With her new loan of 50,000CFA she will be able to organise her small business better in order to increase her profits. The profits generated by her business will allow her to help her husband to take care of the family.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es:
Doña Silvia tiene 44 años D. edad y resiD. en el Departamento D. Usulután junto a su familia y sus hijos tienen las edades entre 17 y 25 años, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas y meriendas desD. hace 12 años sus hijas le ayudan a atender el negocio ya que lo hacen en un horario D. 10:00am a 4:30 pm; según cuenta la señora tiene bastante demanda y desea reforzar el negocio comprado mercadería por lo que hoy solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la inversión y aumentar su producción .
Su objetivo es tener un buen record crediticio para contar con esta ayuda e ir progresando con el negocio y mejorando su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Silvia, 44, lives in Usulután department with her family.  Her children are between 17 and 25 years old.  

She has sold tortillas and lunches for 12 years.  Her daughters help her tend to the business which is in operation from 10am until 4:30pm.  According to what she tell us, demand is high and she wants to strengthen the business buying merchandise for which she is asking for funds that will make this investment possible thus increasing production.

Her goal is to attain a good credit history so that she can count on this support and make progress with the business thus helping to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Julio Fernando

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 23 años, se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután donde vive junto con su familia y tiene 8 años de tener este negocio el cual lo heredo de su tío quien le apoyo mucho,  el horario de atención  es de 7:30 am a 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y los domingos atiende hasta las 12 md.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, adquiriendo con este dinero accesorios para celulares y para repararlos, también le ayudara a ofrecer variedad de artículos a los clientes.
Sus proyecciones con el préstamo es ser un cliente con buena calificación por pagos puntuales y con respecto al negocio progresar cada día estabilizando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio, 23, is a young man who repairs and sells cell phones.  He lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department with his family.  He has had the business for 8 years.  He inherited it from his uncle who was a great support to him.  He is open for business from 7:30am until 5:30pm, Monday through Saturday and until noon on Sunday.

He is asking for funds to buy merchandise for the business.  He will use the loan to buy cell phone accessories and for their repair.  It will also help him offer his customers a wider variety of items.

His aim with respect to the loan is to become a client with good ratings because of punctual repayments and with respect to his business to progress daily thus stabilizing his income.

loans.use: To buy cell phone repair parts.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. lives in the Busega neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.  

Justine runs a wholesale shop.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days a week.  She sells her products at the market. Her main business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  

Justine has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  Her goals for her business are to start buying directly from manufuctures, and to own a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy  more merchandise like bags of suagr, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Piiva J. is in his early 30s and is married with one child.  He opened his own spare parts shop a year ago. The shop is open daily from 6 am to 8 pm. Piiva earns a stable monthly profit from this business. This will be his first loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  Piiva aims to increase his spare parts inventory with this loan. 

Piiva will share this loan with his loan group Mbinga, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the picture, Piiva can be seen standing, third from the right.

loans.use: To increase spare parts inventory

loans.name: Jehova Jerex Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehova Jerex es un grupo conformado por Lorena del Carmen S. de 54 años desde hace 6 años realiza cobertores, bolsos y vende CD. Ella con el crédito comprara telas, hilos, cartón etc. para la realización de togas, uniformes etc. para las promociones.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ivania Leticia M. quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita como enchiladas, tajadas con queso, carne asada, cerdo etc. desde hace 5 años y María Jesustina Torre tiene una comideria desde hace 20 años e invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, carne, verduras etc.
texts.en:
Lorena del Carmen S., 54, is a member of the Jehova Jerex group.  For the past six years she has made bedspreads and purses and also sells CDs.  She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, cardboard, etc. to make gowns, uniforms, etc. for graduations.

The other group members are:  Ivania Leticia M., who has a popular fast food restaurant where she has sold a variety of fast food items for the last five years and María Jesustina Torre who has had an eatery for 20 years and will use the loan for basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: For fabric, threat, etc. to make graduation gowns and uniforms.

loans.name: Ko'e Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Ko`e Rory, aludiendo a un mañana mejor. 
Están en el Séptimo Ciclo, cuenta con 11  integrantes. Es  un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy ejemplar, solidario y responsable. 
Realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el comité, para caso de necesidad. 
Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden mostrar un buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
 Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muhas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
Una de las integrantes quien solicitó un préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras ya que quiere abastecer su puesto de venta.
Ella trabaja con la venta de sus mercaderías  y de esta manera ayuda a su familia especialmente para la alimentación de los mismos.
Comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con su grupo y desea seguir trabajando con el mismo y de esa manera continuar trabajando mejorando cada dia.
texts.en:
The committee is called Ko`e Rory, alluding to a better morning.

They are in their 7th cycle and have 11 members.  The group stands out in the neighborhood for being exemplary, mutually supportive and responsible.

They conduct fund raising activities both to raise funds for the committee and in cases of need.

The members have great enterprising spirit because they are up to date with their payments and they intend to show good behavior and responsibility toward the institution.

Getting the loan opens many doors for the progress of their various enterprises..

One of the members asked for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables to stock her sales stand.

She sells this merchandise to help her family especially for their own nutrition.

She comments that she is very satisfied with her group and wants to continue working with it thus improving each day.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables like: apples, oranges, pears, watermelon, pineapple, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and others.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años de edad, reside en Ozatlan departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia, su madre de 67 años, un hermano de 30 años; María es madre soltera y su hijo tiene 5 años, Ella tiene una tienda donde ofrece a los clientes productos de la canasta básica, el horario de atención es de 7:00am a 8:30pm con la ayuda de su hermano, este negocio fue iniciativa propia, viendo la manera de tener ingresos para su hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para reforzar el negocio y abastecerlo de productos como Jugos, Gaseosa, Leche, boquitas, Agua entre otros que son buscados por los clientes, con este préstamo podrá salir de esta situación ya que con la inversión espera que la tienda progrese y tenga una mejor atención y servicio contando con la preferencia de sus amigos y vecinos quienes forman parte de los clientes, así como aquellas personas que transitan por el lugar.
Su sueño es mejorar los ingresos de su familia a través del negocio, darles una condición de vida diferente y como madre quiere educar a su hijo y sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
María, 33, lives in Ozatlan, Usulután department with her family consisting of her mother, 67, and a brother, 30.  She is a single mother of a 5 year old son.

She has a store where she stocks basic household items.  With help from her brother she is open for business from 7am until 8:30pm.  She started the business on her own initiative as a way to have income for her home.

She is asking for a loan to strengthen the business stocking it with products like: juices, soft drinks, milk, snacks and water among others, which are requested by her customers.  The loan will help her get out of this situation because she hopes the investment will help her store to make progress and have better customer service for her friends and neighbors who constitute her core customer base as well as passersby.

Her dream is to improve family income through the store, to provide a different living condition and, as a mother, she wants to educate and successfully raise her son.

loans.use: To buy juices, milk, soft drinks, snacks and bottled water.

loans.name: Rwamugoma Women's, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
In a month, T. John says he makes 200,000 Ugandan shillings; a figure he admits will not substantively make his business see the light in the near future. He is therefore seeking a loan to provide capital for his business so that he is able to restock for his shop and look towards substantial growth. John, who is 64 years-old, has been operating a general merchandise shop from his home area of Rwamacengye, Rukungiri for over 20 years selling agricultural produce to the local population.

Alongside this business he grows bananas, coffee, tomatoes and onions which all help him earn revenue. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to help him purchase more goods for his shop so that he will be able to make more sales.

John belongs to Rwamugoma Women's, Rukungiri.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his business.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Ashura A. is in her early sixties and is widowed with two children. Six years ago she began selling firewood. She also sells coconuts which are used for making cooking oil. Her business is open daily between 7 am and 8 pm and earns Ashura a stable profit. 

This will be her first loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  Ashura aims to increase her business capital with this loan.  Her dream is to one day buy land. 

Ashura will share this loan with her loan group Ununio, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the picture, Ashura can be seen seated, second from the right wearing a blue top and red bottom.

loans.use: To increase the business's capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Strengthen his working capital

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es:
Josué Manuel, es un joven de 19 años, soltero y vive con su madre, juntos poseen una tienda, residen el San Rafael Oriente, departamento de Usulután; Esta tienda se origino hace mas de 15 años siendo fundada por su madre pero hace 3 años paso a ser administrada por él, quien tiene experiencia en el negocio pues creció atendiendo a los clientes y ayudando a su mama con las ventas.
Él quiere invertir en la tienda pues quiere ir progresando y aumentando sus ingresos por este motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos que pondrá a disposición de los clientes el propósito de Josué Manuel es proveer para los clientes todo lo necesario para el hogar y aprovecha para fortalecer su negocio beneficiándose con más ingresos y ventas.
Las aspiraciones de él es darle al negocio una mayor estabilidad y generar los ingresos suficientes para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la casa, así como en un momento ella lo realizo.
texts.en:
Josué Manuel is a young man. He is 19 years old, single, and lives with his mother. They own a store together. The live in San Rafael Oriente, in the Usulután department. This store opened more than 15 years ago and was funded by his mother. 3 years ago, he started to manage the store since he has experience in the business. He grew up working with customers and helping his mom with sales.
He wants to invest in the store because he wants to make progress and increase his sales. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy products that that will be available to his customers.
Josué Manuel’s plans are to provide his customers with everything they need for the home and to take the opportunity to strengthen the business through more profits and sales. His wishes are to give the business greater stability and to generate enough income to help his mother with the household expenses, like she did at one time.

loans.use: to buy basic food basket products

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Setuka Wobadde Development-Mityana Group

texts.en:
Accepting advice from close family and friends can at times be tantamount to increasing one’s abilities in any given situation. From the point of view of a business, it is most especially of paramount importance when a crisis strikes or when the status quo is not up to the required mark.

For K. Eron, it’s mostly advice from her parents that put that spring in her early stride 30 years-ago as she took root in her coffee and banana selling business in Mityana market. With this kind of longevity, one would not be wrong to accord her respect. 100,000 shillings is what she makes in a week from of her business and with this loan she reckons she will be able to buy more coffee and bananas to sell. She also says she will use some of the proceeds to venture into pig husbandry. Her group is Setuka Wobadde.

loans.use: To purchase coffee and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is 29 years old, married, and blessed with a three-year-old child. For twelve years, he has been in the business of selling gas cylinders. Prior to that he was selling second-hand clothes.  Besides selling gas-cylinders, he operates a food kiosk. He has been able to run his business well, and thanks Faulu Kenya for training him in good customer care and business management.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to increase his stock of gas cylinders.

loans.use: to increase his stock of gas cylinders

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta es una comerciante y se dedica a la venta de Pupusas, bebidas y tortillas, tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután y vive con su familia quienes son su apoyo en el negocio, lo inicio hace 5 años atendiéndolo desde las 11am hasta 8pm, ella cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas para atender el negocio, siendo este el que genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Ella quiere invertir y comprar mercadería (alimentos, maíz y bebidas) para ofrecer a los clientes viendo la forma de crecer con el negocio, por tal situación solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo esta inversión. 
Su propósito con este préstamo es cancelarlo bien, ser cliente clase A y a la vez que su negocio sea prospero para tener una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Marta is a storekeeper and she sells pupusas, drinks and tortillas. She is 37 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. She lives with her family who help her with her business. She started 5 years ago and works from 11 am to 8pm. She relies on help from her daughters to manage the store. This way, they can generate money for the household expenses.

She wants to invest in and buy merchandise (food, corn and drinks) to offer to her customers in order to grow her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to carry out this investment.

With this loan, her goals are to pay it off, to be a first class client and to have a prosperous business so she can have a better economic situation.

loans.use: To buy foods, corn and drinks

loans.name: Toribio Marcial

texts.es: Toribio tiene 45 años, es una persona muy luchadora y se destaca por proporcionar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos por lo que ha sido muy gratificante para él y su negocio. El se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado mejorar su actividad. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado de la terminal en donde transitan diferentes clientes diariamente. Con este crédito comprar bananos, tomates, cebollas y naranjas.
texts.en: Toribio is 45 years old. He is a very motivated person and he stands out for offering a great service to his customers. This is not the first time he has requested a loan. They have been very rewarding for himself and his business. He has sold fruits and vegetables for more than 7 years. With lots of effort and sacrifices, he has been able to improve his business. His business is located in the terminal market where many different customers travel daily. With this loan, he will buy bananas, tomatoes, onions and oranges.

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, D. 46 años, es una mujer que le gusta progresar y triunfar; está casada con Alipio, D. 63 años; ambos tienen 2 hijos, pero viven solos en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural D. Yanapuquio. La agricultura es su principal actividad; con la ayuda D. su esposo siembra, papa; producto bandera D. Julia, ya que su localidad es la principal capital semillero D. papa del Perú, ya tiene 20 años D. experiencia y sus ganancias le permitieron encaminarlos y educarlos. Actualmente posee terrenos D. cultivo, ahí siembra a gran escala las diferentes variedades D. papa y los venD. en el mercado mayorista D. su ciudad. Sin embargo ella está pensando adquirir un camión con el que pueda trasladar sus sacos D. papa; con la ayuda D. su banco comunal ya está logrando ahorrar, por lo que le falta poco, menciona. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y está contenta D. su progreso. Agradece a las personas que intervienen con este aporte para que pueda invertir y desarrollar su negocio.Con el crédito que obtendrá; comprará varias bolsas D. abono orgánico que piensa esparcirlos en sus sembríos D. papa.
texts.en: Julia is 46 years old and is a woman who likes to move forward and succeed.  She is married to 63-year-old Alipio and they both have two children, but they live alone in their own house located in the rural area of Yanapuquio.  Farming is her main business and she grows potatoes with the help of her husband.  They are Julia’s flagship product since her area is the primary potato seedbed in Peru.  She already has 20 years of experience and her earnings allow her to point their children in the right direction and educate them.  She currently owns croplands and she plants large quantities of different varieties of potato there and sells them at her city’s wholesale market.  However, Julia is planning to get a truck which she can use to transport her potato sacks.  With the help of her communal bank, she is already saving and only has a little left to go, she says.  This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is pleased with her progress.  She is grateful for the people who contribute so that she can invest in and develop her business.  With the loan obtained, she will purchase several bags of organic manure that she plans to spread on her potato crops.

loans.use: To purchase bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 44, wants a loan to pay school fees for his son. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a permanent house in which he lives with his wife and seven children. He operates a retail shop in which he sells sugar, soap, cooking oil and other domestic items. He dreams of turning the retail shop into a wholesale shop and educating his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his son.

loans.name: Bwavu Mpologoma Men And Women's Group 2-Kayunga

texts.en:
S. Stephen is married with three children. He is 42 years-old and cash crop selling has been his predominant source of livelihood for the last five years in Ntenjeru-Kayunga. 

Mostly, he sells coffee, maize and beans at a neighborhood market stall. He also does some crop growing and animal husbandry. Crop growing was his first major business preoccupation. In a month, his cash crop selling business generates about shillings 240,000. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more bags of agricultural produce particularly coffee to sell. Stephen belongs to Bwavu Mpologoma men and women group-Kayunga.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products such as coffee to sell.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes, de 31 años, pertenece al banco comunal “zona semillero”, que junto a su esposa Elsa, de 29 años, trabajan y progresan juntos; ambos tienen un hijo, Ángelo de 11 años, al que cuidan y crían en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Yanapuquio. La principal actividad de ellos es la agricultura, junto a su esposa, siembran en sus terrenos agrícolas “papa”; ya tienen 9 años dedicándose a ello, lo que más les gusta es poder verlos crecer fuertes y nutritivos, ya que sus ganancias depende mucho de la calidad de sus cosechas. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Diomedes; como buen trabajador, él cría una variedad de carneros, a los que alimenta, para luego vender su carme en el mercado central de su ciudad, en donde también aprovecha para vender su cosecha de papa. Ahora con el apoyo de su banco comunal, está pensando abrir una pequeña tienda de ropa en una de las principales localidades de su ciudad; asimismo ya está juntando dinero para poder mejorar su casa. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y le gustan las reuniones que constantemente realiza con su banco comunal, donde puede intercambiar experiencias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará guano; con ello podrá asegurar la calidad de sus cosechas.
texts.en: 31 year old Diomedes belongs to the community bank "Zona Semillero". He works and progresses alongside his 29 year old wife, Elsa. Together, they have 1 son, 11 year old Ángelo, who they are bringing up in their own home, located in the rural zone of Yanapuquio. Their principal activity is agriculture. Together with his wife, he grows potatoes in their fields. They have been doing this for 9 years already. What they most like is to see their crops growing to be strong and nutritious, as their income depends heavily on the quality of their harvests. But Diomedes does not only grow potatoes. As he is a hardworker, he also raises a variety of sheep which he feeds and then later sells the meat in the central marked of his city (where he also sells his potato harvest.) Now, with the support of his community bank, he is thinking of opening a little clothes store in one of the main centers of the city. He is also raising money in order to improve his home.  This is his forth loan from MFP, and he likes the frequent meetings that the bank has where he can exchange experiences. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer to ensure a good quality harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the quality of his potato harvest

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a member of the Urafiki Makadara group in Faulu Kenya. He is a businessman who sells paraffin and mobile-phone airtime cards. He also runs a nursery school.  He says his business location is very good because of the high number of customers. He started the business six years ago and he is determined to succeed despite all the challenges.  

He hopes to expand the nursery school to accommodate a primary school. He has developed a lot of discipline in saving his money and repaying loans.  For this reason, he has been allowed to take out a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to add benches and tables in the nursery school.

loans.use: To add benches and tables in the nursery school

loans.name: Bwavu Mpologoma Men And Women's Group 1-Kayunga

texts.en:
By hook or by crook, 52 year-old N. Dumba who is affiliated with the Bwavu Mpologoma group 1-Kayunga took it upon herself to begin her poultry and livestock business in Tente-Kayunga. This business has been in existence since 2003.  It is a business she began with a micro loan. Before that, this mother of six, who is happily married, milled maize. 100,000 shillings is what she makes in a week.  N. principally sells eggs and milk. She also has a boda boda or commercial motorcycle business that she relies on to bring her supplementary profits. With this loan, N. says she is going to buy more chicken feed for her poultry.

N. belongs to Bwavu Mpologoma men and women group of Kayunga.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 34-year-old member of Elshadai group in Faulu Kenya.  She sells second-hand clothes for a living.  She was previously operating a butcher shop.  She has been in this business for three years and has managed to employ one person.  She has gained business knowledge from Faulu Kenya and this has helped her to grow her business. Jane has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: La Rutina Group

texts.es:
El grupo rutina está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Elizabeth del Carmen M. G. inicio vendiendo hielo, helados, chocobananos, etc. Ella junto con su compañero de vida trabaja arduamente para proporcionarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Tania de los Ángeles Díaz es una joven trabajadora quien se dedica hacer tolrtillas bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses ella con el préstamo piensa aumentar la producción y Jairo Ramon G. vende de todo un poco desde ropa, zapatos, prenda etc.
texts.en:
The group "Rutina" is made up of 3 hardworking women.  One of these is Elizabeth del Carmen M. G., who started a business selling ice, ice cream, frozen chocolate bananas, etc.  She and her life partner work arduously to provide their children with a better quality of life.  

There are 2 other members of the group.  Tania de los Ángeles Díaz is a hardworking youth who makes tortillas, a Nicaraguan staple.  With the loan, she plans to increase her production.  Jairo Ramon G. sells a little of everything: clothing, shoes, accessories, etc.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and snacks

loans.name: El Hadji Dial Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur El Hadji Dial Mbaye S. est âgé de 35 ans. Il habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il est marié sans enfant. Monsieur S. est enseignant de fonction depuis 2005 dans une école à Yoff. Suite aux conseils  de son oncle qui était directeur dans les temps il a opté pour l’enseignement. Ceci l’a beaucoup intéressé  parce qu’il  éprouve  un grand plaisir à inculquer le savoir aux enfants. Mais parallèlement  il mène une activité de commerce et de vente d’habits pour enfants au marché  de Yoff ou il gère  une boutique pendant les vacances.  Pendant l’année scolaire  la boutique est confiée  à une de ses cousines et ainsi il se charge d’assurer la supervision. Il est membre  de la caisse  de Yoff depuis aout 2006.Il n’a jamais sollicité de crédit au sein de l’institution. Il emprunte 250 000 frs pour acheter des habits pour enfants qui seront destinés a la vente et ainsi renforcer son stock de marchandises dans sa cantine. Le but visé par monsieur S. est d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer les  conditions  de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. El Hadji Dial Mbaye S. is 35 years old. He lives in the Yoff township. He is married without children. Mr. S. has been employed as a teacher in a Yoff school since 2005. Following the advice of his uncle, who was the school principal at that time, he decided to go into teaching. This work attracted him because he really enjoys imparting knowledge to children. In addition, he also sells children’s clothing at the Yoff market, where he manages a store during school vacations. During the school year, the store is entrusted to a cousin, and he oversees its operation. He joined the Yoff mutual fund in August 2006. He never requested a loan before. He is borrowing 250,000 West African francs now in order to purchase children’s clothing for resale, increasing his merchandise stock. His goal is to increase his revenues and to improve the social conditions of his family.

loans.use: Bolstering working capital

loans.name: Sugeida Concepcion

texts.es:
Sugeida tiene 27 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia administrando juntos el negocio desde hace ya 5 años, trabajando de lunes a domingo; este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para la familia es por eso que todos colaboran para atender a los clientes.
