Ella quiere invertir en la tienda y para eso solicita un préstamo para el fortalecimiento de este y mejorar la atención a los clientes, su compra será en productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite) ya que son los más demandados por las personas que le consumen.
Desea crear un buen historial de crédito ya que espera desarrollar su negocio con esta ayuda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sugeida, 27, sells staple grains.  She lives in Jiquilisco, in the Usulután department, with her family.  She and her family have been running this business together for 5 years, working every day.  This business is the source of income for her family, and for this reason they all pitch in to serve the customers.  

She wants to invest in the store, and to do this she is requesting a loan to strengthen the business and improve the service provided to their customers.  She will purchase basic consumer goods (rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil) that are most in demand by her customers.  She wants to create a good credit history, since she hopes to develop her business with this support and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer goods (rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil)

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: La señora Maria Azucena tiene 51 años,  por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de artesanías, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas desea diversificar y no vender solamente un producto. Maria nos cuenta, que gracias a los esfuerzos y al apoyo que siempre le ha brindado su familia cuenta con este medio para realzar las compras de sus productos. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.  Ella sueña siempre tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado, que brinde estabilidad económica A su mama y su familia en general.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena is 51 years of age and her business is selling traditional handicrafts since she wished to increase the sales of her products. Above all she wishes to diversify and not sell only one product. María tells us that, thanks to the effort and support her family has always given her, she has this means of enhancing the sales of her products. 

Currently she is seeking this financing in order to purchase basic materials. Her abiding dream is to have a large store located within a marketplace that would bring economic security to her mother and her family in general.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 28-year-old married man blessed with a six-year-old child. He sells shoes to earn a living.  He has been in the business for nine years and has one employee. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to improve his business by giving him financial support.  He hopes to have a big business and improve his standard of living in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es:
Sandra reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de carne de res y posee una carnicería, vive con su familia, es soltera y este negocio lo heredo de su tía, realizándolo desde hace 2 años con un horario de lunes a domingo de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para ella y quiere invertir en la compra de reces (ganado) para destazarlas para el comercio pero no cuenta con los fondos para esta compra por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a  realizar esta inversión y sacar el mayor provecho  para el progreso del negocio y para el beneficio de su familia.
Sus proyecciones como cliente es tener una categoría A, y generar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia y el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in Jiquilisco, in the Usulután department.  She has a butcher shop where she sells beef.  She is single and lives with her family. She inherited this business from her aunt.  She has been running the business for 2 years, and works every day from 6am until 2pm.

This business is a source of income for her, and she wants to invest in the purchase of cattle to slaughter and sell.  However, she does not have the funds for this purchase, and so she is requesting a loan to help her make this investment, which will allow her to make progress with her business for the benefit of her family.  

Her plans as a client are to maintain a top credit rating, and to generate income for the well-being of her family and the progress of her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to slaughter for her butcher shop

loans.name: Buenos Aires 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buenos Aires 1 está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras  una de ellas es Luisa del Carmen S. de 33 años quien con el dinero que gano en una rifa invirtió en la compra de mercadería en calzado. Ella tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años quienes van a clases y con el préstamo piensa mejorar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la joven Petrona A. de 21 años la cual inicio hace cuatro años con el comercio de ropa en el cual invertirá el crédito y Xiomara Blandino desde hace tres años vende carne negocio en el que invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The "Buenos Aires 1" group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Luisa del Carmen S., age 33, who invested the money she won in a raffle to buy shoes to sell. She has two children, aged 13 and 10, who go to school. With the loan, she is planning to improve her business. 

The other members of the group are the young Petrona A., age 21, who four years ago started a business selling clothing, in which she will invest the loan; and Xiomara Blandino, who has been selling meat for three years, and who will also invest the loan in her business.

loans.use: Buying shoes to sell

loans.name: Wilber Antonio

texts.es: El joven Wilber tiene 25 años, es casado y tiene1 hijo a su cargo. El señor  se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías, el tiene que visitar diferentes lugares para ofrecer sus productos y obtener una variedad de clientes que le compren sus artesanías, el sale todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues este ingreso inicio como una fuente de trabajo necesaria para su familia. El ya tiene 6 años de  dedicarse a esta actividad, a pesar de las dificultades que enfrento para mantenerlo activo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de artesanía y para la exportación de los productos. Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para trasladar el producto ya que actualmente tiene que transportar las artesanías a través de los buses.
texts.en: Young Wilber is 25 years old, married, and has a child to support.  He sells handicrafts. He has to visit different places to offer his products and to get a number of customers to buy his handicrafts.   He sells every day from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, as this is a source of income he needs to support his family.  He has already worked for 6 years in this trade, and in spite of the difficulties he has faced he has managed to keep the business going.  The reason for this loan is to purchase and export handicraft products.  His dream is to buy a vehicle to transport his products, since he must now transport his handicrafts by taking buses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Sofía; ella es casada y tiene 2 Hijos; La socia trabaja preparando tortas y pasteles, ella los hace en forma independiente y luego los venD. en las diferentes tiendas o cafeterías, también prepara para diferentes eventos como matrimonios, bautizos y otros compromisos, ella le gustaría estudiar repostería y así poder aprender más tipos D. tortas y pasteles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar las tortas y también para comprar algunos materiales para la construcción D. su casa.


Los otros socios  se dedican a la ganadería, carpintería, pastelería y repostería, restaurant, venta D. chicha.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SAN ANTONIO” communal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Sofía; she is married and has two children. She works preparing cakes and pastries, which she does independently, and then she sells them in various stores and cafeterias. She also prepares her products for various events, such as weddings, baptisms and others. She would like to take classes in pastry making, so that she can learn to make additional types of cakes and pastries. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to prepare cakes, and also to buy some construction materials for her house. 

The other members work in ranching, carpentry, pastry- and dessert making, restaurant operation and the sale of chicha [a traditional beverage]. 

The borrower would like to thank those who are making her dream possible in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Buying supplies to make cakes, and also buying some construction materials for her home

loans.name: Ilarion

texts.es: El señor Ilarion nacido en la Liras en la localidad de El Torno provincia Andrés Ibáñez a 15 Km de El Torno. El se dedica a la agricultura y corte de madera para los carpinteros. Ellos son 5 hermanos mayores y trabajan en la misma parcela, pero ellos se dedican más a la agricultura siembran maíz, arroz y maní sacan a la venta en el mercado de El Torno, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una motosierra, para así facilitar su trabajo en el corte de madera, y el resto en la compra de semillas, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. El Sr. Ilarion se encuentra en la foto en compañia de su esposa y su hijito.
texts.en: Ilarion was born in La Liras in the municipality of El Torno in the Andrés Ibáñez province, 15 kilometers from the city of El Torno.  He is a farmer and also cuts wood for carpenters.  He works with his 4 adult brothers on the same parcel of land, but they work more in agriculture cultivating corn, rice and peanuts.  They take their products to sell in the El Torno market.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a chainsaw, which will facilitate his work cutting wood, and to buy seeds.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.  Ilarion is seen in the photo accompanied by his wife and their child.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw and corn seed

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria De Jesús tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de ropa y una pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que tiene esta actividad, pues inicio como una opción porque no tenía un trabajo y no ganaba un salario que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su hogar, también tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 menores dependen de ella. Con el apoyo de su esposo fue que dio inicio a este negocio, por lo que con el paso del tiempo fue que adquirió más experiencia  para con su negocio. El motivo de este crédito es para invertir en la compra de ropa y productos necesarios para su pulpería. Sueña con mejorar su actividad económica y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Maria De Jesús is in business selling clothes and running a general store. She has done so for over 12 years, having gone into business as something that could help her meet the household expenses at a time when she didn't have a job or any salary coming in. Her 4 children are dependent on her, with 2 being of school age. She started the business with the support of her husband, and as time has passed she has gained more experience. Her motive for seeking the loan is to invest in clothing and merchandise for her store. She dreams of improving her economic situation and progressing.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta vive en el pueblo de Achacachi, Provincia  Omasuyos, del Departamento La Paz junto a su esposo, ambos se dedican a la crianza de ganado, y el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de una vaca lechera. Este es su primer crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en: Vicenta lives in the town of Achacachi, in Omasuyos Province, La Paz, together with her husband. Together they dedicate their time to raising livestock, and she is seeking the loan to purchase a milk cow. This is her first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ticomo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ticomo está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Gloria B. Sevilla quien vende cosméticos (base, vanidad, lápiz labial, delineadores, etc.) y ropa (camisas, pantalones, camisetas, etc) desde hace cuatro años. Ella con el préstamo comprara mercadería para mejorar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Antonia Doribel P. vende ropa variada desde camisas, vestidos, blusas, etc. desde hace 5 años y Clara Jiménez desde hace tres años tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de gaseosas y chivería.
texts.en:
The Ticomo Group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Gloria B. Sevilla, who sells cosmetics - including foundation, lipgloss, eyeliners, etc - and clothes - including shirts, trousers, tops etc. With the looan she will buy merchandise to improve her business. 

The other members of the group are Antonia Doribel P., who for 5 years has been selling a variety of clothes including shirts, dresses, blouses etc, and Clara Jiménez, who for 3 years has had a small general store, which she started by selling sodas and dairy products.

loans.use: Clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Sonia Liliana

texts.es:
Sonia Liliana Rodríguez es una comerciante de 34 años de edad, casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años, y junto a él reside en la Colonia Poncaya en el municipio de Catacamas, Olancho. 

Hace unos años su esposo emigró hacia Estados Unidos de América y se quedó sola con su pequeño hijo, durante todo ese tiempo él nunca se desentendió de ellos y les enviaba remesas para que pudieran sostenerse y para la compra de un solar en el cual pudieran ir construyendo poco a poco su casa. Una vez terminada la casa Sonia tuvo la idea de establecer en una parte de la misma una venta de abarrotería en general y eso le ha permitido tener otra entrada de dinero, el cual le ha venido ayudar mucho en estos tiempos de crisis en el país norteamericano. 

Con el préstamo solicitado podrá surtir de más y variados productos su pulpería, ya que lo necesita mucho porque a la par de su negocio hay otro más surtido que el de ella. Su sueño es que su esposo regrese para que entre ambos puedan administrar su negocio y que este crezca y aumenten sus ganancias para que la calidad de su familia mejore.
texts.en:
Sonia Liliana Rodríguez  is a 34-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has a 6 year old son, and she lives with him in the Poncaya area of the town of Catacamas, Olancho. 

A few years ago, Sonia's husband emigrated to the USA, and she was left alone with their little son. In all this time, her husband has never once forgotten them, and has been sending remittances so they can look after themselves and for the purchase of a plot of land where - little by little - they were able to construct their house. Once the house was finished, Sonia had the idea of establishing a general store in part of it, and this has enabled her to establish an additional source of income - something which has helped them a lot in these times of [economic] crisis in North America.

With the loan, she will be able to supply her store with more and varied products, which she already badly needs because not far from her store there is another business which carries more stock than hers. Her dream is that her husband will return, that they will run the business together, and that the business will grow, augmenting their income and giving the family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy groceries in general

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene vive en la zona  Mariscal Sucre,  de la Ciudad de El Alto, actualmente se encuentra casado, cuya esposa se dedica a la confección de mantas. Rene solicito 800 $us y se dedica al transporte en minibús,  en  rutas definidas de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito es para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo.
texts.en: Rene lives in the Mariscal Sucre area of the City of El Alto. He is married, and his wife works making blankets. Rene is seeking $800. He works as a minibus driver, on defined routes across the city of El Alto. The loan is to pay for repairs to the vehicle.

loans.use: To pay for minibus repairs

loans.name: Martha De Los Santos

texts.es: Martha de los Santos tiene 31 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería,  ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella es una persona muy responsable y que disfruta de mantener a su familia para brindarles el pan de cada día, está ubicada en su vivienda en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes entre otro. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de mercadería y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Martha de los Santos is 31 years old and she has a general store.  She has been working with the Fundación for a long time, and has demonstrated that she can make her payments on time and in full.  She is a very responsible person and she enjoys working to support her family so that she can put food on the table every day.  Her business is located in her house, and there she offers a large variety of products such as candy, soft drinks, staple grains, detergents, and other items.  The loan that she requests is for working capital to buy merchandise, so that in this way she can improve her earnings.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Dieumbe

texts.fr: Madame Dieumbe D. est une femme qui habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner,  de glace et de jus. Madame  D. a opté son choix sur cette activité a cause de son   caractère  rentable. Elle  sollicite un crédit de 200 000frs prévu pour développer son commerce de petit déjeuner et de jus (achat de produits de base). Selon elle  le crédit  lui permet d’accroitre sa productivité et ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Dieumbe D. is a woman who lives in the town of Camberene. She sells breakfast foods, ice and juice. Mrs. D. got into this business because it is profitable. She is requesting a 200,000 XOF loan to expand her breakfast and juice sales (purchase of basic ingredients). She says this loan will allow her to increase her productivity and earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of basic ingredients

loans.name: Maria Clementina

texts.es:
María de 58 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres y vende mariscos con su esposo. 

Inicio hace 10 años atrás vendiendo mariscos con su esposo, como le genero buenos ingreso decidió invertir una parte de las ganancias en víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda en las afuera de su casa en un pequeño local que construyo y así pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo surtir su tienda con arroz, bebidas y dulces. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 10h00am hasta las 22h00pm en su tienda mientras que su esposo sale a vender mariscos. Aunque la venta de mariscos le genera mejores ganancias ella quiere seguir con su tienda ya que tiene mas tiempo para sus hijos y nietos.

Para surtir mejor su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para venderla a sus vecinos y así tener un ingreso adicional también quiere comprar mariscos y arroz para la tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante de mariscos a lado de su tienda para poder surtirla mas.
texts.en:
María, age 58, lives in a canton called Playas ["Beaches"], which is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations, known for its variety of seafood. She has a small grocery store and sells seafood together with her husband. 

She began 10 years ago selling seafood with her husband. Since this generated a good income, she decided to invest part of their earnings in groceries, so she could set up a small store outside her house, in a little shop she built, and thus spend more time with her children. Little by little, with effort, she was able to stock her store with rice, soft drinks and sweets. Currently, she works from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. in her store, while her husband goes out to sell seafood. Although the seafood sales generate more earnings, she wants to continue with her store, because it gives her more time for her children and grandchildren. 

To stock her store with more goods, she would like to use the loan to buy clothing, so she can sell it to her neighbors and thus earn additional income. She would also like to buy seafood and rice for her store. In the future, she would like to have a seafood restaurant next to her store, so she can expand it even more.

loans.use: Buying clothing and seafood to sell

loans.name: Alma Nuvia

texts.es: Alma Nuvia tiene 53 años y tiene 4 hijo todos son mayores de edad e independientes. La señora tiene en su casa un negocio de pulpería, ella vende leña, granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes. Ella ya tiene 7 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó debido al no tener ingreso para mantener su hogar, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más para ganarles más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil.
texts.en: Alma Nuvia is 53 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are grown and independent. In her home, she has a small general store where she sells firewood, basic grains, snacks and cleaning products. She has operated this business for 7 years already; she started it since she did not have an income to maintain her household, and she wanted to provide support to her children. She is requesting this loan with the aim of buying a variety of products, since she would like to begin to sell more in order to earn more. In addition, she says that every day the products are getting more expensive. This has become a challenge for her, since the economic situation in the country is becoming more and more difficult.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 37-year-old lady who is married with five children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. The family she lives with is composed of nine people in a family house. Catherine operates a clothing shop in which she also does tailoring, an activity she has done for the last eight years. She started as a tailor doing her business on the streets of the town. Using the gains and support from her husband, she was able to get premises to operate from. Just like most businessmen and women, Catherine also wants to see her clothing business grow to greater heights. She wants a loan to purchase wedding gowns to rent out at her clothing shop.

loans.use: To purchase wedding gowns to rent out at her clothing shop.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "CRISTO CAMPESINO"; la socia vive en el distrito de Huacaytaqui y provincia de Quispicabchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina: ella tiene 40 años de edad ella es separada y tiene 2 menores hijos la socia se dedica a atender su tienda abarrotes, ella trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de abarrotes como por ejemplo, arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceites y otros productos, la socia compra cada cierto tiempo mercadería para implementar su negocio, ella está en espera de un nuevo crédito para comprar los productos de primera necesidad. La socia vive en Huacaytaqui y en esta comunidad, no se tiene mayor número en tiendas abarrotes que solo 4 tiendas en toda la comunidad y ella tiene mayor productos, es por eso que requiere implementar su tienda para abastecer al poblado preciosos en el cual ella a elegido quedarse a vivir y hacer patria como ella misma lo manifiesta.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahinco para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicentina is a member of the community bank "CRISTO CAMPESINO"; she lives in the district of Huacaytaqui, province of Quispicabchis, in the district of Cusco. She is 40 years old and separated with two minor children. She runs her own grocery store, where she sells all kinds of groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oils and other products. From time to time she needs to restock and for this reason she is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies. In Huacaytaqui, where she lives, there are only four grocery stores, and her store in particular has the largest offer; to respond to the demand of the beautiful place where she has chosen to live, as she says, she needs to purchase supplies. 
The member is very grateful for this loan and is committed to continue working very hard to pay back on schedule and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery supplies

loans.name: Insa

texts.fr: Monsieur Insa H.  habite dans la localité de Camberene. Il s’active dans le commerce de tissus et de prets  à porter. Il a choisi cette activité a cause de son aspect rentable. Monsieur H. a déjà remboursé deux prets antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs  prévu  pour  l’achat de tissus et de prets a porter destinés a la vente. Le financement lui permet de développer et d’accroitre son activité.
texts.en: Insa H. lives in the town of Camberene. He sells cloth and ready-to-wear clothing. He chose this business because it is profitable. Mr. H. has already repaid two previous loans. He is requesting a 200,000 XOF loan to buy cloth and ready-to-wear clothing. This loan will allow him to develop and increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and clothing

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel tiene 52 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de plástico y ganando  ubicada en su humilde vivienda, es una persona muy luchadora pues siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar la condición de vida de su familia. Por lo que su producto lo obtiene del salvador, compra de contado y vende contado Pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación por lo que ha sido una cliente muy responsable. Se siente contenta con este nuevo financiamiento para la compra de mercadería necesaria. Ella tiene la meta de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 52 years old. She sells plastic from her humble home. She is a fighter who is always looking for a way to improve her family's quality of life. She obtains her product from El Salvador. She pays for it upfront and sells it for cash. This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan from the Foundation and she has been a very responsible client. She is happy with this new loan to buy necessary merchandise. Her goal is improving her living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 32-year-old lady living in Fort Portal. Uganda. She is a single mother of two children aged 16 and 12 years. This means she is charged with the responsibility of looking after them in terms of welfare and maintenance. She lives in her own house with four people. Amina deals in selling cassava flour. She has been in this business for twelve years now, having started so small. She still hopes the business will grow into a bigger one in the near future. This is Amina’s seventh loan facility from HOFOKAM and she intends to use the loan proceeds to purchase sacks of cassava flour to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cassava flour to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Aracelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely del Carmen O. A., fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora propietaria de una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de gaseosa hace 4 años. En la actualidad vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, chivería, pan, carne etc.

O. es madre de un pequeño de 4 años por el cual trabaja arduamente y sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sea una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Aracely del Carmen O. A. is a hard-working, determined and entrepreneurial woman. She owns a small grocery store, which she started by selling soft drinks 4 years ago. Currently, she sells rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, bread, meat, etc. 

O. is the mother of a little 4-year-old child, for whom she is currently working very hard. She dreams of improving her business and making it into a general store.

loans.use: Buying basic foods such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, bread, meat, etc.

loans.name: Fermín

texts.es:
El señor Fermín  casado con Señora Francisca con 2 hijos. Nacido en Cochabamba y hace 5 años que vive en Santa Cruz en la localidad de Limoncito a 32 Km  de el Torno  se compro  una pequeña parcela donde vive con su esposa y trabaja en la agricultura, su esposa le ayuda en la siembra y la cosecha de sus productos después en la comercialización de los mismos. 
Siembra maíz, arroz, maní y yuca, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas y lo utilizara en los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Mr. Fermín is married to Ms. Francisca and they have two children.  He was born in Cochabamba and has lived for 5 years in Santa Cruz, which is in the locality of Limoncito, 32 kilometers from El Torno.  He and his wife bought a small parcel of land and he works in agriculture.  His wife helps him with planting, harvesting, and later selling their products.  They plant corn, rice, groundnuts, and yucca.  He will use the money from this loan to buy seeds and to prepare his land for planting.  He is very grateful to those offering him support through this loan.

loans.use: to clear his land and plant corn

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian D. sells cosmetics in Broyinbima near Elmina. She has received senior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband by earning housekeeping money. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel, de 26 años, vive junto a Yolanda, de 24; ambos constituyeron una familia muy unida, que en compañía de su hija Stefany de 1 año; a la que cuidan y educan en una casa alquilada, viven en una casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Yanapuquio (sierra del Perú). Todas las mañanas se alistan para poder cultivar papa, siendo la principal actividad de la familia; es así que empieza desde las primeras horas del día hasta el anochecer, dedicándose al cuidado de sus cultivos; ya que la extensión de terreno, no les permite avanzar con facilidad. Seguro de su gran esfuerzo, Fidel afirma que durante todo este tiempo la papa, es la más cotizada en el mercado; siendo la Yungay, una variedad de papa que tiene mucha demanda. Es así que viaja tres veces por mes al mercado central de su localidad, por ello Fidel está ahorrando parte de su dinero para adquirir una casa, de esa manera podrá trasladarse con facilidad. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y le gusta que su banco comunal, sea su poder de ahorro; con ello está seguro que podrá lograr mucho de sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá; comprará abono orgánico; para que pueda cosechar papa dentro de un mes.
texts.en: Fidel, age 26, lives with Yolanda, 24; together they are a close family with their 1 year old daughter Stefany. They look after and educate Stefany in their own, rented, house, located in the Yanapuquio area (sierra del Perú). Every morning they get ready to go out and cultivate their potatoes, this being the family's main source of income. From the first hours of day until nightfall they dedicate their time to the cultivation of their crops. They are at the limit of their land and cannot easily expand [production]. Sure of his skill, Fidel states that his potato crop is always the most prized in the market, his potatoes being "Yungay" - a variety that is in great demand. Because of this he travels to market 3 times a month, and he is saving part of the money to buy a house. This is his 9th loan with [field partner] MFP and he likes the communal bank as his means of saving: with it he is sure he will be able to realize his goals. With the loan he obtains, he will buy organic fertilizer that will enable him to harvest the potato crop within a month.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer so that he can soon harvest potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying household items, paper goods, cosmetics and fashion items which she needs to include in her range of merchandise

loans.name: Duve Esther

texts.es:
Duve M. R. es una mujer de 50 años que vive en el barrio Siape y que no se queda quieta porque le da curso a su talento emprendedor; siempre está en función de mirar las oportunidades, comprar, vender  y conocer nuevas personas para convertirlas en sus clientes.
Así ha venido trabajando durante muchos años,  porque desde hace 7,  se dedica a viajar Maicao,  un municipio fronterizo con Venezuela,  para  comprar  víveres como arroz, aceite,  fab, Jabón, leche en polvo, salchicha, refrescos y hasta sabanas.  Cuando inició esta actividad, lo hizo con muy escaso capital y poco a poco ha ido incrementándolo. Duve viaja con su hermana cada 8 días, compra productos que le encargan y los distribuye a crédito  semanalmente, para luego recoger su cartera cada quince; sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio San Salvador  y también tiene en su propia comunidad. Últimamente ha encontrado  muchos de estos artículos a buen precio en Barranquilla y entonces los compra en esa ciudad. Duve  adicionó a su negocio la venta de  calzado a través de guías especializadas y este dinero lo recoge cada quince días y vende por encargos.
Duve es una mujer  muy creativa y dinámica, siempre está en movimiento, le saca mucho provecho a sus capacidades y constantemente permanece identificando nichos de mercado donde pueda ella ganar con su trabajo; se ha dedicado siempre a lo que le gusta y ahí radica su éxito. En época de carnavales, Duve vende camisetas estampadas con lentejuelas que ella misma decora y este es un potencial al cual le saca dinero también, igualmente vende cerveza, sopas y hayacas, ya que aprovecha que en el sector donde vive es justamente por donde se dan los grandes desfiles del carnaval, comparsas  y es  un escenario  de gran aglomeración de personas para disfrutar de estos eventos importantes en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella y su familia  conformada por su esposo, pensionado de una empresa, e hijos y nietos, viven en su propia casa  donde ella y su esposo permanecen  siempre unidos  y en todas las decisiones de su hogar. Este es su tercer financiamiento y Duve planea comprar víveres, en un mayor volumen porque tiene encargado, arroz, aceite, fab, jabón, leche en polvo embutidos; ella siente que ha cambiado su vida desde que recibió su primer crédito,  porque ha tenido la posibilidad de dinero   disponible para comprar y responder  muy pronto a sus clientes. Su sueño es ampliarlo  adicionándole prendas de plata porque tiene un potencial de clientes  que conoció en Maicao y así se lo han solicitado, este es justamente su desafío,  pues requiere un poco mas de capital y está trabajando para ello
texts.en:
Duve M. R. is a 50-year-old woman who lives in the Siape neighborhood, and who does not just sit around, because she is giving expression to her entrepreneurial talent: she is always busy looking for opportunities, buying, selling, and getting to know new people in order to make them her customers.

She has been working in this way for many years; 7 years ago, she started traveling to Maicao, a municipality on the border with Venezuela, to buy groceries such as rice, oil, detergent, soap, powdered milk, sausages, soft drinks and even bedsheets. When she began this business, she did it with very little capital, and little by little she has been increasing it. Duve travels with her sister every 8 days, buying products which her customers request, and distributing them on credit each week; she later collects her payments every two weeks. Her main customers are her neighbors in the San Salvador neighborhood and also in her own community. Recently, she has found many of these items for a good price in Barranquilla, and thus she buys them in that city. Duve added to her business the sale of shoes through specialized guides; she sells them on order and collects the money every 15 days. 

Duve is a very creative and dynamic woman who is always on the move. She takes great advantage of her skills, and she is constantly identifying market niches where she can earn money with her work. She has always done what she enjoys, and that is the root of her success. During the Carnival season, Duve sells shirts decorated with sequins, which she makes herself, and this is another source of income for her. She also sells beer, soup and hayacas [a kind of tamale], taking advantage of the fact that the area where she lives happens to be the place where the great Carnival parades take place, so it is a place where great crowds gather to enjoy these events that are so important for the city of Barranquilla. She and her family, made up of her husband, who is retired from work with a company, along with children and grandchildren, live in their own house, where she and her husband always remain united in all of the decisions related to the household. 

This is her third loan, and Duve plans to buy groceries in greater volume, because she has orders for rice, oil, detergent, soap, powdered milk, and sausages. She feels that her life has changed since she received her first loan, because she has had the opportunity to have money available to buy merchandise and respond very quickly to her customers. Her dream is to expand her business, adding silver jewelry, because she has potential customers she met in Maicao, and they have requested this. This is her current challenge, since she needs a little more capital, and she is working toward this goal.

loans.use: Buying groceries in greater volume, because she has orders for rice, oil, detergent, soap, powdered milk and sausages

loans.name: Oscar Isabel

texts.es: El señor Oscar Isabel tiene 55 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El señor Oscar su negocio es la venta de herramientas de herrero, este negocio lo inicio su Papa pues fue con el paso del tiempo que le enseño a Oscar a buscar la forma de mantener el negocio como medio de vida, para que así lograra mantener a su familia. El ya tiene 20 años de tener negocio, cabe señalar que no ha sido fácil, pero con la ayuda de sus buenos tratos con sus clientes ha podido mejorar. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar barras, cinceles, mazos. Sueña que sus hijos pequeños puedan prepararse en la universidad producto de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Oscar Isabel, 55, is married and has two minor children. His business is selling blacksmithing tools, a business that his dad started. Over time his father taught him to find the way to keep up the business in order to make a living and thus be able to support his family. He has had this business now for 20 years. It must be said that it has not been easy, but thanks to his good way with his customers he has been able to improve. 

The gentleman is seeking this loan with the goal of buying bars, chisels and mallets. He hopes that one day his small children would be able to receive a university education as a result of his efforts.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a young man, age 24, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives with a family of three people in his own house. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for six years. He says that he has few challenges and dreams of expanding his transport business by buying more motorcycles in the near future. Patrick wants this loan to buy land for construction of a rental house so that he can earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy land for construction of a rental house

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Lidubina B. Mendosa es una señora trabajadora que a sus 66 años ha hecho de todo desde vender fritanga (pollo asado, enchiladas, tacos, carne asada, ensaladas, gallo pinto), sopas los domingos (de pollo, de mondongo, de hueso, de queso) y bisutería actualmente. Ella con el crédito comprara arroz, aceite, pollo, azúcar entre ostros productos paras sus negocios.
B. es una mujer activa es por ello que está recibiendo talleres sobre cómo hacer bisutería, actividad muy lucrativa que le ha ayudado a prender nuevas cosas y sacar su creatividad. Ella sueña en viajar lejos y conocer México.
texts.en:
Lidubina B. Mendosa is a hard-working woman at her 66 years.  She has done everything from selling snacks (chicken, enchiladas, meat, salads, and rice and beans), to selling soup on Sundays (chicken, tripe, and cheese soups) to currently selling costume jewelry.  With this loan, she will buy rice, oil, chicken, sugar, and other products for her businesses.

B. is an active woman, and that is why she is taking classes on how to make costume jewelry.  This is a lucrative business, and it has helped her learn new things and bring out her creativity.  Her dream is to travel far and to visit Mexico.

loans.use: She will purchase rice, oil, chicken, sugar, etc., for her businesses

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is a single parent taking care of two children. She sells tigernut milk and bread with groundnut paste (peanut butter) in Elmina. She has been through senior high school. Janet manages her home with the income she makes and provides for the family's basic needs. This loan will enable her to expand her business. Janet plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 22 años, es un hombre soltero que lucha por salir adelante; el vive junto a sus padres, y sus 3 hermanos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Yanapuquio (sierra peruana). Con la ayuda de sus padres; Jorge, logró adquirir un terreno agrícola, ahí desde hace 2 años; viene sembrando papa en sus diferentes variedades; con el apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo adquirir un pequeño capital, que con su buen juicio para los negocios, ya está en aumento. Ahora él, comenzó a tener contacto con los comercializadores de papa, que viajan continuamente a diferentes lugares del país, ya que ellos abastecen a los pobladores el consumo de este tubérculo. Por tal motivo espera adquirir más terrenos de cultivo, para poder aumentar su producción y de esa manera poder negociar mayor cantidad de cosecha, por ende tener mayores ganancias. 

Para su futuro empresarial, él planea comprar una casa en la ciudad y abrir un restaurante, donde pueda obtener mayores ingresos económicos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y está seguro que con su ayuda podrá seguir progresando. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono natural, para que las 5 hectáreas de cultivo de papa que tiene; pueda obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
22-year-old Jorge is a single man fighting to get ahead. He lives together with his parents and his three sisters in their own house, located in the town of Yanapuquio (Peruvian Sierra). With the help of his parents, Jorge succeeded in acquiring agricultural land two years ago. He has been sowing various kinds of potatoes. With the help of his communal bank, he was able to acquire a little capital which, with his good business sense, he is already increasing. Now, he has begun to have contact with the potato traders that continually travel to different parts of the country, since they supply the settlers with this tuber. For this reason, he hopes to acquire more land to cultivate, in order to be able to augment his production and thus be able to trade a bigger harvest and ultimately increase his income.

For his business future, he plans to buy a house in the city and open a restaurant, where he’ll be able to earn greater income. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is sure that with their help, he’ll be able to continue progressing. With the loan that he is seeking, he will buy natural fertilizer for his 5 hectares of potato crops, in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to apply to the 5 hectars of potatoes

loans.name: John

texts.en: He is a 39-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda married with five children aged 19, 17, 14, 9 and 6 years. His name is John. He lives in his own house and is into the transport business. He has a truck that is mostly hired to transport heavy things. He has been in the business for 10 years now and hopes to carry on with the hope of growth with the purchase of more trucks. John intends to use the loan proceeds to buy tires for his truck for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy tires for his truck for his transport business.

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en: Deogratius is a young lad of 25 years married to a farmer and together they have two children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda in a family of four people in a rented house. He operates a motorcycle transport business and has been in it for three years now. He is currently riding someone else’s motorcycle but he is finally buying his own. The purpose of the loan facility is to enable Deogratius to make the final payment on the purchase of his  motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano de 65 años, es un hombre muy bueno y alegre, esta casado con Eusebia, ellos tienen 7 hijos y viven en su casa propia en el pueblo de Jacahuasi. Él afirma con mucha alegría que todos sus hijos son responsables y 3 de ellos profesionales, “fue por eso que no pude comprar mi terreno”, menciona. Sin embargo está juntando capital para comprar un terreno y poder cultivar mayor cantidad de verduras y de esa manera tener mayor ganancia. Ya tiene 40 años dedicándose a la agricultura y agradece a Dios porque en todo estos años las cosechas fueron buenas; las espinacas y zanahorias que cultiva las vende en el mercado de su ciudad y también en la capital, es lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, el poder viajar. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y está contento de poder pertenecer a la entidad más respetada de su localidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico para sus plantaciones de verduras, asimismo contratará peones para que pueda arar la tierra antes de sembrarla.
texts.en: 65-year-old Feliciano is a very good and cheerful man. He is married to Eusebia. They have 7 children and live in their own home in the town of Jacahuasi.  He happily affirms that all of his children are responsible and that three of them are professionals, “that’s why I couldn’t buy my land” he mentioned. However, he is gathering capital to buy land and to be able to cultivate a greater quantity of vegetables, and in this way make a bigger profit. He has worked in agriculture for 40 years already and is grateful to God, because in all those years the harvests were good. He sells the spinach and the carrots that he grows in the city market and also in the capital. Being able to travel is what he likes most about his work. It is his first loan with MFP and he is happy to be able to belong to the most-respected entity in his town. With the loan that he is seeking, he will buy organic fertilizer for his vegetable plantations and will also hire agricultural workers to help him plow the fields before sowing them.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and to hire laborers to help him plow the fields.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De Yguazú Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Luchadoras de Yguazú. Están en el Quinto Ciclo, con 14  integrantes. 
Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable y están muy satisfechas de pertenecer al programa comité de mujeres.
Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para pagar las cuotas.
El crédito para ellas les facilita mejorar sus emprendimientos ya no poseen capital para invertir, así como la señora Prisila quien solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosmético como maquillajes, cremas para la piel, aceites, perfumes y otros.
Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en sus ratos libres, su clientela la conforman amigas y vecinas quienes le piden los productos de acuerdo al mismo ella los retira.
A ella le gustaría en el futuro tener en su casa un salón de venta de cosméticos y ropas para trabajar mejor y obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
The committee is called Mujeres Luchadores de Yguazú [Tenacious Women of Yguazú]. It is in its fifth loan cycle and has 14 members. 

The group stands out in its neighborhood for being close-knit, mutually supportive and responsible and they are highly satisfied at belonging to the Committee of Women program. 

The members are possessed of great enterprising spirit, since they are up-to-date with the payments and engage in business activities in order to raise funds for making the payments. 

The loan helps them improve their enterprises as currently they have no capital to invest. For example, Prisila, who is seeking the loan in order to purchase cosmetics such as makeup, creams for the skin, oils, perfumes and other items. 

She works selling cosmetics in her free time. Her customer base is made up of her friends and neighbors who ask her for products according to which she retrieves them. 

In the future she would like to have a venue for selling cosmetics and clothing out of her home in order to improve her work conditions and achieve better earnings.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, oils, creams for the skin and other items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan N. rents a small store where he sells veterinarian drugs. These products are very popular in his area. Most of the people in his region own livestock, which require a lot of inoculations and other medical care. Elkhan's business helps local farmers provide medical care for their livestock. He has many regular clients. Elkhan purchases goods every week. He is requesting this loan to purchase more products to sell so that he can increase his profit. 

Elkhan is married and has six children. It is very hard to provide for a large family, so Elkhan applied for 1000 AZN to invest in his business. He wishes to educate his children and hopes that someday they’ll become good members of society.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Ingris Patricia

texts.es:
El negocio de Ingris Patricia es la fabricación de artefactos de hierro y de aluminio, pero también tiene un vehículo que utiliza como moto taxi, usualmente usado en el municipio de Malambo como medio de transporte. Inicialmente, cuando su esposo dejó de trabajar como empleado, emprendieron  el  negocio donde ofrecía servicios de alquiler de lavadoras y de video juegos, pero la alta competencia que se generó en esta población relacionada con estas actividades, los obligó a retomar la experiencia de 10 años de su esposo en la fabricación de productos de hierro y  aluminio con los que en la actualidad han logrado  sostenerse en el mercado.
Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su primero logró aumentar sus ingresos y con ello terminar de construir su apartamento, el que ahora le ofrece nuevos ingresos por concepto de arrendamiento.  Su plan es organizar gradualmente su taller con mejores y más adecuadas herramientas y el mejoramiento locativo del mismo. Con su credikiva comprará  materia prima  como aluminio, hierro, cerraduras, tornillos, tuercas láminas de vidrio remaches y empaques, aprovechará la temporada de fin de año, donde los clientes por obtener ingresos adicionales,  mejoran sus condiciones habitacionales y con ello mandan a fabricar   puertas, rejas y ventanas  en el taller de Ingris. Así ella aspira a aumentar su capital de trabajo, generar mayor número de clientes y mejores sus utilidades que favorecrian su ingreso familiar y el sostenimiento cada vez de mejor calidad,  de sus 3 hijos que están en las edades de 6 a 13 años.
texts.en:
Ingris Patricia's business is the production of iron and aluminum fixtures, but she also has a vehicle which she uses as a moto-taxi [motorcycle outfitted with a passenger compartment], typically used in the municipality of Malambo as a means of transport. At first when her husband stopped working as an employee they set up a business in which they offered washing machine and video game rental services, but the competition that was generated in this community related to these types of businesses was stiff. They were obliged to fall back on her husband's ten years of experience producing iron and aluminum products, by which they currently have successfully maintained their presence in the market. 

This is her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the first loan she successfully increased her income and thus was able to complete the construction of her apartment, which now offers her new income by way of rental. Her plan is to gradually organize her workshop with better and more appropriate tools and to improve its location. 

She will use her Kiva loan to buy basic supplies such as aluminum, iron, locks, screws, nuts, glass panes, rivets and washers. She will take advantage of the end-of-the-year season during which customers, due to bringing in additional income, typically improve their living conditions and so place orders for doors, grille work and windows from Ingris's workshop. Therefore she hopes to increase her working capital, expand her customer base and raise her profits which would be favorable to the family income and ever-improving quality of life of her three children who range between the ages of 6 and 13.

loans.use: To purchase basic supplies such as aluminum, iron, locks, screws, nuts, panes of glass, rivets and washers

loans.name: Irma Nellys

texts.es: Irma Nellys tiene 55 años. Se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales, no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con créditos. Hace ya 20 años que viene dedicándose a esta actividad, oficio que le ayudó a pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos todos los días sale a compra al mercado sus frutas frescas para realizar una buena elaboración de sus refrescos, por lo que espera surtir más su negocio para obtener más clientes. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con Fundación  por lo que necesita este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Irma Nellys is 55 years old and she works selling natural juices.  This is not her first experience with loans.  She has been working in this business for 20 years and it is a trade that helped her to pay for her childrens’ college expenses.  She goes out to the market every day to buy fresh fruits so that she makes good juices.  This is why she hopes to stock her store more to get more customers.  This is her sixth loan through the foundation and she needs it to buy raw material.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en: Dilara Z. is 31 years old and single. For a year she has been selling food in her grocery store. Dilara’s wish is to increase her business by offering a greater variety of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She has applied for 1000 AZN in order to increase the number of items she sells and to increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase more items for stock.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es: Peregrina tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña aprendió las técnicas agrícolas, ahora su labor se ha intensificado más en la ganadería, en donde compra y vende animal ovino, el cual cría en su casa; asimismo compra cuyes, así los reproduce y los vende, siendo éste negocio muy rentable. De esta manera puede esperar el tiempo de cosecha de maíz para que logre generarse ingresos, ya que este proceso requiere de tiempo, además que es muy trabajoso, por lo que siempre cuenta con la ayuda de su familia, tanto para la siembra como para la cosecha. Sin embargo ha habido temporada de mucha perdida debido al clima y otros factores, llegando a perder lo invertido, pero para ella no le es suficiente para renunciar, pues es su forma de vida del cual vive de ella. Por ahora su mayor anhelo es mejorar la cosecha de maíz, así como aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es el crédito número 15 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece  a las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa, así como comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su granja de cuyes.
texts.en:
Peregrina is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a house they own. Peregrina learned how to farm as a young child but her work now involves mostly small livestock. She raises sheep and guinea pigs, which she finds to be a profitable business. It provides her with income in the time before she can harvest her maize crop. Growing maize requires time and a lot of work from Peregrina and her family. Also, some seasons are affected by bad weather and other factors that can result in the loss of all her investments of time and money. Nevertheless, these challenges don't discourage Peregrina because farming is her way of life. 

For now, Peregrina's greatest hope is to improve her maize harvest and expand her livestock business. This is her 15th loan from MFP and she is very happy to have this financial resource. She is also grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible, supportive people. Likewise, she is grateful to the people who will fund this loan she is requesting. The loan will be very useful in developing her business. Peregrina will use the loan to purchase fertilizer for growing alfalfa, and construction materials to expand her guinea pig farm.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and materials to expand guinea pig farm.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin Q. is married and has one son. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Elchin has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food items. With a starting capital of $200 USD, he began this enterprise a year ago. Over time he has expanded his business and today this business has become a family operation, as his wife is also engaged in it.

Today Elchin needs to buy additional food items to increase the range of goods he has for sale. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while to achieve his goals and to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf A. has been able to support his family in an honorable way by selling different kinds of food items in his grocery store. He is married and has two children. In order to improve the quality and quantity of his products, he wants to buy more food items. For this purpose he needs a loan of 1000 AZN. Ashraf has put a lot of effort into developing his business; he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur and, with your help, this could be possible.

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Charllotte

texts.en: Charllotte E. sells kenkey and fried fish at Elmina. Charllotte has received a senior high education. She is a single parent of four dependants. She responsibly educates and feeds her family. Her loan will be used to buy maize and fish to sell and also use some of the maize to prepare kenkey for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profits.

loans.use: To buy maize and fish to sell and also use some of the maize to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en: Zumrud D. is an entrepreneur who runs a business selling clothing for kids. She has been in this business for eight years. Zumrud has loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her inventory and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. She  brings clothes, once in a week, from Baku which is 1.5 hours away from her home. This time Zumrud is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase the assortment of her inventory. She would like to purchase additional clothing for the upcoming cold weather so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothes inventory, to increase profit.

loans.name: Digno

texts.es: El señor Digno tiene 62 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijas menores de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa, Digno se dedica a la venta de mariscos la cual distribuye de manera ambulante, pese que en su casa su esposa también le ayuda. El ya tiene 10 años de tener este negocio, pues surgió ante la necesidad de mantener a su familia, ya que para ese tiempo cuando inicio una cooperativa pesquera y así salía a vender sus diferentes productos.  Es por ello que decidió hacerse de un negocio para tener más ingresos y brindar más tiempo a su familia. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de camarones, chuletas, pescados, punches entre otros. Su sueño siempre ha sido brindar más comodidades a su familia, establecer un negocio más grande y poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. Digno is 62 years old, married, and has two young children. His wife is a homemaker and Digno sells seafood as a street vendor, though his wife also helps him from home. This business, which he has had for ten years, arose out of of the necessity to support his family.  Ten years ago, he started a fishing cooperative and then went out to sell his different products.  He decided to establish this business in order to bring in more income and to have more time with his family. Digno would like to invest this loan in the purchase of shrimp, filets, fish, crabs, and other seafood.  His dream has always been to offer his family greater comforts, to establish a larger business, and to be able to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, filets, fish, crabs, and other seafood

loans.name: Phelomina

texts.en: Phelomina A. is a single parent living with her two children. She has attained a junior high level of school. Phelomina serves banku with fried fish and pepper sauce for sale at Elmina. Phelomina will use the loan to purchase a bag of corn and other ingredients to prepare banku for sale. The new earnings that she is going to accrue as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bag of corn and other ingredients to prepare banku to sell

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan I. rents a little store where he sells construction materials and paints. He buys his goods from different cities, wherever they are cheaper, and sells them. He purchases goods every week. Ruslan is married and has a son. He has many loyal clients. Ruslan wants to take a loan to help him purchase more goods and to have more profit. He wishes to educate his child and hopes that someday he’ll become a good person in society.

loans.use: To purchase more construction materials.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
el sr. Felix Pedro M. O. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Jeronimo, Choluteca.
Felix se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales y horchata, compra las frutas para preparar sus refrescos.
tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Felix es padre de 4 hijos los cuales ya estan grandes y le ayudan a vender sus refrescos.
Felix se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a Choluteca  a vender sus frescos.
Felix y su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia, en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas, agua, leche, azucar, colorantes y saborizantes.
texts.en:
Felix Pedro M. O. is 46 years old, he lives in the village of San Jeronimo, Choluteca. 
Felix sells natural beverages and horchata (rice water).  He purchases the fruits to make the beverages and has been making them for 8 years.
Felix is a father of 4 grown kids who help him sell his beverages; he gets up at 4AM to go to Choluteca and sell his drinks.  Felix and his wife work hard to get their family ahead and in their spare time they go to church.  The loan will be used to purchase fruits, water, milk, sugar, food coloring, and sweeteners.

loans.use: Purchase fruit, water, milk, sugar, food coloring, sweeteners, and bags.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama D. sells okra and maize at Elmina. Ama has not acquired any form of education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with the Ghana Health Service. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional okra and other food stuffs to resell to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy additional okro and other food stuffs to resell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort V. sells palm kernel oil at Teterem near Elmina. Comfort has received senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Comfort has been selling palm kernel oil for some time now. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy palm nuts to process into oil to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

In this picture, Comfort is demonstrating one of the steps in the palm kernel oil making process. She is pouring the milled palm fruit from a height to remove any dirt that might be stuck within the kernels.

loans.use: To buy palmnuts to process into oil to sell

loans.name: Shirinbeyim

texts.en: Shirinbeyim M. is 53 years old. She is selling souvenirs, home products and cosmetics in a central local shop. Shirinbeyim has been in this business for five years already. During these years, the business turned into a successful one, allowing Shirinbeyim to support herself and her family. Now Shirinbeyim is planning to increase her stock and to purchase more home products plates at wholesale. With this purpose, she requests 1000 AZN. Shirinbeyim thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more home products.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 4 Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la señora Zunilda R.  del km 9 Acaray de C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas 4”  están en el Decimo Primer   Ciclo   con  17 integrantes, es un grupo muy unido que se destaca  en el barrio por la forma de trabajo en conjunto y también por seriedad con toman las responsabilidades que tiene el comité.

Cada una de las integrantes retiraron su crédito para invertir en sus negocios para comenzar, mejorar, o aumentar la cantidad y variedad de mercaderías con cuentan, así la Sra. Virginia presidenta del grupo retiro su crédito para la  compra de especias en gran cantidad a granel, para volver a envasar o fraccionar en pequeñas cantidades. 
Ella trabaja de esta forma vendiendo a varios negocios especias fraccionadas en pequeñas cantidades.
De esta forma trabaja y obtiene un buen ingreso para su familia
texts.en:
This group was started by señora Zunilda R..  It is located at kilometer 9 in Acaray in C.D.E.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in the area.

The group is called "Mujeres Unidas 4" (United Women 4). They are on their 10th loan cycle and have 17 members.  This is a very united group that is known in the neighborhood for the work they do together and also for the seriousness with which they take their responsibilities in the group.

Each one of the members is taking out a loan to invest in her business to start, improve, or increase the quantity and variety of merchandise that she has.  Señora Virginia, the president of the group, took out her loan to buy a large quantity of spices in bulk so she could divide them and package them in small quantities.  She works in this way, selling small quanities of spices to different businesses.  In this way, she obtains a good income for her family.

loans.use: To buy cumin, white and black pepper, organs, parsley, garlic, anise, etc.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: For the last two years, Kamala O. has dedicated herself to selling men's clothing in the market. She began by selling small quantities but, through the years, she has gone on to acquire greater quantities for sale. Kamala began her business due to the needs of her family; her husband’s income did not suffice to cover the household expenses. Currently Kamala requests 1000 AZN in order to re-stock her clothing inventory. She counts on your help and thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Bayardo Javier

texts.es: Bayardo Javier tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de medicamentos naturales. El siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, el es un joven muy responsable y ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas. Es de manera ambulante en los buses pues es aquí donde obtiene una gran variedad de clientes. Sueña con sacar adelante su familia y espera que sus hijos logren ser profesionales. El financiamiento es para la compra de medicamentos pues actualmente posee varios pedidos.
texts.en: Bayardo Javier is 31 years old and he sells natural medicines.  He is always looking for a way to increase his income and it is not the first time that he is requesting a loan.  He has had this business for more than 6 years and he is a very responsible young man who has proved that he makes his loan repayments.  He sells the medicines traveling on buses and here is where he gets a great variety of customers.  He dreams of helping his family progress and he hopes that his children are able to be professionals.  The loan is for the purchase of medicines because he currently has several requests.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz Q. is a 30-year-old man, engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. He has 3 years of experience in this field. 

Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Parviz has become a very successful businessman. Parviz has a friendly family who always try to help each other. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Parviz wants to expand his business and to buy more cattle. So, for that, he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase three cattle.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 48 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil lugar caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. Tiene un taller de ensamblaje y un carro que lo utiliza para expreso. 

Hace 7 años el comenzó en su carro haciendo expresos pero como necesitaba mas ingresos para poder mantener a sus tres hijos. Comenzó con un talle de ensamblaje en la parte delantera de su casa. Poco a poco tubo una buena acogida con los vecinos de su barrio. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 07h30 haciendo expreso y desde las 13h30 hasta las 18h00 con su taller de ensamblaje. Hace puertas, ventanas, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y pintura para que su negocio y casa estén mejor ubicados. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su vivienda y tener una compañía de expresos.
texts.en:
Arturo is 48 years old.  He lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, a place where the majority of the inhabitants are involved in business.  He owns a woodworking shop and a car that he uses to make deliveries.

Out of necessity, 7 years ago he began using his car in the delivery business.  This enabled him to support his three children.  He began his workshop in the front part of his house.  Little by little he gained a good reputation with his neighbors.  Currently he works from 6:30am to 7:30am making deliveries and then from 1:30pm to 6pm he works in his shop.  He makes doors and windows etc.

With the loan he would like to buy cement, blocks and paint in order for his business and home to be better positioned.  En the future he would like to finish building his home and own a delivery business.

loans.use: To buy cement, blocks and paint.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce M. is a palm kernel oil processor at Elmina. Joyce has a junior high educational background. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will enable her to produce larger quantity of palm kernel oil for sale. She hopes to build a house from the profits that she makes.

loans.use: Her loan will enable her produce larger quantity of palm kernel oil for sale.

loans.name: Elsy Marbeli

texts.es:
la joven Elsy Marbeli A. tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la aldea las Cabezas 500 metros al norte de la ciudad de Choluteca. Elsy es una mujer emprendedora y se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años.
Elsy tiene dos cualidades que son responsabilidad y honradez.
Elsy tiene clientes fijos que son el personal que trabaja en la empresa Concresur, los alimenta por todo el mes al credito y a finales de mes le cancelan todo lo que le deben.
Todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para poder tener lista toda la comida que le piden sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para fabricar sus comidas, desea seguir creciendo con su negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Young Elsy Marbeli A. is 20 years old and lives in the hamlet of Las Cabezas, 500 meters north of the city of Choluteca. Elsy is an enterprising woman who has sold food and candies for two years. Elsy has two qualities, which are responsibility and integrity. 

Elsy has steady customers among those who work for the company Concresur.  She feeds them all month on credit, and at the end of the month they pay off all they owe.  She gets up every day at 5 in the morning in order to have all of the food that her customers request ready.  She will use this loan to buy more ingredients for making her dishes.  She hopes to continue to grow her business in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, eggs, tortillas, butter, oil, chicken, cheese, cabbage, potatoes, yucca, tomatoes, onions, garlic, salt, and spices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maqsad

texts.en: Maqsad Q. is 40 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Maqsad sells confectionery and other food items in the market. He has been in this business for 2 years. This activity generates the main income for Maqsad's family. Since Maqsad is very popular in the market, selling fresh and tasty food, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Maqsad requests 1000 AZN for purchasing food inventory to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to increase inventory.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena K. sells palm kernel oil and palm oil at Elmina. Helena has attained junior high level of education.  She is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. She sees to the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of palm kernel and palm fruits to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel and palm fruits to process into oil for sale

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar Q.  is 48-year-old married man with three children. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them. The biggest problem Eldar faces is that pests have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He has been working in agriculture for eight years. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, Eldar applied for 1000 AZN. He already has successful loan history with AqroInvest and KIVA.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena A. cooks banku and serves it with fried fish at Elmina for sale. She is married and takes care of five dependants. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to help her expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize to help her expand her business.

loans.name: Agamammad

texts.en: Agamammad M. has been selling sheep and cattle for 10 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He's the father of three children who all need to be fed and provided with the necessary education. He sells sheep to the local butchers and vendors and, once a week, takes them to sell to the livestock bazaar. One of his main needs is the need to purchase more sheep in order to improve his business. For this reason Agamammad has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase 20 sheep. Previously, he took a loan from AqroInvest through KIVA and he has successfully finished it.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep.

loans.name: Gustavo Victoriano

texts.es:
Gustavo de 45 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. tiene un taller de ebanista y vende y comprar caña y madera.

El comenzó hace varios años con su taller de ebanista para tener dinero suficiente para mantener a toda su familia, poco a poco haciendo muebles pudo comprar cañas para venderlos en la construcciones. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 17h30 haciendo muebles. Una parte de el lugar que alquila el lo utiliza para dale trabajo a jóvenes y que practiquen haciendo muebles. Uno de los inconvenientes con su negocio es que todas las noches tiene que regresar a las 23h00pm para cuidar el la madera hasta las 04h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar madera y libros para la librería que tiene su esposa. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para tener bien asegurado su negocio.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 45 years old and lives in a canton called Playas ["Beaches"].  It is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations and is known for its wide range of seafood.  He has a cabinet-making shop and he also buys and sells cane and wood.

He started his cabinetry shop several years ago, in order to have enough money to sustain his whole family.  Little by little, by making furniture, he was able to buy cane to sell.
