Nowadays, he works from 7:30 AM until 5:30 PM making furniture.  He uses one part of the space he rents to give work to young people, who practice making furniture.  One inconvenience of his job is that every night he has to return to guard his lumber from 11:00PM to 4:00AM.

He wants to use this loan to buy wood, as well as books for his wife's bookstore.  In the future, he would like to buy a piece of land in order to assure the future of his business.

loans.use: to buy wood and books

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Nueva Esperanza “están en el Quinto Ciclo   con 22  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas, realizan actividades para el fondo del grupo en caso de que alguna compañera este con dificultades de pago.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa quien  se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano.
Ella en su casa en un salón que posee expone las ropas que tiene, y así ofrece a sus clientes.
Comenta que hay temporada con buena venta especialmente cuando hay  mercaderías nuevas y variadas ya que atraen la atención de la genta y llegan, preguntan y compran.
Es por este motivo que solicita el préstamo para la compra de fardo de  ropas de segunda.
texts.en:
This group is called “Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"].  They are in their fifth cycle and have 22 members.  The group is known in its neighborhood for the solidarity and responsibility they share.  In case one member struggles to make a repayment, they carry out activities to benefit the group fund.

One member is Ms. Teresa, who sells second-hand clothing.  She has a room in her house where she displays the clothing she has, and this is how she offers it to her customers. She notes that certain times are good for sales, especially when she has new merchandise and a good variety to catch the attention of people who will come, ask questions, and purchase. She is requesting this loan to buy bundles of second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Raquel Nataly

texts.es:
Raquel de 20 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes), vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Comenzó vendiendo productos de uso personal con el código de vendedora de una amiga, poco a poco fue obteniendo clientela y decidió tener su propias ventas. Cuando obtuvo capital para invertir en los productos Yambal comprando cremas, perfumes, desodorantes pudo tener aun mas clientela. En la actualidad cada perfume lo vende desde $ 25.00, cremas desde $ 12.00 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, desodorantes cremas de distintas marcas para surtir mas sus ventas. En el futuro quiere ser lider vendedora en Yambal.
texts.en:
Raquel is 20 years old, she sells Yambal products (Company that offers young entrepreneurial women a start in independent sales), and lives in Orquideas de Guayaquil (urban zone called orquideas because when discovered there were many Orchid flowers).

She started selling personal hygene products using a friend's code and little by little she gained clients, so she decided to sell on her own. When she had investing capital for the Yambal products she purchased creams, perfumes, deoderants, and gained even more clients.  She sells each perfume starting at $25.00, creams starting at $12.00 etc.

She would like to purchase perfumes, deoderants, and brand-name creames to bulk up her sales.  In the future, she wants to become lead salesperson at Yambal.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, deoderants

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.es:
Leopoldina C. procedente de Bogotá  desde hace algo mas de tres años, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla e instaló su propio negocio  de ventas de carnes frías y también  de venta de mercancías  por catálogo, aprovechando sus buenas relaciones con la central de policía que le queda muy cerca a su vivienda y con la clínica de este mismo organismo. Así fue como inició su negocio, al que gradualmente ha ido agregando nuevos clientes y también nuevas mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos.  Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el planea provisionarse  de amplios volúmenes de carnes frías  ya  encargadas para la época de fin de año,  en la que sus clientes preparan las mas deliciosas comidas para celebrar el fin de año. Con este nuevo capital invertido aspira a generar un mayor incremento en sus utilidades,  por el buen número de clientes que han realizado ya sus pedidos y porque es la época en que  Leopoldina compra directamente a las empresas las ofertas de fin de año,  como .
Su sueño es tener una casa propia y adicionalmente exhibir sus productos en una gran miscelánea que le facilite el intercambio comercial. Su mayor desafío fue en su proceso de adaptación  cuando llegó a Barranquilla. Su sueño es,  al lado de su conyugue, lograr una  educación de calidad para sus dos hijos que están en las edades de 7 y 18 años, canalizándoles un futuro lleno de éxitos y prosperidad.
texts.en:
Leopoldina C. arrived from Bogotá a little over three years ago to the city of Barranquilla and set up her own business selling refrigerated meats and also selling merchandise by catalog. She makes good use of her good relations with the police depot which is quite near her living quarters and with the associated clinic. That is how her business got its start. Gradually she has been adding new customers and new merchandise by means of specialized product guides. 

This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use it to supply the large volumes of refrigerated meats which have already been ordered for the end-of-the-year season during which her customers prepare their most scrumptious dishes to celebrate the New Year. With the investment of this new capital she hopes to generate a bigger increase in her profits due to the good number of customers who have already placed their orders and because it is the season in which Leopoldina takes advantage of end-of-the-year deals, buying directly from the companies. 

Her dream is to have her own home and additionally to exhibit her products in a large retail center which would facilitate her business interactions. Her greatest challenge was during the process of adaptation when she arrived in Barranquilla. Her dream is that, along with her husband, she would obtain a quality education for her two children who are 7 and 18 years old, channeling for them a future full of successes and prosperity.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of cold meats such as stuffed turkeys and cold cuts along with delicious sauces

loans.name: Marcelo Ruben

texts.es: Marcelo Rubén se dedica al comercio de cerdo y ganado en pie. El  inicio hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy  gratificante obtener este medio de vida. El negocio lo inicio cuando se caso pues sus padres anteriormente tenían este medio de vida y que necesitaban que Marcelo lo aprendiera para que en el futuro brindara la manutención de su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ganado pues ha recibido muy buenas ofertas y no quiere desperdiciarlas.
texts.en: Marcelo Rubén works selling live pigs and cattle.  He has had this business for more than 11 years and it has been very rewarding to have this means of income.  He began the business when he got married because his parents previously worked in this trade and they needed Marcelo to learn it so that he could support his family in the future.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of cattle because he has received very good offers and doesn’t want to miss them.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. worked as a hair stylist for many years at Ofir’s Beauty Salon in Brownsville. When her boss decided to sell the place in 2007, Maria jumped at the opportunity to buy the business. It has been challenging to manage her own business during this recession but Maria views her ability to sustain the salon as a success. She is grateful for the enthusiastic support she has received in becoming a business owner from her husband, a truck driver, and their four children. Maria is constantly seeking ways  to be innovative with her business and educate herself, and her employees, in new styling techniques. With the economy improving, Maria enjoys the increase in customers and referrals. 

With this loan, Maria plans to move to a larger location and buy new furniture. Before approaching ACCION Texas-Louisiana, Maria tried to access credit through banks. But without an established credit history, she was turned down. Without this loan, Maria would be unable to expand her business. “I am so grateful to ACCION for the work that they do. I am very aware and thankful for the fact that ACCION decided to trust me when other organizations wouldn’t,” she says.

Her advice to small business owners is, “If you give it 100%, you will see that anything is possible.”

loans.use: Relocate to another space and buy new furniture

loans.name: Derma De Lourdes

texts.es:
Derman de 56 años, hace decoraciones y recuerdos de masilla para reuniones, fiestas. Vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil lugar caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes.

Cuando se quedo viuda con sus tres hijos decidió tener su propio dinero haciendo muñecos a base de masilla para fiestas y decoraciones, dándose a conocer a muchas personas comenzó a obtener dinero haciendo decoraciones de todo tipo. Trabaja desde su casa haciendo los adornos por pedido en ocasiones su hija le ayuda cuando tiene demasiado trabajo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar masilla y equipos para hacer mas adornos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando en su negocio, y que su negocio sea bien conocido para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Derma is 56 years old and she makes decorations and keepsakes made from mastic for gatherings and parties. She lives in El Guasmo, a sector of Guayaquil characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants.

When she became a widow with her three children, she decided to make her own money by making mastic-based figured for parties and decorations. She started to make a name for herself among many people and began to make money by making all types of decorations. She works from home making the decorations by request. Her daughter helps her at times when she has too much work.

With the loan, she wants to buy mastic and equipment for making more decorations. In the future, she wants to continue working in this business and wants her business to be well-known to secure her retirement.

loans.use: Mastic, equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John "Eddie" A. started taking apart televisions and putting them back together when he was 9 years old. He naturally gravitated toward mechanics and eventually worked as a manager at several high-end auto corporations in San Antonio. Without ever spending a day in college, Eddie successfully managed these stores and participated in several auto training courses that led him to become an expert in auto electronics, auto body repair, and mechanics. Even though he liked working for these corporations, he could not overcome the fact that he could spend his whole life working for this business and be fired at any point. However, Eddie’s most significant motivation to start his own business was to be able to spend more time with his wife and two children and have guaranteed days off. 

In 1999, he used his savings and opened his business, Audio Express, which focuses on audio, video and security systems in automobiles. The first year was incredibly rough because his store was robbed of all its inventory. He was very close to closing down but was able to persevere through the difficult time. However, his business was in a bad location and with his first ACCION Texas-Louisiana loan, he moved to his current location. With this shift, his business doubled and he is convinced that without this first ACCION loan, he would be out of business, “The microloan enabled us to take our store to another level. We could transition to another location and get more business.”

Eddie accounts his success to his “3 P” rule that he always abides by: “People, product and price.” He always focuses on the customers’ needs first. Even when gas was $4 a gallon, Audio Express did well because of the customer-first focus. When people from the Louisiana coast line evacuated to San Antonio during Hurricane Katrina, Eddie contributed to this cause by repairing their vehicles for free. He even repaired a Saints football player’s car free of charge and did not know who he was until #93 came back with free tickets.  

To prepare for the holiday season, Eddie plans on buying basic inventory with his loan: stereos, radios, and amplifiers. He says, “If we don’t have it, we can’t sell it”. What’s next for Eddie? He is going to pursue marketing his incredibly innovative invention that he cannot disclose at this time.

loans.use: Inventory: stereos, radios, dvd players for cars

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
I. Ali is 55 years old. He is married and has two children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling sheep and large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers and sheep from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his sons and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Ali is thinking about expanding his business because the income from his present herd is not sufficient to provide for his family. He plans to purchase more lambs. To do so, he needs to invest an additional 1000 AZN in his business. In order to obtain this amount, he has applied, for a second time, for a loan from Kiva. Ali has a good client history and has successfully finished his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Ana Felicita

texts.es:
Ana de 49 años, Vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil lugar caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. Elabora y distribuye peluches. 

Siempre le gusto hacer peluche sin tener ninguna remuneración pero al quedar viuda tubo que conseguir dinero y comenzar a vender los peluches y ha fabricar mas. Poco a poco vio que era rentable esta actividad y comenzó a gastar sus ahorros en telas y materiales para elaborar a mayor cantidad los muñecos de peluche. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde muy temprano con dos personas haciendo peluches de caricaturas y repartiéndolos a las diferentes tiendas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, felpa, relleno para elaborar mas peluches. En el futuro quiere que su microempresa crezca económicamente para ser una de las mejores en Ecuador.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old and lives in El Guasmo, a sector of Guayaquil characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants. She makes and distributes stuffed animals.

She always liked making stuffed animals without pay but when she became a widow, she had to make money and began to sell the stuffed animals and make more. Little by little, she saw that this business was profitable and she began to spend her savings on fabrics and materials to make a larger number of stuffed animals. Starting very early, she currently works with two people making stuffed animal cartoons and distributing them to different stores.

With the loan, she wants to buy fabrics, plush, and stuffing to make more stuffed animals. In the future she wants her small business to grow financially to be one of the best in Ecuador.

loans.use: Fabrics, plush, stuffing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba Luz es una mujer  de 59 años,  madre de tres hijos  mayores de edad que vive en el barrio ciudadela 20 de Julio,  donde se conjugan los negocios, construcciones  multifamiliares y los escenarios deportivos mas importantes del  país,  como el Estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla cuna del futbol Costeño.
  Alba Luz es una docente  que en su afán de crear alternativas emprendedoras, inició su  negocio de vender mercancía,  al principio dirigido al gremio de profesores, pero gradualmente se ha extendido a otros clientes entre vecinos, amigos y familiares que van refiriéndole nuevos mercados.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la línea de perfumes y cosméticos, que son los productos que repuntan en las ventas especialmente a final de año, cuando la gente se prepara para engalanarse es  las fiestas familiares, grados escolares, universitarios etc. 
Con este nuevo préstamo aspira  a aumentar su capital de trabajo y lograr la recuperación de sus cuentas por cobrar mas ágilmente, pues en esta temporada hay mucho dinero circulante y ella puede pedir una cuota inicial. Leopoldina  Inició su negocio en el año 1997 y desde entonces ha visto crecer sus ingresos y logrado más oportunidades de apoyo a sus hijos.  Hoy en día su aspiración es ampliarlo inyectando cada vez que pueda,  capital de trabajo y buscando nuevos  clientes, pero sobre todo  sosteniendo los rentables ofreciéndole un servicio efectivo.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is a 59-year-old woman. She is the mother of three older children and lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood where businesses, multi-family housing constructions and the most important sports venues such as the Estado Metropolitano de Barranquilla, the cradle of costal soccer, are combined.

Alba Luz is a teacher who, in her desire to create enterprising alternatives, began her business in selling merchandise. In the beginning, it was directed toward the teachers’ association, but it has gradually been extended to include other customers like neighbors, friends and relatives, who refer her to new markets. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in a line of perfumes and cosmetics, which are the products that pick up in sales, especially at the end of the year when people get dressed up for family, school, and university parties, etc.

With this new loan, she hopes to increase her working capital and be able to recover her accounts by charging more quickly, as there is a lot of money in circulation during this season and she can request an initial payment. Alba Luz started her business in 1997 and since then, she has seen her income grow and has been able to obtain more opportunities to support her children. Today, her hope is to expand her business, adding working capital whenever she can, looking for new clients, and most of all, keeping it profitable and providing and effective service.

loans.use: To invest it in a line of perfumes and cosmetics, which are the products that pick up in sales at the end of the year.

loans.name: Maribel Arcadia

texts.es: Maribel de 47 años, tiene su pequeño negocio que es la venta de comida. Por lo que está ubicado en su humilde vivienda, en donde ofrece una gran variedad de platillos a sus clientes. Cuando pues anteriormente era su Mama quien tenía a cargo el negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo decidió que Maribel se quedara con él para mantener a su 3 hijos menores de edad. Pues ha sido difícil mantener este negocio pues tiene 15 años de tenerlo.   Ella trabaja desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer vendiendo bebidas, gallo pinto, platanitos,  carne asada, maduro frito, queso entre otros ricos platillos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, verduras y bebidas. En el futuro quiere mejorar la fachada de su casa para proporcionárselo a uno de sus hijos.
texts.en: Maribel is 47 years old and has a small food sales business located in her humble home, from which she sells a great variety of dishes to her customers.  Her mother was previously in charge of the business but over time, she decided that Maribel should have it to support her three young children.  It has been difficult to maintain the business and she has had it for 15 years.  She works from very early until it is dark selling drinks, gallo pinto (a typical Nicaraguan dish made of rice and beans mixed together), plantains, roasted beef, fried plantain, and cheese, among other delicious dishes.  With the loan, she wants to buy rice, sugar, vegetables and drinks.  In the future, she wants to improve her home’s exterior to give it to one of her children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Santa María “están en el Séptimo Ciclo   con 23  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas, todas ellas con diferentes actividades y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para el comité, el comité en caso de que alguna de las compañeras necesite.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rosalina quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas.
Ella tiene un salón donde ofrece las bebidas que tiene para la venta y nos comenta que los fines de semana tiene la mayor venta.
Además comenta que el negocio le beneficia bastante ya que la venta de bebidas deja buena ganancia y quiere seguir con la misma.
Su familia le ayuda especialmente los fines de semana ya que abre su negocio hasta altas horas de la noche.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Santa María". They are in their seventh cycle, with 23 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood because they are very close, supportive and responsible among themselves. All of them have different types of activities and some will start new work. They all have an entreprenurial spirit and work to raise funds for the committee, in case one of the members is in needs them.

One of the members is Rosalina, who sells beverages.  She has a place where she sells the beverages and she tells us that on the weekend she has the highest sales. In addition, she tells us that the business really benefits her since selling beverages earns a good income and she wants to continue doing it. Her family helps her, especially on weekends, since she is open until very late.

loans.use: To buy beverages such as soft drinks, wine, beer, and more.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 27  años de edad,  es soltero de profesión abogado, vive  con sus hermanos.
Jesús empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su vecino como mécanico de automóvil, para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios, su padre es de profesión albañil y su madre es peluquera ambos trabajan en la Argentina para ayudarle a sus demás hermanos.
Jesús es un joven muy sacrificado quién siempre tuvo que trabajar para cubrir los gastos de su estudio y tambien ayudarles a sus hermanos menores.
Trabaja en un estudio jurídico con tres de sus compañeros de promoción, cuentan con muy buena clientela formada.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una notebook ya que le será muy útil en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 27 years old. He is single and a lawyer. He lives with his siblings. Jesús started to work when he was very young as a mechanic with his neighbor in order to cover his educatino expenses. His father is a bricklayer and his mother is a hairdresser. Both of them work in Argentina in order to help him and his siblings.  

Jesús is a very hardworking young man who has always had to work to pay for his studies and also to help his younger siblings. He works in a law office with three people he graduated with and they have good clientele. He needs the loan to buy a Notebook which will be very useful in his job.

loans.use: To buy a Notebook

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz de 25 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Desde pequeña ha ella le intereso tener una tienda ya que los padres tenían una. Como se caso muy joven y empezó a tener hijos decidió comprar víveres para venderlos en la ventana de su casa, poco a poco con esfuerzo compro arroz, enlatados, bebidas. En la actualidad tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz por quintal y plátanos para su tienda. En el futuro quiere surtir su tienda para una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is 25 years old. She has a small store in the back part of her house. She lives in Las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area, called Orquideas because when founded there were many orchids). 

Since she was small she was interested in having a store because her parents had one. Since she married very young and started to have children she decided to buy groceries to sell from the window of her house. Little by little, with effort, she bought rice, canned goods and beverages. At present she a small store in the back of her house and works from 6 am until 10 pm every day.

With the loan, she wants to buy a 46 kilo sack of rice and plantains for her store. In the future, she wants to diversify her store for better customer service.

loans.use: Rice, plantains

loans.name: Ruth Elisa

texts.es:
Ruth, es artesana de hamacas y este es el segundo préstamo que solicita para esta misma actividad, ella reside en Delicias de Concepción, tiene 30 años de edad y vive con sus hijos de  11 y 4 años de edad y su esposo, este negocio lo tienen desde hace 5 años.
Ella quiere nuevamente el apoyo del préstamo para compra de Hilo de seda de diferentes colores como material principal e importante para la confección de hamacas, esto ayudara a incrementar su inventario de materiales para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es contar con un negocio estable que le genere los ingresos para estudiar a sus hijos y puedan ser profesionales en un futuro y al mismo tiempo mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ruth makes hammocks and this is the second loan she has requested for this business. She lives in Delicias de Concepción with her husband and two children, aged 11 and 4. She is 30 years old and has been running this business for five years.
She would like the support of another loan to buy silk thread in different colours, as this is the primary material required for making hammocks. It would help her increase her stock of materials and meet the demands of her customers.
Her aim is to have a stable business that generates income so that her children can study and become professionals in the future, and she can also improve her home.

loans.use: To buy silk thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Sergio Ali

texts.es: El Señor Sergio Ali se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, este negocio le ha ayudado a generar ganancias que le ayudan a suplir las necesidades familiares. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. Este negocio lo inicio por una hija que le ayudo con esta actividad, pues ha sido con mucho esfuerzo que ha logrado seguir adelante. El señor aduce, que gracias a Dios su negocio ha estado muy rentable, por lo que su único problema han sido las enfermedades que han atacado a su familia y a él ultimadamente. Actualmente, su sueño más anhelado es tener su propia granja de crianza de cerdos.
texts.en: Mr. Sergio Ali works buying and selling pigs. This business has helped him earn money to supply the basics for his family. That is why he is asking for a loan to buy more pigs. He started this business with the help of his daughter and with a lot of effort he has been able to get ahead. Mr. Ali says that thanks to God his business has been very profitable and his only problem has been the illnesses that he and his family have suffered. His greatest dream is to have his own farm where he can raise pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ingrid Patricia

texts.es:
Ingrid Patricia es una joven mujer dedicada a la venta de gafas, lentes, monturas, estuches,  en un pequeño puesto que tiene a los alrededores de el centro comercial Metrocentro  y muy cercano al  Estadio Metropolitano, cuna del buen futbol de Colombia.
 Ingrid inició en el año 2004 y gradualmente con los financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su persistente trabajo desde las 10:00 A.M. hasta las 9.00 pm diariamente  y de domingo a Domingo,  ha ido creciendo.  Con los créditos ha logrado mejorar la liquidez de su negocio se han incrementado sus ventas y con ello las utilidades pues tiene un capital adicional con el que  responder a la actualización de sus gafas, que es lo que piden sus clientes. El credikiva es  su tercer crédito y con él planea actualizar su inventario y ofrecer modernas gafas y monturas, los cuales son artículos de rápida salida en el mercado que le ofrecen una rotación rápida de su capital y que  con su  compra de contado también puede ofrecer a sus clientes mejores precios.
Ingrid se prepara día a día para aprender a vender lo que sus clientes necesitan y prefieren, por eso registra en su libreta,  lo que ellos piden y ella no tiene.  Sus clientes son los peatones que circulan en el centro comercial pues está ubicada en un corredor comercial muy importante. Su sueño es comprar una casa en el Macro proyecto Villas de San Pablo y está a la espera de encontrar las condiciones para ese propósito.
texts.en:
Ingrid Patricia is a young woman who works selling glasses, sunglasses, frames and cases in a small stand that she has near the Metrocentro shopping area and very close to the Metropolitan Stadium, home of good soccer in Colombia. Ingrid started her business in 2004 and gradually with the financing of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and her persistent work from 10am to 9pm daily from Sunday to Sunday, it has been growing. With the loans she has been able to improve the liquidity of her business and increase her sales and her offerings. She has additional capital in order to update her inventory of sunglasses, which is what her clients ask request. 

The Kiva loan is her third loan and with it she plans to update her inventory and offer more modern sunglasses and frames, which are the items that sell the fastest and which allow her to quickly rotate her merchandise. Since she can buy them with cash she can offer her customers better prices. Ingrid works everyday to learn what her customers need and prefer and for that reason she writes down what they request and what she doesn't have. Her clients are the pedestrians that walk around the shopping center, because her stand is located in a really important commercial corridor. Her dream is to buy a house in Villas de San Pablo and she is waiting for the right conditions in order to do so.

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of glasses and sunglasses

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana de 23 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, está acompañada y reside con su esposo y su hijito de 5 años, su madre y una hermana todos en una misma vivienda ubicada en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán; toda la familia se dedica a este oficio y lo realizan desde hace 5 años confeccionando y vendiendo las hamacas, su hermana además lleva hamacas a mercado de San Miguel para ofrecerlas y venderlas.  Roxana es el segundo préstamo que solicita ya que su negocio ha evolucionado satisfactoriamente por lo que ella sigue impulsándolo con la ayuda de los prestamos, en esta ocasión lo necesita para la compra de hilo de seda ya que este es el material principal para la confección de las hamacas.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio, aumentar sus ganancias que le permita ahorrar para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Roxana is 23 years old and makes hammocks for a living. She lives with her husband, 5-year old son, mother and sister in a house in Delicias de Concepción, a district of Morazán. The whole family works in this trade and have been making and selling hammocks for 5 years. Her sister also takes the hammocks to display and sell at the market in San Miguel. This is Roxana's second loan request, and her business has grown well so she continues to boost it with the help of loans. On this occasion she needs it to buy silk thread, as this is the primary material needed for hammock-making.
Her dream is to expand the business, increase her profits and be able to save to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy silk thread

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, tiene 42 años, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde muy temprana edad, él reside en el cantón Vado Marín perteneciente al municipio de El Transito donde vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos, estos ayudan a don Julio con el trabajo de campo; Él siembra cada año en su propio terreno ya desde muy pequeño se mantiene de esta actividad y por el momento es el ingreso que cubre las necesidades del hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono para la siembra de maíz ya que esto ayudara a fortalecer la plantación y pueda tener mejor y abundante cosecha; su objetivo es dar los cuidados a esta siembra, tener una buena producción para poder vender una parte y generar los ingresos que necesita el hogar.
texts.en:
Julio is 42 years old and has been growing maize since he was very young. He lives in the Vado Marín area of the El Transito district, with his wife and three children, who help Julio with the work in the fields. He sows crops every year on his own plot, and he has supported himself with this work since he was very young. For the moment, the income he earns covers the household costs.
He is requesting a loan in order to buy fertiliser for his maize crops, as this will help to strengthen the plantation and produce a better and more fruitful harvest; his aim is to look after this crop, and get a good yield so that he can sell part of it and generate income for his household.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser for planting maize

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
María de 34 años, Vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). Vende comida a la gente del centro donde vive.

Ha ella siempre le gusto cocinar debido a que es madre soltera tubo que optar por tener su propio medio económico, inicio haciendo almuerzos y vendiéndolo a sus conocidos, poco a poco fue creciendo su clientela. En la actualidad ella tiene un pequeño comedor donde vende almuerzos muy económicos a $ 1.50, hace todo tipo de platos desde las 08h00am comprar los víveres hasta que llega y comienza a prepararlos para el almuerzo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pinturas y bloques para mejorar su negocio ya que la comida la hace en la cocina de su casa. En el futuro quiere adecuar su casa y tener un gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old.  She lives in the “Orquídeas de Guayaquil” (Orchids of Guayaquil).  It is an urban area that got its name because of the many orchid flowers that were there when the area was discovered.  She sells food to people in the center where she lives.

She has always liked to cook.  As a single mother she had to have her own way of earning a living.  She started making lunches and selling them to the people she knows.  Little by little her customer base was growing.  Now she has a small dining room where she sells very economical lunches for $1.50.  She makes all types of dishes starting at 8:00 a.m., when she buys the supplies, and then returns to start preparing the lunches.

She wants to use the loan to buy construction material like cement, paint, and blocks to improve her business.  She makes the food in the kitchen in her house.  In the future she wants to adapt her house and have a beauty parlor.

loans.use: Cement, paint, and blocks

loans.name: Rubia Carolina

texts.es:
Rubia reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 48 años y vive con su esposo y sus hijos, juntos desarrollan el trabajo de siembra de maíz y chile ya que su esposo desde niño practica este oficio siendo el ingreso con el que cuentan para mantenerse y cubrir sus gastos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues desean sembrar en esta época y no cuentan ni con el dinero ni con los materiales para el cuido del cultivo, Este préstamo ayudara a realizar las compras necesarias y que la siembra reciba los cuidados necesarios para su buen desarrollo.
Su proyección es obtener una buena cosecha y poder comercializarla para obtener los ingresos y solventar sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Rubia resides in El Transito area of San Miguel.  She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children. Together they work to grow corn and chile as her husband has done since his childhood.  This is the income they maintain themselves upon and cover expenses.
She has requested a loan for the purchase of compost and fertilizer, as they want to sow this season and have neither the money nor the materials to the care of the crop. This loan will help to make the necessary purchases and ensure the planting care necessary for the crops proper development.
She anticipates a good harvest and to market it for the income to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy compost fertilizer to plant corn and chiles

loans.name: Vilma Ester

texts.es:
la señora Vilma C. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la Aldea la Cabeza del departamento de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de carne de res,  actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años.
Vilma es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable según los vecinos que viven junto a ella, hacen buenos comentarios acerca de su forma de ser, su negocio es muy visitado ya que es la unica persona que destaza en la comunidad.
Vilma cuenta con el apoyo total de su esposo es agricultor.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas carne de res asi tendra mayores ventas y mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma C., age 49, lives in the village of La Cabeza in the Choluteca department.  She sells beef, and she has been doing this for five years.  Vilma is a very hard-working, honorable, and responsible woman according to her neighbors who live near her.  They had good things to say about her way of being.  Her business is much frequented because she is the only person who butchers in the community.

Vilma has total support from her husband, a farmer.

She will use the loan to buy more beef.  That way she will have greater sales and more income.  She needs the income to cover the household expenses and for her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy meat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vera Josefina

texts.es: Vera Josefina tiene 36 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que la distribuye de manera ambulante a personas cercanas. Es importante mencionar que, ya la señora tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio vendiendo poca cantidad de mercancías, pues siempre le ha gustado sufragar los gastos del hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de sabanas, toallas, cosméticos, calzado y ropa. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, de tal forma que siempre este activo y dedicarse a él enteramente y brindar estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vera Josefina, age 36, has two minor children.  She sells general merchandise.  She delivers it in an itinerant manner to people who are nearby.

It is important to mention that she has been in this business for six years.  She started out selling a small amount of merchandise.  She has always liked to help with the household expenses. 

This loan is to buy sheets, towels, cosmetics, footwear, and clothes.  Her dream is to improve her business so that she is always busy and completed devoted to it.  She also dreams of providing her children with financial stability.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia reside en El transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 25 años y posee un comedor que le llama COMEDOR JUANCITO, el nombre es en honor a su hijo de 3 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus hermanos quienes la apoyan en el negocio  desde hace 2 años, el negocio tiene venta de comida, desayunos y almuerzos, por la tarde vende también pupusas y pasteles de papa, trabaja todos los días.
Ella necesita en el comedor un mostrador de comida y comprar mercadería para la preparación de los alimentos por lo que solita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar esta inversión, así tendrá de una mejor manera el mostrador con los diferentes menús que ofrece a los clientes, volviéndolo  más atractivo y con mejor atención.
Las proyecciones de ella es mejorar sus ingresos y crecer con el comedor, atrayendo a más clientes con la esperanza de ampliarlo y mejorar su imagen.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in El Transito, located in the village of San Miguel. She is 25 years old and she has a restaurant named "Comedor Juancito". It is named after her 3-year old son. She is a single Mom and she lives with her siblings who all have all helped with her business for the past 2 years. She caters and also serves breakfast and lunch. In the evenings she makes pupusas and potato patties. She works every day

She needs to have a better stand set up in her restaurant and she needs to purchase ingredients to prepare the foods. She requires a loan to invest in her business. She will have a better stall to serve the various menu items that she offers her clients. It will be more attractive and give her costumers better service.

Her goal is to improve her earnings and to expand her restaurant to attract more clients. She hopes to have a larger restaurant and improve its presentation.

loans.use: To purchase a stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn and fresh fruit.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 43-year-old mother of three who lives with her husband and children in Siquirres, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. She runs a business selling merchandise such as children´s games, cutlery, household products and decorations. Her clients are mostly family members, neighbors, friends and acquaintances who live in her community. This loan will be used to finance the purchase of such merchandise. Sonia wakes up every day at 5:00 AM. After carrying out domestic tasks (preparing breakfast and lunch, cleaning) she goes to work producing bread (another product she sells). In the afternoons, she heads into her community to make sales, collect payments from clients and deliver her products. Her goals are to expand her business and to one day own a central location where she would be able to sell her merchandise (to avoid having to travel so much). 

The loan consultant who has been working with Sonia describes her as a hardworking, amicable, energetic entrepreneur with the ability and inclination to develop and expand her productive activity in an effort to improve her living conditions. Sonia is a dedicated mother and businesswoman.  She makes decisions, for the family and at work, in cooperation with her husband. This will be her second loan with Fundación Mujer. Sonia plans to re-invest her earnings into her business. She says that one of her main obstacles has been the high level of competition that exists in her neighborhood. Sonia is confident that by catering to the specific needs of her clients, and focusing on customer service, she will be able to retain current clients and attract new ones.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as cutlery, decorations and household products.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin R. has been in the refurbishment business as a general handyman for six years, but when the economic climate in the country began to take a downward turn, Kelvin, who immigrated to the U.S. from Guyana 30 years ago, realized that he would need to adjust his business accordingly. 

Seeing an opportunity to move into the “green” building sector, Kelvin changed his business model to installing solar panels and distributing prefabricated low-cost homes made from structure insulated panels.

Recently, Kelvin’s company, R&R Building Material Corp., was invited to put in a bid on a housing project in the Caribbean, which, if successful, would result in a multi-million dollar contract to construct 70 houses.  The project is funded by an IDB loan in an effort to improve the housing sector in a country severely affected by hurricanes. Kelvin hopes to win the bid by setting up a hurricane-resistant model home that is capable of withstanding winds of up to 200 mph, category 9 earthquakes, as well as fire and termite damage. 

Kelvin is using the loan money from ACCION to help buy materials for the model home. This is his first loan from ACCION, and he views it as a first step in a multi-tiered program to grow his business. If Kelvin had been unable to get this loan from ACCION he would have needed to search for another investor, which he believes would have been difficult. The loan from ACCION is manageable for his budget and will allow him to build the model home, as well as place him in a better position to seek future investment from other financial institutions. He has said, “In these economic times, you have to be careful. You have to be sure you are able to carry the debt forward, and this is why it is better for me to start off with ACCION.” 

If R&R Building Material Corp. wins the housing contract, Kelvin will be able to pursue his goal for the company to manufacture its own houses, no longer needing to use their current outside manufacturing source in Alabama. Married with two high school-age children, Kelvin also works nights checking inventory at AT&T in order to supplement his income. He says he has put a lot of emphasis on and capital into getting the Caribbean contract, which he knows will propel his business upward. 

“The loan experience with ACCION has been a pleasant one,” Kelvin states, “ I would recommend it as a great way to access funding for any small business. Hopefully I can realize our dream.”

loans.use: Materials for building model home

loans.name: Jacquelin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jaquelin de 38 años, tiene un puesto de desayunos, es madre soltera con dos niños de 10 y 8 años. Vive en las Orquídeas “Pascuales” de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Inicio su negocio vendiendo empanadas y muchines (son piqueos tradicionales) en las calles de Orquídeas, poco a poco y después de tener dinero tubo la idea de sacar provecho a que viviera por un sector comercial ya que por su casa queda el mercado de “pascuales”. Ubico unas mesas y unas sillas afuera de su casa y comenzo con las ventas de desayunos y piqueos. Poco a poco se le ha incrementado su clientela debido a que la gente del mercado llega muy temprano y sin desayunar. Trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 11h00am todos los dias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas, mesas y una cocina industrial para que la elaboración de los desayunos sea mas rápida. En el futuro quiere tener un local bien adecuado en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jaquelin is 38 years old and has a breakfast stall.  She is a single mother with two children, ages 10 and 8, and lives in Orquídeas “Pascuales” de Guayaquil (an urban zone called Orquídeas, which means orchids, because there were many orchid flowers growing there when the area was discovered).

She started her business by selling empanadas and “muchines” (a traditional bite-sized food) on the streets of Orquídeas.  Little by little, after saving some money, she came up with the idea of opening a stall, since her house was located near the Pascuales marketplace.  She set up some tables and chairs outside her home and began selling breakfast and bite sized food.

Her customer base has increased little by little, because the people in the marketplace arrive very early without having had breakfast.  She works daily from 5:00 AM to 11:00 AM.

She will use the money from this loan to buy tables and chairs and a commercial grade cooker so that she can prepare breakfast faster.  In the future she would like to open a well-stocked eatery in the city center.

loans.use: Tables and chairs

loans.name: Manos Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí se reunieron las mujeres interesadas con el objetivo de  aumentar su capital de trabajo emprendiendo actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, a quienes les pareció interesante por ser una  oportunidad crediticia muy buena.
El comité lleva por nombre Manos Emprendedoras, las cuales debido a que todas las integrantes coinciden de que ésta oportunidad les servirá para progresar, actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, integrada por  12   emprendedoras señoras, quienes se esmeran periódicamente para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Todas las personas son muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria C. quien se dedica a la confección de artesania, como fabricación de  frazadas y hamacas de hilos de algodón para esta epoca de primavera – verano.
Ella y otras integrantes se dedican a esta actividad y lo fabrican en forma continuada ya que tienen muchos clientes que solicitan para volver a vender en otras ciudades.
Esta muy satisfecha con su grupo ya que mediante ella puede obtener el crédito que facilita la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de sus artesanias.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari women meet up who are interested in increasing their capital by setting out to do productive work. From there we coordinate the meetings to inform those who were interested about the program since it is a great loan opportunity.

The committee is named Enterprising Hands since all of the members agree that this opportunity will help them progress. Currently they are in their sixth loan cycle. The group is made up of 12 enterprising women who always do their best to increase their income hence they can offer the best to their families.

All of these individuals are hardworking and have invested their loans in their respective activities. One of the members is Mrs. Maria C. who makes traditional artwork such as blankets and hammocks from cotton for the spring and summer seasons.

She and other members are dedicated to this job since they have many clients that come back to buy and sell in other cities. She is very satisfied with her group since she is able to obtain the loan that helps her buy raw material to make her artwork.

loans.use: To buy various colors of cotton string.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
María Berta tiene 62, es una señora  muy trabajadora y reside en el municipio Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután,  tiene una panadería desde hace más de 10 años y trabaja con su familia todos los días, este negocio lo heredo de su madre, Doña Berta quiere invertir en su panadería pero no cuenta con los recursos para hacerlo, por este motivo ella Solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en activo fijo para su negocio. 
Este préstamo ayudara a solventar los problemas de producción que presenta la panadería, aumentando las posibilidades de generar mayores ganancias.
Doña María quiere ser buen cliente y contar con estas oportunidades por mucho tiempo ya que de esta manera ella podrá mejorar las condiciones de la panadería y estabilizara sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria Berta is 62 years old. She is a very hard working woman who lives in the municipality of Jiquilicso in the community of Usulutan. She has had a baker for the past 10 years and she works together with her family every day. She inherited her business from her mother. Berta wants to invest in her bakery but she doesn't have the financial resources to do so. She therefore requests a loan to invest in her business.

This loan will help her with the production problems she has faced in her bakery. This will bring new opportunities and create better earnings.

Berta wishes to be a good client to ensure she has these opportunities for the future. She will be able to improve her bakery with this help and stabilize her income.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing: blouses, t-shirts, skirts, and men's shorts

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel, reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, tiene 63 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijas y se dedica a la venta de medicinas desde hace 15 años trabajando todos los días con la ayuda de su esposa, él necesita invertir en el negocio y para eso solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar más medicinas para ofrecer a los clientes.
Este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer su inventario de medicinas y cubrir con la demanda, ya que este producto siempre es buscado por las personas y si  posee para distintas clases de enfermedades así como vitaminas, contara con la preferencia de sus clientes.
Don Manuel quiere tener un buen historial crediticio y seguir recibiendo de esta ayuda para invertir en su negocio y poder obtener más ganancias que solventen sus necesidades y las de su hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Concepcion Batres in the community of Usulutan. He is 63 years old and he lives together with his wife and daughters. He has been selling medicines for the past 15 years, working every day alongside his wife. He needs to invest in his business and to this end he requests a loan. He will purchase more medicines to offer his clients.

This loan will help him supplement his inventory of medicines and fill customer demand. His products are always in demand by his clients, especially because he has products for various kinds of ailments, including vitamins. He caters to his clients' preferences.

Manuel wants to maintain a good credit history to always be eligible for loans to invest in his business. He will obtain better earnings that will help him provide for his needs and those of his homestead.

loans.use: To purhcase medicines for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yolanda Median de 72 años viuda y madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 41 a 54 años. Vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica a la elaboración de  muñecos de trapo y también vende mercancías variada mediante guías especializadas de productos.  Desde que le ofrecieron un curso de manualidades no dejó de confeccionar  muñecos, porque Yolanda es apasionada por esta   actividad que además le ha ayudado a generar ingresos, al mismo  tiempo que amparada en su clientela inicial, estimuló su vinculación al comercio mediante catálogos de productos. Ella es una comerciante ejemplar, transparente en sus negociaciones y esto le ha generado reconocimiento, por eso coordina un pequeño grupo de 3 vendedoras y también ha logrado buenos contratos con su muñequería. Este es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  espera comprar telas y rellenos para fabricar muñecas encargadas para el 24 de Diciembre, fecha en que se celebra el nacimiento del niño Dios y   los niños esperan sus regalos del cielo; por eso Yolanda aprovecha para sacar sus mejores diseños y también para comprar la oferta de los productos en descuento que traen sus catálogos. Su sueño aun es perfeccionar su arte y lograr mayor dedicación y crecimiento de sus dos negocios, aunque su gran desafío es el poco dinero con el que cuenta y esta es la razón de recurrir a su credikiva para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda Median is a 72 year old widow. She is the mother of 4 children, ages 41 to 54. She lives in the city of Cartagena and is engaged in the manufacture of cloth dolls. She also sells varied merchandise by means of specialized catalogues.

Since being offered a handicrafts course Yolanda hasn’t stopped making dolls because she is passionate about this activity. In addition, it has helped her generate income. While maintaining her initial clientele, she added to her customer base by means of product catalogues.

She is a model businesswoman, transparent in her dealings, and this has generated recognition. That’s why she coordinates a small group of three saleswomen and also has obtained good contracts with her doll making business.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she hopes to buy fabric and stuffing for dolls ordered for December 24, the date on which the birth of the son of God is celebrated and children await their Christmas gifts. This is the time when Yolanda puts out her best designs and also the time for the purchase of products offered at a discount in her catalogues. Her dream is to improve her art and achieve dedication and growth of her two businesses. Her greatest challenge is the small amount of money which she has, and this is the reason for resorting to a Kiva loan in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and stuffing for making dolls which have been ordered.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying 80 lbs. of fish, 1 quintal of rice, 50 sacks of charcoal, 80 lbs. of beef, 100 lbs. of yuca, 60 lbs. of malanga, 80 lbs. of chicken and 100 units of coconuts

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de esposo Catalino de 54 años, y de su nieto de 12 años, a quien ella cría como si fuera su propio hijo. Esta dama es muy emprendedora, y siempre esta en la búsqueda de negocios que le permitan obtener ganancias, de esta manera ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de calzado, de manera ambulatoria, tiene contactos al norte del país que le mandan los pedidos y ella los comercializa  a mayor precio en la capital. Lo que no le gusta de su negocio es que muchas veces brinda a crédito su mercadería, y algunos clientes se atrasan en el pago, y por eso prefiere vender sus calzados al contado. Además como es empeñosa obtiene considerables ganancias semanales que le permiten ostentar una buena calidad de vida. Para el futuro desea instalar una vitrina en su casa para ofrecer ahí también su mercadería; y esta muy animada pues se acerca la temporada de verano y ya tiene pedidos de sandalias. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en diversos zapatos y sandalias, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes y espera cumplir con todos, de esta manera calcula que aumentaran sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and lives in her own house, along with her husband, Catalino, who is 54 years old, and her 12 year-old grandson, who she has raised as if he were her own son.  She is a very enterprising woman, always in search of businesses that will allow her to earn income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.  For five years now, she has sold all types of shoes as an itinerant vendor.  She has contacts in the north of the country who send her orders to her, which she sells at the best price in the capital.  One thing she dislikes about her business is that she often offers her merchandise on credit, and some customers fall behind on their payments.  For this reason, she prefers to sell her shoes for cash.  Also, since she is hard-working, she earns substantial weekly income that makes is possible for her to pull off a good quality of life.  In the future, she hopes to install a showcase in her house so she can offer her merchandise there as well.  She is also excited because the summer season is approaching and she already has orders for sandals.

This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She promises to comply with her repayment schedule in a punctual manner, as she does not want to look bad to those who are making it possible for her to have the money to continue progressing.  María plans to use the loan she is requesting to purchase some merchandise (a variety of shoes and sandals).  She has various orders pending and hopes to fill them all, and in this way, to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to stock up on shoes and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, American rice, sugar, oil, La Lechera milk, eggs, chicken and soap.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Don Roberto, es un señor trabajador con espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado a ser un comerciante con mucho movimiento, tiene 50 años de edad y reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia, el movimiento de su negocio se da porque ofrece la mercadería en su vehículo y se transporta a los pueblos cercanos buscando clientes para vender  sus productos; él transporta Maíz, Mariscos y Ropa, ofreciendo de todo un poco su único impedimento es que se le terminan los fondos para volver a invertir por este motivo él Solicita un préstamo que le ayude a solventar esta situación, su propósito es aumentar los inventarios de cada producto que ofrece.
El objetivo como comerciante es proporcionar a los clientes lo productos que necesita es por eso que ofrece varios artículos en su vehículo, para su familia él tiene como objetivo propiciar los ingresos necesarios para su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Roberto is a hard working person with an entrepreneurial spirit. He is a merchant with a great deal of energy. He is 50 years old and he lives in Jiquilisco, in the community of Usulutan. He lives with his family. He is very mobile in his business because he distributes his goods in a car and visits the near-by villages in search of clients to buy his products. He transports corn, seafood and clothing. He sells a little bit of everything with his only obstacle being that he runs out of capital funds to reinvest. He requests a loan to help him with this situation. His goal is to increase his merchandise products for resale. 

As a merchant he endeavors to provide his clients with the products that they need, which is why he sells various products from his car. For his family, he wants to generate enough income to provide for their well-being and their development.

loans.use: To purchase corn, seafood and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy men's underwear, children's underwear, American rice, oil, eggs and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase couch covers, colognes, umbrellas, perfumes, women's sandals, and hair conditioner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purhcase children's clothing

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es:
Verónica de 38 años, vive en las Orquídeas “Pascuales” de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). Tiene una pequeña tienda de pañales y bisutería.   

Hace un año atrás ella quedo viuda  con sus tres hijos, para poder tener ingresos y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos invirtió sus ahorros en pañales, papelería, bisutería para tener su propios negocio. En la actualidad tiene su pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, pañales, vitrinas para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un boutique en otra ciudad.
texts.en:
Veronica is 38 years old and lives in the Orquideas Pascuales de Guayaquil (an urban area called The Orchids because there were many orchids here when it was discovered).  She runs a small general store where she sells diapers and jewelry.

A year ago, she was widowed and left alone to care for her 3 children.  In order to generate an income and provide for her children, she invested her savings in diapers, paper supplies and jewelry to run her own business.  Now she has a small general store that she runs out of her home; she works from 7 am to 10 pm everyday.

She will use the loan to buy fabric, diapers, and glass displays to stock her business.  In the future, she would like to run a boutique in another city.

loans.use: Fabric, diapers, glass displays

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 52-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband and children in Cariari, Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. Lourdes runs a sewing business where she provides alterations and produces specific items such as socks, curtains, bathroom towel sets and bed sheets. Lourdes also rents out tablecloths for special events.  Her clients are mainly friends, neighbors and acquaintances who live in her community. The loan consultant who has been working with Lourdes has described her as a humble, hard working entrepreneur with a strong drive to succeed. This will be her first individual loan with Fundación Mujer. Her business is in need of an injection of working capital in order to satisfy the demands of her existing clients.

Lourdes carries out her sewing projects in her home where she has a workshop. She plans to use this loan to invest in threads, fabric, casings and other necessary sewing materials. At the moment, she is behind in production and needs more materials to be able to complete her orders. In general, she wakes up early to carry out domestic tasks such as preparing meals for her family and cleaning the house. Afternoons are dedicated to her business, sewing, selling or collecting payments from clients. Lourdes generally goes to sleep late at night. 

A main goal for Lourdes is to become financially independent. She wants to be able to reap the benefits of her labor and expand her business without holding debts. In order to accomplish this goal, she plans to start saving some of her revenues. Some of her main challenges have been to start advertising and find an affordable source of hired labor.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials (threads, fabrics, casings).

loans.name: Yvonne Paola

texts.es:
Yvone de 29 años, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  aunque esta divorciada ella sigue trabajando para sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años. 

Ahorro dinero para poder comprar productos y venderlos con un precio adecuado y así mantener a sus dos hijos. Realiza su trabajo sola, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar los estudios de enfermería y ampliar su negocio con un local.
texts.en:
Yvone is 29 years old and sells Yambal products (a business that offers entrepreneurial women the opportunity to begin their own business as independent saleswomen); though she is divorced, she works hard to support her 2 children who are 2 and 7.

She saved money to buy products and sell them at a good price to support her children.  She runs her business by her self and works from very early each morning offering her products to her neighbors and friends.  She sells perfumes that range in price from $20 to $75 each.

She will use this loan to buy more Yambal products like perfumes, creams, lotions, and deodorants.  In the future, she would like to finish her nursing degree and expand her business with a storefront.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams and lotions, and deodorant

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Se acerca el 11 de Noviembre, día de la Independencia de Cartagena de Indias y se conmemora con  diversos eventos historicos; en estos días tambien ocurre el reinado nacional de la Belleza Colombiana y los Cartageneros y colombianos en general, viven esta celebración con festines en todas las calles de la ciudad heroica y derroche de gran alegría carnavalera, porque alli se esta escogiendo a la mujer mas bella de Colombia. Es aqui donde suscita el espiritu emprendedor de Armando, pues el, siempre conciente de las oportunidades,  aprovecha para vender productos de gran rotación por la ocurrencia de estos eventos; así que está solicitando su credikiva para comprar espumas para el carnaval, camisas adornadas de múltiples colores gorras disfraces y atuendos de acuerdo con la época. 
Armando Cárdenas vive en el barrio Zaragocilla de la ciudad de Cartagena, él es un cliente leal de la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización donde ha recibido 11 créditos para fortalecer su negocio llamado “Comercio el Baratero” que inició en el año 1982 y se ha destacado por hacer crecer su microempresa a punta de interpretar lo que cada temporada requiere, así ha logrado dar educación a sus tres hijos que hoy están en las edades de 30 a 40 años y son profesionales y técnicos destacados. Con su vinculación a los programas de la Fundación ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo lo que le ha servido para mejorar su vivienda y generar mayores opciones de venta oportuna. Su sueño es construir su casa de dos pisos dejando un local para sus variedades de mercancías dando curso a su sueño:  " Tener un gran almacen".
texts.en:
November 11th is fast approaching; it is Independence Day for Cartagena de Indias where the people commemorate a number of historic events.  Also, this is the time of the Colombian National Beauty pageant and the people of Cartagena and Colombians in general celebrate this time with huge parties in all the city streets.  They are very excited to see who will be chosen as the most beautiful woman in Colombia.  This is what gives rise to the enterprising spirit of Armando.  He is always aware of his opportunities and takes advantage to sell products that are important during these events.  He is seeking a loan through Kiva to buy foams for Carnaval, multi-colored shirts, hats, costumes and other outfits for the occasion.

Armando C. lives in the Zaragocilla neighborhood of Cartagena; he is a faithful customer of the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo through which he has received 11 loans to build his business called Comercio el Baratero which he started in 1982.  He stands out for building his business by understanding what the people want in each season.  He has used his business to provide education for his 3 children who are now in their 30s and 40s and are successful professionals.  With his ties to the Foundation's programs, he has been able to increase his working capital which has helped him to improve his home and generate more sales leads.  His dream is to build a 2 story home with a storefront where he can sell his goods and let him leave out his dream of "having a large warehouse."

loans.use: Buy shaving cream and foams for Carnaval, multi-colored shirts, hats, costumes, and other seasonal outfits

loans.name: Francisco Alejandro

texts.es:
Francisco de 26 años, tiene una pequeña panadería en su casa, en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).

Escogía tener una panadería ya que hace muchos años atrás aprendió a hacer panes y no quería desperdiciar ese talento. Compro un horno y  harina para comenzar con la panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad vende pan en su pequeño local que tiene en su casa trabaja desde las 05h00am haciendo pan hasta las 00h00pm que cierra el negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina y una refrigeradora para las bebidas que quiere vender en su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su panadería.
texts.en:
Francisco is 26 years old and he runs a bakery in his house, located in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered).

He chose to engage in bakery because he leaned how to bake bread many years ago, and he did not want to waste this experience. To start his baking activity he bought flour and an oven that he put in the front part of his house. He currently sells bread in a small room of his house, where he works backing bread form 5 am until 12 pm when he closes the shop.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy flour and a fridge for the drinks he wants to sell in his bakery. In the future he wants to own a bigger bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour and a fridge.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael C. un hombre muy alegre que vive en el municipio de Malambo con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 15 y 17 años. El es un gran trabajador que aprendió el oficio de electrónica hace 15 años en una academia y con el fin de mantener a su familia emprendió el sueño de tener un negocio propio;  así fue como nació el taller de reparación de electrodomésticos,  inicialmente trabajando en el municipio de soledad y hoy está radicado en Malambo;  allí no solo ofrece el servicio sino que vende también electrodomésticos de segunda entre sus vecinos y en general a toda la comunidad malambera que se han convertido en sus principales clientes.
Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación y con este financiamiento comprará electrodomésticos de segunda y repuestos para reparar los  artefactos dañados que le  lleven sus clientes.  Con los créditos se le ha dado facilidad  la compra de las mercancías e insumos que requiere para hacer el mantenimiento o reparación del electrodoméstico. Rafael espera continuar creciendo de la mano de esta organización, porque  su sueño es adquirir una vivienda propia y ver a sus hijos terminar en la universidad. Su mayor desafío se presenta a principios del año, porque se disminuyen sus ventas,  pero el se prepara ahorrando para cuando llegue esta época, porque algún día espera  lograr una buena ubicación de su punto de servicio  en su casa propia
texts.en:
Rafael C. is a very cheerful man who lives with his wife and their two children (ages 15 and 17) in the municipality of Malambo.  He is a hard worker who went to school to learn the electronics trade 15 years ago.  With the goal of supporting his family, he undertook his dream of having his own business.  This is how his home electronics repair shop was born.  At first, he worked in the Soledad municipality, and now his shop is located in Malambo.  He not only offers repair services there, but he also sells secondhand home electronics.  His neighbors and the community of Malambo in general have become his customers.

This is his third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will buy secondhand home electronics with this loan, as well as spare parts for repairing the damaged devices that his clients bring in.  The previous loans have made it easier for him to purchase merchandise and the parts needed to maintain or repair home electronics.  Rafael hopes to continue growing with the help of this organization, because his dream is to buy his own home and to see his children finish university.  He faces his greatest challenge at the beginning of the year, when sales drop.  However, he has prepared by saving for this period, because one day he hopes to have a good spot to run his shop out of his own home.

loans.use: to buy used home electronics, as well as spare parts for repairing his customers' broken devices

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La Señora Luz C. es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive en la comunidad de Buena Esperanza que pertenece a la parroquia de Ricuarte. Ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca, su población se dedica a agricultura y cría de animales, también trabajan en diferentes ocupaciones en la ciudad de Cuenca. Su iglesia es un atractivo turístico así como la gastronomía que se prepara en el sector.

Doña Luz tiene 64 años, es casada y  tiene 7 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, seis de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Luz tiene una licorería hace 40 años, la misma que atiende de lunes a domingo pero solo en las noches. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y las vende en su comunidad.  Cría gallinas y cuyes, que son para el consumo de la casa o los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 4 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, el nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de licores para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud para trabajar y así crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Luz C. is a member of the Las Flores community bank.  She lives in the community of Buena Esperanza which is in Ricuarte parish.  Situated in the north-east of Cuenca canton, the inhabitants of her village are crop farmers and livestock farmers.  They also work in a number of different jobs in the city of Cuenca.  Their local church is a tourist attraction as is the fine food that they make in the region.

Luz is 64 years old.  She is married and has 7 children who are all grown up.  Six of them are married and live independently.  Her son who is single works and helps her financially.  Her husband farms and thanks to their joint work they have managed to build their own home.

Luz has had a liquor store for 40 years.  She works there from Monday to Sunday but only in the evenings.  She also farms.  She sows vegetables and sells them in her community.  She also raises hens and guinea pigs which are eaten by her family or sold when they have a financial need.

She has been a member of the community bank for 4 years and the loans have been useful for her business.  She will use the new loan to buy liquor for her business.

Her dream is to continue to look after her health so that she can work and thereby grow her business.

loans.use: To buy liquor

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer comerciante, dedicada al trabajo, madre de tres hijos, casada. Su negocio es una pulpería en donde lleva varios años trabajando, negocio que comenzó con poco y que gracias a su tenacidad y empeño ha logrado evolucionar y con los financiamientos de Afodenic, que fue el paso para crecer.
Ahora cuenta con más  productos, ya que invirtió en ropa interior, cosméticos, sandalias y proporciono más granos básicos.
Con este financiamiento comprara: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, golosinas, carnes, pollo, lácteos así como ropa interior, cosmético. Logrando a si mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Luz is a merchant dedicated to work.  She is married and has three children.  Her business is a grocery store that she has had in operation for many years.  She started out with little and thanks to her tenacity and dedication has managed to evolve and with Afodenic loans had the means to grow.

She now stocks more products because she invested in clothing, cosmetics and sandals and also more basic grains.

She will use this loan to buy sugar, rice, beans, corn, sweets, meats, chicken and dairy products as well as underwear and cosmetics hoping thereby to improve sales.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, snacks, meats, chicken and other products to improve sales.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive en la parroquia de Ricuarte. Ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca, su población se dedica a agricultura y cría de animales, también laboran en  diferentes áreas de trabajo en la ciudad de Cuenca, su iglesia es un  atractivo turístico así como la gastronomía que se prepara en el sector.
