loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima lives in a city called Gujranwala with her family in a small house. Gujranwala is famous in Pakistan for its dairy industry.  She is a housewife who stays at home and fulfills her household responsibilities. She is a mother of three sons. Her eldest son is 9 years old and studying in 5th class. The next to him reads in 4th class and the youngest has not started to attend school yet. 

Saima's husband is a driver by trade and drives a rickshaw. He provides transport services to his passengers. He starts work around 9am and ends at 7pm. In this way, he drives for ten hours continuously. He has been in this business for the past five years. He is the only breadwinner of his family and that makes him more serious about his responsibilities. 

Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy a new rickshaw because the old rickshaw has become rough and never allows him to drive maximum hours which is affecting his earnings as well. 

Saima is hoping that with the new rickshaw he will be able to double his income and provide transport services to many more passengers. She is a new loan user of Asasah and she hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: 18.05.009 Group

texts.en:
Thiết N. Thị  (99), a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Thiết, is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 009-Quảng Hưng (18.05.009).

Thiết is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Thiết owns & operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Thiết has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thiết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thiết has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Mai (88) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Dung (97) is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. Thị Thắm (98) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  L. Thị Hằng (100) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thiết N. Thị  (99) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thiết là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 009-Quảng Hưng (18.05.009).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thiết thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thiết kiếm được khoảng 6800000 VND.  Vào 2008, Thiết đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thiết đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Mai (88) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Dung (97) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. Thị Thắm (98) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  L. Thị Hằng (100) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie O. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Melanie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods and other types of snack products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nighat Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Nighat Perveen is a resident of Gujranwala which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its dairy industry. She is a 44-year-old widow who lost her husband as a result of a heart attack a few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her because all responsibilities were now shifted on her shoulders. But she never loses hope and decided to start an embroidery business using skills she learned from her mother as a teenager.

Nighat Perveen couldn’t educate both her sons due to poor financial circumstances, but she taught the art of embroidery to her younger son who now rents a shop in the nearby market and runs an embroidery business. Her eldest son works in a factory for a low income. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, her son will buy an embroidery machine which will enable him to work better and fulfill larger orders on time. Nighat Perveen is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan experience. She hopes that this will be a long-term relationship and she will continue getting Asasah support in the future.

In the photo, the lady who holds a book (an Asasah passbook) in her hands is Nighat Perveen.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Mrs. Suos S. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has four school-aged children. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year in both the rainy and dry seasons. 

Presently, Mrs. Suos S. says that her cow is getting old, and it doesn’t support her field work. Therefore, Mrs. Suos S. is looking for a loan to buy a cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a cow to replace the old one

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene E.'s main source of income comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She is 50 years old, married and has six school-aged children. They are from the city of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. Irene has been in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Irene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Raf'uddin

texts.ru: Ашуров Рафъуддин проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Рафъуддин имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает дыню и арбуз. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Raf'uddin A. lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Raf'uddin has a secondary education.  He has been involved in sales for over 6 years.  He primarily sells cantaloupes and watermelons.  He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Fatalisho

texts.ru: Сарбаландов Фаталишо проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена работает в средней школе учительницей. Сам Фаталишо имеет средне - техническое образование, бухгалтер-технолог. По профессии не работал. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него продуктовый магазин. Кроме того Фаталишо занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 18 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Fatalisho S. lives in the A. Jomi district.  He is 44 years old, married and has 6 children.  His wife works as a teacher at a secondary school.  Fatalisho has a secondary-technical education, as an accountant-technologist.  He never worked in that field.  He is currently involved in retail sales and has a food store.  Besides this, Fatalisho is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for future resale.  He has been involved in this business for 18 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives with her family in a two-room brick house in Pakpattan, a small city located in Punjab Pakistan that is known for its sugar production. Zarina has three children, a five-year-old daughter studying in class one and two sons who are not yet of school-going age. Her husband has been a scrap dealer for six years, earning good profit. Zarina is 32 years old and sells clothes to share the financial burden with her husband. She purchases clothes from a wholesale market and sells them to a good number of local clients in the area.

Zarina, a new applicant, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy more scrap for additional profits.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Jannaqt Liaqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Jannat Liaquat A. lives in Pakpattan, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its sugar production. She lives in the area named 20SP in a three-room brick house with her family. She is a housewife, stays at home and helps her husband in his dairy business.
 
Her husband has some buffalo at home from which he gets milk. Jannat supports her husband by taking care of his buffalo and giving them food and water on time. She is a very supportive and active lady who is always ready to support her family.
  
Her husband has a good reputation among his customers. He has obtained a good customers base in a three-year period. He sells them good quality milk and earns a good profit. He sells 1 kg of milk for 45 PKR. His sales allow him to manage the financial expenses of his family.  

Jannat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo, which will increase the production of milk and help him to serve more customers and make more income.
 
Jannat is hopeful that an additional buffalo will increase her husband's profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Jannat.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom A. S. is a resident of Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan that is famous for its sugar production. She has a two-room brick house there and lives in it with her family. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She not only manages her household responsibilities well, but also contributes to her family financially by selling shawls. She has adopted this part-time business to help her pay the utility bills.
 
Her husband, A. S., is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a business of selling cement. He receives orders from different construction companies and earns a profit by filling them. He has been serving his clients for the past eight years, and by providing them good quality cement he has gained their loyalty. His earning allows him to smoothly run the finances of his family.
 
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy cements packs in bulk quantity that will enable him to fulfill the orders of his customers in a timely manner.
  
Kalsoom is confident that with the help of this investment, her husband’s income will be increased and her family will be enjoy a better standard of living. 
She is a new loan applicant and hopes the loan will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy cement packs in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 58 years old. Erlinda is married and has one grown child. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling canned goods and snacks in the local community. She also makes and sells  sausage or longganisa. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa B. is a 30-year-old single man who lives with his mother and brothers and sisters in the Songinohairhan district of UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His mother is retired and two of his siblings currently work in a private company, while his two twin siblings both attend university. As the oldest son, Amarsanaa is head of the household and responsible for his entire family. 

Amarsanaa has been operating a dairy business with the help of his mother since 1995 and has built a stable and successful operation. He has 16 milk cows at his home that produce the milk he sells. On average, his cows can produce about 30 liters of milk per day. He sells each liter of milk for 700 MNT to the two grocery shops with which he has supply contracts. His future goal is to increase the number of his milk cows as well as to raise his income. Amarsanaa is a very honest and deliberate man who says, "For the future, I plan to expand my cow farm." He is requesting a 2000000 MNT loan to purchase hay to feed his cows.

loans.use: To purchase hay to feed his cows

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R. is from the village of San Jose. She is 42 years old. Gina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina plants and harvests rice for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 37000 PHP per crop.

In 2006, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Gina is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the tenth loan Gina has taken from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive S., age 34, has a mini-restaurant business. She serves a variety of different meals, such as chicken and pork adobo, afritada, and fried fish. Olive has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. She has four school-aged children and lives in the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. 

Earlier this year, Olive joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Olive is requesting her first loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Munhnasan

texts.en:
Munhnasan S. owns and operates a clothing production business in her town. She designs and produces a wide variety of clothing items. She started this business in 2004 and has gained much experience as a seamstress. Her business is very popular in her community and she has built a positive reputation amongst her customers. In the future, Munhnasan hopes to further grow her business and use her earnings to purchase a fence and house for her family. 

She is requesting an 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more fabrics and materials for her sewing business. 										
Munhnasan lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in a rented yard. Her son, age 18, attends university and her husband works as a salesman.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Sherry Mae

texts.en:
Sherry Mae A., age 35, buys and sells canned goods, instant noodles, detergent powders, and other products in her sari-sari (variety) store. Sherry Mae has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. She and her husband have three school-aged children and live in the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. 
   
Earlier this year, Sherry Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Sherry Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sherry Mae is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Dorjzodov

texts.en:
Dorjzodov T., age 34, operates a dairy trade business with the help of his wife at the local market in their town. He started his business in 2005 by selling a variety of consumer goods in a rented stall at the Tansag department store in the province, and moved his business to the local market in 2009. Dorjzodov purchases his dairy products from farmers in the surrounding countryside and sells them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is able to earn 4,000,000 to 5,000,000 MNT over a day of sales. In addition, his success has enabled him to purchase a new van for his family usage. 

He has recently purchased a large lot of dairy products worth 2,000,000 MNT; therefore, his working capital has decreased and limits future procurement of products for sale. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale prices. 	

Dorjzodov is a hardworking businessman who lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His son attends a local secondary school. For the future, he says, "My goal is to expand my business."

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale prices

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Bangon, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Ramon, who is 55 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 18 and 31 years old. Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to buy stock of goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Wilma B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Diodivina

texts.en:
Diodivina S. earns her living by operating two business ventures: running a a general store, and buying and selling charcoal. Her husband, Jose Allan S., age 49, works as a laborer and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children in their twenties and live in Ilaya, Oguis, Danao, Cebu. 

Diodivina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Diodivina has been working hard and incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,400, which helped to improve the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks of charcoal and goods to offer for sale in her general store so that she can continue to save up, expand her business, and imporive her family's living conditions.

Diodivina S. is truly a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. "Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through this alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities beyond their imagining. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy stocks of charcoal and goods to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela A. is a married woman who lives in Luyong Baybay, Brgy. Tacup, San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing and fish vending. Her husband, Felix A., who is 53 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are aged between 23 and 28.
Estela joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Estela has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 11,200 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing 14,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase a fishing net so that she is able to continue to save up for the future education of her granddaughter and for house repair.
Estela A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda T. is from the village of San Jose. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per cropping.
In 2007, Criselda joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is an ambitious woman from Jenin and wanted to start a poultry farm with her husband and brother. Maha is a mother of three sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee and has a small number of chickens he raises and sells. Maha wanted to expand the project and have a farm.

Maha took a $1,000 loan from FATEN to purchase stalls, chicks and feed because the space is available. Maha wants to create a stable source of income for her family as well as for her brother, who appears in the picture because she is not comfortable with having her picture online.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm

loans.name: Ruhim

texts.ru:
Ruhim A. 30 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, sin kotoromu 5 let i doch kotoroy 3 qoda. Ruhim yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, poselok Bala Behmenli vmeste s semyoy. 

Ruhim  uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. Eto uje vtoroy ssud Rihima v perviy raz on  bral 1000$ ,za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lenderam. Seychas je kak vi videte na fotoqrafii Ruhin imeyet noviy svoy bizness i seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya biznessa.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/7355
texts.en:
Ruhim A. is 30 years old.  He is married and has 2 children: 5-year son and 3-year-old daughter.  Ruhim is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the Bala Behmenli village in the Fuzuli region together with his family.

Ruhim has been involved in the animal husbandry business for 2 years.  This is Ruhim's second loan.  He first borrowed $1000 and is very grateful to the lenders for this credit.  Currently, as you can see in the photograph, Ruhim has a new business and needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle for developing his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is from the village of Purok 6, Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, Lucila runs a coconut-buying business. To provide another source of income she has a motorcycle transportation business in her local communtiy. Lucila has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In June 2009 Lucila joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has previously repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP and is now requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP. This will be her fifith loan from PMPC, and will be used to purchase additional inventory for her business. She will use the profits from her loan to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann Y., 55, grows and sells mango trees in Kandal province. She is married with two children, one of whom is a student and the other of whom is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. She typically makes about $5 USD each day, and would like a loan to create another business for her daughter who works at a garment factory. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to open a hairdressing shop for her daughter. This business will bring her family more profit.

loans.use: To open a hairdressing shop

loans.name: Gelegjamts

texts.en:
Gelegjamts C., age 66, operates a shoe-making business in his town, with the help of his wife. As a younger man, between 1963 and 1998, he used to work as a master in the factory. He has been making a variety of shoes in his home since 2006 and has gained much experience as a manufacturer. 

Gelegjamts is a modest, open-minded, and helpful man who works very hard. He lives with his family in Huvsgul province, Mongolia, in a "ger," which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. For the future, he hopes to have his own workplace and continue providing for his family. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials used in making his shoes.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials for shoe-making

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., age 60, is a widow who lives with her three grown children in the Kandal province. She prepares and sells fried bananas, typically making about US $2 of profit a day. She is also supported by her three children, who are garment factory workers. 

Bun S. would like to take out a loan of US $500 to reinvest in her fried banana business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to fry and sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A., age 48, sells a variety of different products in her local general store. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three adult children and live in the village of Cabaruan.
  
In 2009, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Nenita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Nenita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon C., age 55, works in security and earns a daily income of US$ 2 each day, while his wife (pictured here) grows and sells mango trees. She is able to make about US $3 a day. One of their two children is a garment factory worker and makes US $3 every day. Chuon C. and his wife live in Kandal province. 

Chuon C. is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase a motorbike in order to operate a new motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike in order to operate a new motor-taxi business

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren M. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His daughter, age 15, attends local high school. His wife supports and helps out with his business while Nyamsuren works as a carpenter. He has owned his carpentry business for almost 14 years and over this long time he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. 

He usually produces a variety of wooden items according to customers' orders and his wife is responsible for sale at the local market. Nyamsuren is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his wooden items production business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

To make a living, Domingo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Domingo has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2006, Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domingo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 37,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Domingo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Thuk

texts.en: Thuk H., 69, is a widow with one daughter living in Kandal province. She is a farmer who works for less than one dollar a day, while her daughter sells used clothes in the local market. Thuk H. is asking for a loan of US$ 200 to reinvest in her daughter’s business.

loans.use: Selling used clothing

loans.name: Anayat's Group

texts.en:
Anayat lives in Kasur which is a small city located in Punjab, famous in Pakistan for its tanneries.  She lives in the area of Bhutta Sohan Din with her family in a 2-room brick house. 

She has a thread roll making business. She recovers thread from old warm clothes such as sweaters and sells rolls of it to different thread dealers at the market and earns good income. Her income allows her to pay the utilities for her family. She is married to Y. M. who doesn’t have any specific work. 
  
She has given birth to six sons. She couldn’t provide them formal education due to poor financial conditions. Her two elder sons have an embroidery business; they operate their embroidery shop in the market and contribute to their family financially. 
  
Anayat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, they will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread, cloth and sketches in bulk quantity that will enable them to fulfill the orders of their customers according to the latest trends.  

Anayat is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to their embroidery business and their income will double.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato O. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. He is 36 years old. Renato is single. To make a living, Renato owns & operates a specialized business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from  buying and selling of scrap metal & other used products in the local community. Renato has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Renato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renato has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to resell. Renato is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to resell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Renato from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S. M., age 40, grows and sells mango trees. On average, she is able to earn about US $5 in revenue each day. Her husband (pictured here) is a technician who repairs televisions and radios, typically making US $5 per day as well. One of their children is a laborer and the other two are in school. The family lives in Kendal province.

Sen S. M. is asking for a loan of US $400 to help her pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To help pay for the children's education

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru:
Latif O. 35 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, doch kotory 7 let ona uchitsya v shkole i sin kotoromu 5 let on xodit v detskiy sad. Latif yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, pasolok Kurdmahmudlu vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Latif uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom taksista. Seychas Latif nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya mashini.
texts.en:
Latif O. is 35 years old.  He is married and has 2 children: 7-year-old daughter, who goes to school, and 5-year-old son, who goes to kindergarten.  Latif is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Fuzuli city and now lives in the Kurdmahmudlu village in the Fuzuli region.

Latif has been involved in the taxi business for 5 years.  Currently, Latif needs 2000 AZN in order to buy parts for his car.

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts for the car

loans.name: Tseveensuren

texts.en:
Tseveensuren J. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Darhan-Uul province of  Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her middle daughter attends university, while her youngest daughter studies at the local high school. Her husband operates a transportation service business to supplement his family income, and her eldest daughter helps out with Tseveensuren's business.

Tseveensuren has been operating a shoes trade business in a stall at the new market since 2001. She provides a variety of shoes to satisfy their customers' needs. She owns a stall in the market where she sells the shoes.  After some years of positive growth for her business, she has gained not only a wide range of customers, but also a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Her working capital has exceeded 1,800,000 MNT.

Today, she enjoys a stable operation with the businesses and is focused on opening one more stall for her shoe retail trading business in the near future. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a new van for her husband. She currently pays her daughter's tuition fees with her earnings as well. She works hard to expand her business. Tseveensuren is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to open one more stall in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To open one more stall.

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:

To make a living, Crislyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Crislyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2009, Crislyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crislyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Crislyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Crislyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sim S. included. She is asking for a loan of US$200 to purchase fertilizer for the farm, increasing her current profits and prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

texts.en:
Esther N. lives in the Wandegeya Katanga neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. Esther has a business of a bar. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Esther sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerrycans of local gin.

The main business challenge(s) for Esther include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers being able to reach her business.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house, own a delivery van and start selling wholesale only. Esther lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.
