Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons locales appelées « SODABI »,  elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Tabligbo pour gagner plus de profits sur ces ventes.  Elle a une ancienneté de 8 ans dans ce commerce. Actuellement son stock est baisse raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 35 bidons de  SODABI. Ainsi elle pourra de nouveau satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Kokoui is a housewife who has three children. She has an income-generating activity selling local alcholic drinks called "Sodabi". She gets her supplies inland in the town of Tabligbo in order to make more money from her sales. She has eight years' experience in this business. Her stock is currently low and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 35 drums of Sodabi. She will thus be able to satisfy customer demand again.

loans.use: Purchase of local alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria P. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop, such as cartons of salt, boxes of soap, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more items to sell.  She is 25 years old and is married to a builder. She has three children and two of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Stock more items to sell

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou est une femme mariée, elle a  2 personnes à charge et son mari est un mécanicien. Elle exerce dans la restauration plus précisément elle vend la bouillie et des beignets. Les gens consomment  la bouillie comme petit déjeuner ; elle arrive toujours à vendre tout son stock. Sa bouillie est faite à base de céréales. Le stock de céréales dont elle dispose est fini, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de maïs, 10 bols de sorgho et 50 bols de mil. Ce crédit est son troisième.
texts.en: Oumou is a married lady who has two people in her care, and her husband is a mechanic. She has a restauration activity, more specifically she sells "bouillie" (a type of porridge) and fritters. People eat this "porridge" for breakfast and she always manages to sell her entire stock. Her porridge is made from cereals, but her stock of cereals has run out. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy six bags of corn, ten bowls of sorghum and 50 bowls of millet. This loan is her third.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, beans, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working as a home painter since 1987. He specializes in painting buildings.  He works on a freelance basis and independently. His business operation is limited to his town and its surroundings.

Today, he has the opportunity to expand his business into other areas and he is requesting to borrow $500 to purchase a compressor and renovate his painting tools. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity. His business income is important to support his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and renovate his painting tools

loans.name: Kodzo Mawuli

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il exploite un cybercafé, la formation en informatique et le traitement de texte. La demande de sa clientèle est élevée, il voudrait augmenter son moyen matériel pour mieux les satisfaire. Ce crédit va lui permettre de d’acheter 10 ordinateurs, 6 imprimantes et 2à cartons de papier A4.
Il est marié et  père de 3 enfants. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman has opened his own shop in which he runs a cyber café, as well as giving computer and word-processing training. Demand from his customers is high and he would like to expand his equipment to be able to provide better customer satisfaction. This credit will allow him to buy ten computers, six printers and two cartons of A4 paper.

He is married and father to three children. He provides for his family's expenses with the income from his business.

loans.use: Purchase of computers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes J.  is currently in the business of selling food items in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize and beans to sell.  Agnes is 38 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and two of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy some land.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Cette dame a 40 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente en détail  de Bijoux et de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne à accra. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2004 ; sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. Les périodes de fin d’année étant proche, elle voudrait accroître son revenu pour mieux gagner. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 pagnes hi-target, 5 pagnes GTP, et des bijoux.
texts.en: This lady is 40 years old and has an income-generating activity selling (on a retail basis) jewelry and "pagnes" (a West African term for very colourful pieces of fabric). She gets her supplies in Accra. She has been carrying out this business since 2004 and her customer base is predominantly feminine. With the end-of-year festivities approaching she would like to increase her income in order to make more profit. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten "hi-target pagnes", five "GTP pagnes" and jewelry.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and "pagnes"

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme de 22 ans, célibataire et très dynamique. Elle a appris le métier de la coiffure. Elle  a ouvert on atelier de coiffure qu’elle a appelé «  JESUS T’AIME ». Elle a 3 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce. Elle a besoin de matériel de coiffure  pour exercer correctement son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite de va lui permettre d’acheter 2 séchoirs, 1 porte rouleau, 1  carton de shampoing et basalm.
texts.en: Akou is a 22-year old woman who is single and very dynamic. She trained as a hairdresser and has opened a hairdressing salon, which she has named "Jesus t'aime". She has three years' experience in this business. She needs hairdressing equipment to carry out her business properly. She gets her supplies in Lomé. The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy two hairdryers, one hair-curler holder, and one carton of shampoos and balsam.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryers, hair-curler holder, shampoos and other items

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan S. is currently in the business of selling food items such as yams, sweet potatoes, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more food items to sell.  Susan is 33 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy some land.

loans.use: Stock more food items to sell

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou N. est une femme qui est âgée de 47 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est divorcée et mère de famille. Elle a une activité commerciale diversifiée car elle s’active depuis plus de 20 ans dans l’achat et la vente de poissons et de tissus. Et c’était pour soutenir  son mari et ses enfants qu’elle s’était lancée dans  cette activité.  Ainsi elle parvenait a satisfaire ses besoins. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis octobre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus( thioup, wax, etc.) en vue de développer son activité secondaire de vente de tissus. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de renforcer son épargne.
-
texts.en: Mrs. Astou N. is a 47-year old woman. She lives in Bambilor. She is divorced and has a family to support. She is engaged in different business activities as she has been selling fish and fabrics for over 20 years. She first started this work in order to support her husband and children. And  in this way she has been able to provide for her needs. She has been a member of the Bambilor credit union since October 2009. She already had a loan before. She is seeking a credit of 300,000 to purchase fabrics (traditional fabrics such as damask-type thioup, colourful “wax” fabrics, etc), in order to further grow her secondary business in fabrics. Her goal is to increase her revenues and boost her savings.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra reste une femme très dynamique, malgré son âge avancé, elle continue d’exercer comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail  de produits génériques, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Voulant agrandir son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’1 carton de vitamine, 1 carton de paracétamol, 1 carton de déparasitant et divers autres produits génériques. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Ce crédit qu’elle sollicite est son deuxième après remboursement du premier
texts.en: In spite of her advanced age, Abra is a very energetic woman.  She continues to operate an income-generating business in the retail sale of generic products.  She gets her supplies at Lome's large market.   Her clientele consists of all types of people. Wanting to expand her stock, she is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy one carton of vitamins, 1 box of paracetamol, 1 carton of deworming medication and other generic products. She is married and the mother of two children. The loan she is requesting is her seond; the first loan has been repaid.

loans.use: Purchase of generic products

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is currently in the business of selling food items like maize flour, cassava, etc.,  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour to sell.  Agnes is 37 years old and is married to a policeman. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools for his work

loans.name: Reida

texts.en: Reida M. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize to sell.  She is 29 years old and is Married to a peasant. She has three children and two of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit K. is married and lives with her son’s family with two schoolchildren. Although Anahit’s husband is a university professor, the family’s main income comes from Anahit’s business. The family helps Anahit to run the household and look after the children. Anahit has been managing the trade business since 1995. She sells quality men’s clothing and currently needs to renew the stock and expand the business.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing inventory and expanding the business

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Zaina I. is twenty years old and married with one daughter.  She has been running a charcoal selling business for one year.  The business is open daily between 8 am and 8 pm and earns her about $6 each day. 

This will be Zaina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use this loan to increase her charcoal inventory. Her dream is to open a shop for food in the Mbagala district of Dar es Salaam.

Zaina will share this loan with her loan group, Masasi, which totals fifteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Zaina can be seen in the front, wearing orange.

loans.use: To increase charcoal inventory

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Cette femme est âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’articles de mercerie. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans ce commerce et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Actuellement elle sollicite de WAGES son troisième crédit pour accroître son stock et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de fin d’année. Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à acheter 2 rouleaux de satin, 2 rouleaux de  ozanga et divers autres articles de mercerie.
texts.en: This woman is 35 years old, married and the mother of two. She makes a living by selling dry goods. She has been in this business for two years, stocking up at the big market of Lomé. Her customer base is very diverse. She is seeking a third loan from WAGES in order to increase her stock and better respond to the customer demand at the end of the year. This loan will be used to purchase two rolls of satin, two roles of [organza?] cloth and various small items.

loans.use: Purchasing dry goods

loans.name: Little Beginners Group

texts.en:
Eva Manuel, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Little Beginners.  She is 44 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 18 and 28 years. She was only able to attend school through 3rd grade due to financial difficult. She cares for one sibling.

For three years, she has been selling biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap etc. on “S.D Cooper Road” on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap etc.  She describes herself as a God-fearing woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap etc

loans.name: Shaba Group

texts.en:
Simon M. is in his mid-thirties and is married with one daughter.  He has been running a food shop for 8 months.  He sells sugar, rice, wheat, and fruits and vegetables.  The shop is open daily between 6 am and 8 pm and earns a profit of about $125 per month. 

This will be Simon's first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Simon aims to use this loan to increase his shop inventory.  

Simon will share this loan with his loan group, Shaba, which totals 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Simon is the man wearing blue.

loans.use: To increase shop inventory

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Koffi est un homme de 31 ans, il est père de famille avec 2 personnes à charge. Il a appris la chaudronnerie et pour augmenter ses sources de revenu il a commencé la vente en détail d’aluminium et de ferraille. Il a une expérience de3 ans dans ce commerce. Il veut s’approvisionner , il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 200Kg d’aluminium et 150 KG de ferraille.
texts.en: Koffi is a 31-year old man. He is  a parent with two dependents. He is a learned coppersmith; in order to increase his revenues he started retailing aluminum and iron scrap. He has three years of experience in this business. He would like to replenish his stock and seeks a loan from WAGES to purchase 200 kg [440 lbs] of aluminum and 150 kg [330 lbs] of iron scrap.

loans.use: Purchasing iron scrap and aluminum

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose E. is currently in the business of selling bread  and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Rose is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is NGO staff. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Maretou

texts.fr: Madame Maretou N. est une femme de 57 ans qui habite à Bambilor. C’est seulement depuis un an qu’elle a commencé à gérer  une boutique dans laquelle elle pratique la vente de marchandises diverses. Auparavant elle s’adonnait à la vente de tissus. Mais puisqu’elle prend de l’âge  elle a  opte pour la gestion de la boutique qui demande moins de déplacement. Elle  est membre  de la caisse de Bambilor depuis juillet 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs qui sera prévu pour l’achat de marchandises diverses en vue de renforcer son stock. Selon madame N. ce crédit lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus, de mieux soutenir sa famille face aux charges de dépense quotidienne, mais aussi d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. Maretou N. is a 57-year-old woman who lives in Bambilor.  Just a year ago, she began operating a shop in which she sells various goods.  In the past, she dedicated all her time to selling cloth.  But since she is not getting any younger, she has opted for managing a shop which demands less travel.  

She has been a member of the Bambilor branch since July 2010.  She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs, which will be used for buying various goods.  The aim is to bolster her stock of merchandise.  

According to Ms. N., this loan will enable her to increase her revenues, to support her family better in face of day-to-day expenses, and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of four school-age children. He has more than 20 years of experience running a car repair shop. He is specialized in repairing automobile bodies. He is the main income provider of his family and his wife who works in a local school, tries to help him with her small income. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.al. to purchase new tools for his work. In the future, he hopes to continue his work properly and to be able to expand his business operation and gain more clients.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his work

loans.name: Marianita Isabel

texts.es:
Marianita Isabel V. R. tiene 48 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 22-11 anos. 

Marianita es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Marianita es maestra auxiliana y su esposo es profesor. Los dos cultivan pina también. Venden sus pinas en Babahoyo cada 1 ano y medio después de la cosecha. Solicita el crédito para comprar los líquidos y abonos para el mantenimiento de pina. Con el apoyo del préstamo, podría mejorar sus pinas. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es tener mas cultivos y empezar a sembrar cacao y maracuya, o lo que da la tierra. 

Le gusta jugar el basketball y el fútbol en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Marianita Isabel V. R. is 48 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Chillanes, located in the Bolívar province. She has 4 children aged 11 to 22.

Marianita is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos (The Pleasure of Being friends), a rural bank located 20 minutes far from the parish of San José del Tambo. 15 is the total number of its members, who mainly engage either in growing cocoa or in running small shops.

Marianita is a teaching assistant and her husband is a professor. They also grow pineapple. They sell their pineapples in Babahoyo every 1 and a half year after the harvest. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy the liquid fertilizers to preserve the pineapples. The support provided by the loan will help her improve her pineapples. Her dream for the next 5 years is to increase her crops and to begin planting cacao and passion fruit, whichever takes root on her land.

She likes playing basketball and soccer in her free time.

loans.use: To buy liquid fertilizers to preserve her pineapples.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina K. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell.  Edina is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice H. is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Joice is 22 years old and is married to a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to go to school.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcaol to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice D. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread and other items such as, lagemat, taia and tea in the local restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour. Alice is 35 years old and single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of two young children. He has earned his income as an experienced van taxi driver almost 10 years ago.  His main service route is between his town and its surroundings, which is almost a two hour drive. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body after being in an accident. He wants to renovate it to present a comfortable transportation service to his customers. In the coming year, he expects that his business will continue to grow and he wishes that we wile be able one day to purchase an additionA. van to increase his business operation.

loans.use: to perform maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace S. is currently in the business of brewing local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeasts, sugar etc .  Grace is 36 years old and ismarried. Her husband is a peasant. She has 5 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials like yeasts, sugar etc

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is married and lives with her son’s family with two children. Emma’s husband has left home for Russia to find a job. Emma has been trading since 2000. Emma is selling locally made quality shoes, which are cheaper than imported ones and have a higher demand in the market. 

Currently, Emma is planning to purchase new stock from local shoemakers and for that purpose, she requires this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new shoe stock from local shoemakers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Y. makes a living selling clothes and has applied for a loan so that she can buy more inventory to sell to her customers. She is 30 years old, married and has six children, two of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. makes a living selling various food items at a local market and is applying for a loan to buy more bags of beans and rice to sell to her customers. She is 23 years old and a widow.  She has two children, both of whom are in school.  With the additional income made possible by this loan, Mary hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more beans and rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan J. makes a living selling tomatoes and onions and is applying for a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers. She is 34 years old, married and has one child who is a student in the local school. She hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik K. is a widow and lives with her two daughters, one of whom is a student and the other helps her mother running the business. Life conditions brought Knarik to be engaged in this business. It has been seven years that she has been selling men’s clothing. Knarik’s customers like her for her kindness, consideration and the clothing she offers. 

Currently, Knarik needs to expand her business by purchasing new inventory, for which she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan U. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Susan is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has 3 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola T. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  Viola is 23 years old and is married with a husband who is a NGO staff member.  She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine K. is married and lives with her mother-in-law. Both Armine and her husband are university graduates, but as they were unable to find a job in their fields, they have started their own business. Armine has been in the clothing trade business since 2004. Her husband helps her by taking care of the bookkeeping. Armine has applied for the loan to purchase autumn clothing stock.

loans.use: Purchasing autumn clothing stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a freezer and some accessories

loans.name: Mirtha Emelania

texts.es:
Mirtha Emelania T. P. tiene 49 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Mirtha es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Mirtha se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz y maíz en un terreno arriendado. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos aquí en la provincia. Todavía no se ha vendido su maíz este ano. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar los líquidos y seguir cultivando el arroz y maíz. También le gustaría comprar y criar unos pollos. Con el apoyo del préstamo, podría mejorar sus cultivos y ayudar a su familia. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es que sus hijo siga estudiando- ya esta en sexto grado. Dice que todo este bien con sus cultivos, pero un familiar recién tenía una operación pero se fue bien. 

Trabaja en la agricultura todos los días, pero a veces sale los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Mirtha Emelania T. P. is 49 years old and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolívar province with her common-law husband. She has three children.

Mirtha is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos communal bank, which is located 20 minutes from the parish of San José del Tambo. There are 15 members in total, the majority of which work growing cacao or have their own small businesses.

Mirtha works in agriculture, growing rice and corn on a piece of rented land. She makes the purchases and sales of her products in the province. She has still not sold her corn this year.

She is requesting the loan to buy liquids and to continue growing rice and corn. She would also like to buy and raise some chickens. With the help of the loan, she will be able to improve her crops and help her family. Her dream for the next five years is for her children to continue in school – one is already in 6th grade. She says that all is well with her crops and a relative recently had an operation, but it went well.

She works in farming everyday but she sometimes goes out on weekends.

loans.use: To buy liquids for farming and continue growing rice and corn.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert O. and his wife had worked in the construction business for many years when Albert decided he was ready to be self-employed and start his own construction company, OCI Construction, LLC. With a loan from ACCION Texas, Albert is going to pay for construction software, company registration fees, and an online database that will notify OCI Construction of potential projects. Albert would have a difficult time getting his company off the ground without this loan.

A constant challenge for Albert is that property management companies only want to contract construction companies with whom they have had past experience. Although Albert has completed a variety of construction projects, these have not been under the name of his construction company. Therefore, OCI Construction will have to start with small projects and build up slowly.

For the future, Albert hopes that OCI Construction will be contracted to do significant commercial jobs such as schools and hospitals. He foresees his company becoming a well-respected, customer-oriented, affordable construction business. 

Feel free to visit his website at www.oci-construction.com

loans.use: To pay for construction software, company registration fees, and online construction database

loans.name: Gladys Amanda

texts.es:
Gladys Amanda C. G. tiene 37 anos. Es soltera y vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 anos. 

Gladys es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva cacao, maíz, y arroz. Algunos intermediarios vienen a su comunidad a comprar sus cultivos, y otras tienen que vender en Matilde y Mata de Cacao. Solicita el crédito para seguir sembrando cacao y comprar una bomba de agua porque sin agua no se produce el cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría mantener más a sus niños y dejarles estudiar. Su sueno es que estudien sus hijos, y que sus cultivos sigan produciendo para poder sobrevivir. 

No tiene mucho tiempo libre porque pasa todo su tiempo trabajando afuera y en su casa.
texts.en:
Gladys Amanda C. G. is 37 years old.  She is single and lives with a partner in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolivar province.  She has 2 children age 9 and 11.

Gladys is a member of the rural communal bank "El Placer de Ser Amigos," which is located 20 minutes from the San Jose del Tambo parish.  There are 15 members in all; the majority of the members cultivate cocoa or have their own small businesses.

Gladys works in agriculture, cultivating cocoa, corn and rice.  Some intermediaries come to her community to buy her crops, and she also sells some of her crops in Matilde and in Mata de Cacao.  She requests a loan to continue cultivating cocoa, and to buy a water pump because without water one cannot produce cocoa.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to better support her children and keep them in school.  Her dream is that her children complete their education and that her crops continue to produce so that she can get by.

She does not have much free time because she spends all of her time working on her business and in her home.

loans.use: to cultivate cocoa, corn and rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Elsa Narcisa

texts.es:
Elsa Narcisa H. A. tiene 38 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 22 hasta 16 anos. 

Elsa es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura y cria chanchos. Su esposo trabaja en una hacienda de banano. Solicita el credito para comprar chanchitos. No sabe cuantos pero lo que se puede. Con el apoyo del préstamo podria seguir avanzando económicamente en la vida, poco a poco vendiendo los chanchos. Su sueno es que sus hijos sean felices y que Dios les cuiden. 

Le gusta jugar deportes.
texts.en:
Elsa Narcisa H. A. is 38 years old. She lives with her common-law husband in the canton of Chillanes, located in the Bolívar province. She has four children who range in age from 22 to 16 years old.

She is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos communal bank, located 20 minutes from the San José del Tambo parish. There are 15 group members in total, and the majority of them work growing cacao or have their own small businesses.

Elsa works in farming and in raising pigs and her husband works on a banana estate. She is requesting the loan to purchase pigs. She does not know how many, but she will buy what she can. With the support of the loan, she will be able to continue moving forward financially in life, little by little, selling her pigs. Her dream is for her children to be happy and for God to look after them.

She likes to play sports.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan Ramón tiene 38 años, es casado y tiene 1 hijo. El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y soldadura, El dio inicio a este negocio hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. El negocio consiste es su principal medio de vida. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de cerdos, debido a que tiene cierta demanda con sus clientes. Cabe señalar que el solicitar su préstamo le brindara más confianza para con su negocio,  de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en: Juan Ramón is 38 years old, married, and has a son.  He works buying and selling cattle and welding equipment.  He started this business himself and has been with it for more than 10 years.  The business is his main means of income.  This is the first time that Juan Ramón is taking out a loan with our institution and it will be for the purchase of pigs because he has a demand from his customers.  It is worth mentioning that the loan will provide him with more confidence with regards to his business because of the institution’s good credit conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new movies (disc)

loans.name: Holger Alfredo

texts.es:
Holger Alfredo R. A. tiene 48 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 11 anos.  

Holger es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Holger trabaja como contador. Solicita el crédito para pagar los estudios universitarios para sus hijos. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría darles a sus hijos un poco más en la vida. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es aumentar un proyecto pequeño de cacao. 

En el poco tiempo libre que tiene, le gusta dedicar a la familia.
texts.en:
Holger Alfredo R. A. is 48 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in Chillanes canton, in the province of Bolivar, Ecuador. He has two children, who are 15 and 11.  

Holger is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos [The Joy of Being Friends] rural communal bank, which is located 20 minutes from San Jose del Tambo parish. The bank has 15 members in all, most of whom work growing cocoa beans or have their own small businesses. 

Holger works as an accountant, and is asking for a loan to pay for his children to attend college. With the help of this loan, he will be able to give his children a little bit more in life. His goal for the next five years is to expand his small cocoa-growing enterprise. 

Holger likes to spend what little free time he has with his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children to attend college

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez Fatima belongs to Kasur, which is a small city famous for its leather industry, in Punjab, Pakistan. She has a two-room brick house where she moved 10 years ago with her family.   

She has a business of making thread rolls. She gets thread from old, warm clothes such as sweaters and sells to different thread dealers at the market to earn a good income. She started doing this work when she moved to Kasur. She does this work to help her husband financially. 

Kaneez has given birth to a son who is just 8 years old and studying in 3rd class. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her thread-roll business. With the loan, she will buy warm clothes such as sweaters in a bulk quantity and get thread from them for selling.  

She hopes that through this investment, her income will double in size and she will gradually take her business toward success.

loans.use: To buy sweaters for making and selling rolls of thread

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria 2 & 4 Group

texts.en: Epifania is one of the members of the group Mujeres en Victoria 2 & 4 (Women in Victory). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their only child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to make her business a great source of income for her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook; that why she is dedicating to this kind of business. Epifania is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around six years, starting with her Esperanza first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients like rice, beans, oil, meats and vegetables. She is running a little restaurant (in the Dominican Republic it is called Comedor). She will use the profits to save, to cover some needs like paying bills, and to invest in her business. She is planning to have a good restaurant and the biggest one. This Esperanza associate began with us because she was waiting for money to work, and to start making her dream of having her own restaurant come true. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. A man in the circle is the husband of one of the women missing from the picture

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, meats, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 43 años, es divorciado y vive con uno de sus hijos en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 15 años trabaja de manera independiente, él se dedica a las producciones musicales, cuenta con su propia banda musical presentándose en diversos eventos sociales como fiestas de graduación, matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños, etc. Su trabajo principal es el de representante de la banda, por lo que siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevos contratos que soliciten su servicio, además que también participa dentro de la banda tocando la batería electrónica. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo a lado de sus demás compañeros, para él este negocio de representaciones musicales le resulta rentable, ya que cada fin de semana nunca faltan los eventos sociales. Su deseo es mejorar su banda con instrumentos nuevos, asimismo expandir su fama por toda la región. Este es su crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, puesto que le tienen mucha confianza, por ser responsable en sus pagos; además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para mejorar el servicio en las presentaciones de su banda, ya sea gastos de estadía y el transporte de su banda.
texts.en:
Saúl, 43, is divorced and lives with one of his children in a relative’s house.  He has worked independently for the last 15 years.  He has a band and provides musical performances at various social events like graduations, weddings, baptisms, birthday parties, etc.  His main job is as the band’s agent so he is always out looking for new contracts for their services.  He’s also a band member; he plays an electronic percussion set.

He enjoys his work very much alongside his fellow band members.  For him, musical performance has turned out to be profitable because every weekend there are a lot of social events. 

He hopes to improve the band with new instruments.  This is his 10th loan with MFP and is very happy to know that he can count on financial support because he’s responsible with his repayments.  Besides, he enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive.

He thanks all those who will fund the loan he’s asking for that will be very useful for his business’ progress.

He will use the requested funds to improve his band’s presentations be it for lodging and/or band transportation costs.

loans.use: For the band's performance costs like transportation and lodging.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel wants a loan to buy a piece of land to construct a rental house. He is a 40-year-old single man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Emmanuel is a civil servant and, given the low income he earns, he feels he needs to have a side income. Thus, he dreams of constructing a rental house. He feels that, with the rental house, he will be able to have a better standard of living. He dreams of going for further studies so that he can grow in his career.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for construction of a rental house

loans.name: Drake

texts.en: Drake wants a loan to roof his rental house. He is a 31-year-old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a rented house. He dreams of going for further studies for the progress of his career. Drake is a civil servant and was a teacher. He says that he would like to see his income grow and not rely only on his salary for a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To roof his rental house

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a housewife, but in order to financially support her family, she also weaves carpets on order. She lives in a three-room brick house with her family in Kasur, which is a small city famous for its leather industry in Punjab, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of seven sons. She couldn’t provide an education to her elder sons, but now they have started doing work and through their financial support, she has been able to enroll her three younger sons in school. She wishes that they could complete their education and make their future bright and never suffer the same problems their elder brothers have faced in their lives. 

Her husband, G. N., is involved in selling bakery items. He collects orders from different bakeries and supplies them the baked items such as fruit cakes, bread, biscuits, etc., to earn an income for the family. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. He will buy bakery items in bulk with the loan and fulfill his larger orders on time.

loans.use: To buy bakery items in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” está iniciando su tercer ciclo, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho mujeres.  Las señoras  se reunirán cada quince días, durante cinco meses para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Geovanna como presidenta, la señora  Dolores como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Soledad.

La señora  Geovanna es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad, como presidenta de su asociación tiene la tarea de controlar que la Mesa Directiva, Jefes de Grupo y socias de bases cumplan con los reglamentos acordados  al inicio del ciclo de crédito.  Ella tiene cinco años de experiencia como cliente de Pro Mujer, ingresó a una asociación gracias a la invitación de un grupo de señoras.  Con respecto a su negocio, ella vende en el bazar que comparte con su madre.  Su primer crédito fue de $us 150.-, actualmente ha solicitado Bs.5000.- y piensa invertirlo en la compra de su propia mercadería para el bazar.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación la mayoría son de comercio.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” community association, part of the Villa Exaltación focal center, is starting its third loan cycle. It is made up of 8 women, who meet every 15 days over 5 months to receive training and make loan payments. The directors committee consists of Geovanna, the president, Dolores, treasurer, and Soledad as secretary.

Geovanna is a young 24 year old woman. As president, she has the task of making sure the directors committee, group leaders, and members comply with the rules agreed upon at the beginning of the loan cycle. She has 5 loan cycles of experience as a Pro Mujer client. Geovanna was invited to join a Pro Mujer association by one of the groups of women. With respect to her work, she and her mother are vendors at the bazaar. Geovanna's first loan was for US$150. She is currently applying for a Bs.5,000 loan and plans to invest it in the purchase of her own merchandise to sell at the market.

The majority of the rest of the members works in small business.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for Bazaar (office supplies, decorations, etc.)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyng Lissett

texts.es: Evelyng Lissett tiene 32 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Ella vive en una zona que se encuentra algo alejada de la ciudad, por lo que ha sido muy difícil trasladar todos los productos que tiene que ofrecer en los diferentes lugares que recorre, pues va a los mercados, buses, entre otros. Por lo que desea adquirir una buena calidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes para niños. Evelyng es una mujer bastante activa y que gusta mucho de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Evelyng Lissett, 32, sells clothes.  She lives in an area that is quite distant from the city so it has been quite difficult to transport her wares to all the places she frequents to sell because she goes to markets, bus stops, etc.  She wants to acquire good quality products to have on stock for her customers.

She has therefore deemed it advisable to request a loan to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts and children’s outfits.

Evelyng is quite active and enjoys working in order to help her husband get ahead.

People who know her hold her in high esteem and consider her to be trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam wants a loan to complete paying for his plot of land for construction of a rental house. He is a 22-year-old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in his own house. He dreams of turning his grocery into a wholesale shop; thus, improving his source of income. Sam sells domestic items in his grocery and says so far he has had no big challenges.

loans.use: To complete payment for a plot of land for the construction of a rental house

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rita is the coordinator of her group Dios Proveera 1 & 2 (God Will ProviD.). She makes her home here in a simple structure with four of the five children she had. Being a single mom, she raised and educated them, working hard and taking care of them. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew and spend time with her children.

Rita is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around eight years, starting with small sewing orders before she expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a sewing machine and some cosmetics products from the Ebel catalog. She will use the profits to save and buy a computer for her children. In the near future, she wants to build a house.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed money to invest in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some cosmetics products

loans.name: Aparicio Santiago

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Aparicio Santiago; el tiene 57 años de edad y es divorciado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio trabaja en un estudio jurídico, el es abogado y trabaja en la ciudad de Cusco desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m por medio saca adelante a sus hijos pero en algunas oportunidades no alcanza, el socio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar ya que dos de sus hijos estudian economía y el otro estudia derecho. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Aparicio Santiago, 57, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank located in Izcuchaca district, Anta province, Cusco department.

He is divorced and has five children.  He works in a law firm; he’s a lawyer and works in Cusco from 8am until 6pm to support his children.  Sometimes, however, it’s not enough.  He wants his children to finish their schooling.  Two of them are majoring in Economics and one in Law.  He is asking for the loan to pay their educational expenses.

He uses this forum to thank all those who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To pay for his children's schooling.

loans.name: Gloria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Gloria se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene este tipo de experiencia de créditos. Pues siempre está mostrando mucho empeño por mejorar en su negocio.  Su negocio consiste en ofrecer los diferentes productos a sus clientes, lo que siempre ha caracterizado a Gloria es simpatía y la forma de expresarse con sus clientes. Ha sido difícil la lucha que ha atravesado por obtener este negocio que tiene desde hace 9 años, pero han valido la pena pues así puede ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro mejor. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, ropa interior, comenticos entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria sells general merchandise.  This isn’t her first experience with credit.  She is always looking for ways to improve her business.

She sells a variety of products to her customers.  What has always set Gloria apart is her kindness and the way she relates to her customers.

The road to having this business for the last 9 years has not been easy but it has been worth it because she is able to offer her son a better future.

This loan is to buy raw materials like: shoes, underwear and cosmetics, among others.

loans.use: To buy shoes, underwear and cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú tiene  47 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa alquilada. DesD. hace 13 años venD. productos D. belleza y desD. hace 1 año que tiene su salón D. belleza en una D. las calles comerciales D. su ciudad. En un inicio recorría las calles D. su barrio, yendo D. casa en casa, visitando a sus amistades para que le compren algún producto que tenía en oferta. Hoy, ofrece los mismos productos pero en mayor proporción, pero adicionalmente su negocio lo complementó brindando el servicio D. cosmetología, realizando peinados y cortes D. cabello. Cuenta con el apoyo D. una señorita, a quien contrató para que le ayuden en el servicio, asimismo venD. sus productos a crédito, D. esa manera L. da facilidad a sus clientes D. comprar el cosmético que necesita. Este trabajo le ha traído mucha satisfacción a Marilú porque le permite ser independiente en sus ingresos, además tiene L. libertad D. ofrecer  promociones cuando tiene más cantidad D. productos para vender. En adelante desea incrementar y mejorar sus equipos para mejorar el servicio en su salón D. belleza. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, puesto que le tienen mucha confianza, por ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más productos como tintes y demás colorantes y cosméticos para su salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Marilú, 47, lives with her husband and her son in a rented house.  For the last 13 years she has sold beauty products and for the last year has had a beauty salon in one of the city’s commercial streets.  

At the beginning she used to go door to door visiting her acquaintances hoping they’d buy some product or other she had on hand.  Now, she offers the same products but in greater quantity having added cosmetology services like hair styling and haircuts.  She has a young lady that she hired to help out.  In addition, she sells beauty products on credit thereby making it easy for her customers to buy the beauty products they need.

This work has brought Marilú much satisfaction because it allows her to be independent earning her own income and she has the freedom to sell her products at reduced prices when she has large amounts to sell.  In the future she’d like to increase and improve the equipment in the salon in order to proviD. better customer service.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s responsible with her repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive.  In addition, she thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested funds to buy more supplies, like hair dye and other coloring agents as well as cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy assorted beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Nazario; el tiene 57 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; el socio trabaja manejando una combi haciendo servicio público hacia la ciudad de cusco y también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de madera, el tiene un pequeño puesto para que venda la madera, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de madera. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nazario, 57, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank located in Izcuchaca district, Anta province, Cusco department.

He is married and has 7 children.  He drives a “combi” (minivan used in public transportation) providing public transportation in Cusco and is also a lumber retailer; he has a small stand where he sells lumber.  He wants to expand his business buying more lumber and needs the loan to buy it at wholesale.

He uses this forum to thank all those who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy lumber at wholesale.

loans.name: Pensando En El Futuro 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Bernarda is the coordinator of her group Pensando en el Futuro 4 & 5, (Thinking about the Future). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children, whom she raised and educated by hard work. Her most difficult challenge is to teach her children to be good humans beings. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to learn how to use the computer.

Bernarda is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around four months, starting with a small loan her partner got. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying snacks, juice, breads, cheese, jam, etc. She is planning to expand her cafeteria products to offer more options to her clients. She will use the profits to save and buy a computer for herself and her children. In the near future, she wants to build a house.

This Esperanza associate's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy snacks, juice, breads, cheese, jam, etc.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maria Consuelo; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, yogurt y leche, ella cría las vacas y saca leche y prepara con varios insumos el queso, yogurt y la leche y lo vende en el mercado de Huancaro que queda ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere tener un puesto para poder vender. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar el queso y el yogurt.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María Consuelo, 52, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank located in Izcuchaca district, Anta province, Cusco department.

She is a single mother of 6 children.  She alternates her daily chores with cheese, milk and yoghurt sales.  She raises the cows that produce the milk which, with the addition of certain ingredients, she prepares the cheese, yoghurt and milk to sell in Huancaro Market located in Cusco.  She wants to have a sales stand.  She’s requesting funds to buy ingredients to prepare the cheese and the yoghurt. 

She uses this forum to thank all those who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cheese and yoghurt.

loans.name: Maribel Antonia

texts.es: Ella es una persona muy honrada y disfruta de este negocio, es casada y vive junto a su familia Maribel tiene 1 hijos menor de edad a su cargo. Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de mercadería en general Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos que le solicitan, tiene clientes que son fijos. Con estos ingresos ella ayuda a sufragar los gastos del hogar. Desea ampliar su inventario de modo que su nivel de ventas e ingresos aumente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez un crédito para la compra de calzado, sabanas, ropa entre otras cosas. Maribel es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que se esfuerza a diario para darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Maribel is an honest person who enjoys her work very much.  She’s married and lives with her family.  She has one minor child in her care.

For the past two years she has sold general merchandise.  She has an established customer base that she sells a variety of items to.  Income from this activity helps her meet household expenses.

She wants to expand her inventory so that sales and profits will increase.  She is, therefore, asking for her first loan to buy footwear, bed sheets and clothing, among others.

Maribel is quite dedicated to her family and makes the effort daily to provide them with the best.

loans.use: To buy footwear, sheets and clothing, among others.

loans.name: Cinthia Carolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Cinthia Carolina; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de granos secos y también se dedica a estudiar la carrera profesional de odontología, los granos secos compra al por mayor y los vende en los diferentes mercados de Cusco y también envía a lugares como Cotabambas, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar granos secos como maíz, trigo, cebada y moraya al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cinthia Carolina, 22, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank located in Izcuchaca, Anta province, Cusco department.

She is single and alternates her daily chores with dry grains sales.  She is also studying to be a dentist.  

She buys the grains at wholesale and then sells them in Cusco’s various markets.  She also sends them to places like Cotabambas.  She wants to improve the grain sales business and is asking for funds to buy grains like corn, wheat, barley and moraya (a tuber) at wholesale.

She uses this forum to thank all those who will share in her dream and to pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy dry grains like: corn, wheat, barley and moraya (a tuber) at wholesale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA ESPERANZA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higia ;  La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, La socia se dedica  a prestar servicio de llamadas a celulares y fijos de todo el país, ella recarga sus 4 telefonos celulares en las dos lineas de telefonía, entonces ella de forma ambulante se para en las esquinas de las plazas mas concurridas y con su mandil fosforecente presta el servicio de llamadas a todo el país; La socia solo estudio la secundaria y no pudo tener acceso a estudiar en la superior debido a que su economía no le permite. La socia a averiguado sobre la posibilidad de comprar una carreta mazamorrera, para poder vender mazamorra caliente en diferentes tipos y tamaños de recipientes a distintos precio para el alcance de todo el publico. ella ya tiene planeado cambiar de negocio y es la razón por la cual solicita el prestamo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una carreta para vender mazamoras.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos venden comida, animales menores, verduras, gaseosas y cervezas, pollería,  restaurantes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Higia, 25, is a member of the “NUEVA ESPERANZA” (New Hope) communal bank located in Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and a son.  She provides cellular and land line phone services to the entire country.  She recharges her two cellular phones on two lines and then goes to corners of the most popular city squares wearing a phosphorescent apron and provides calls to the whole country.  

She only finished secondary school because her economic situation did not allow for higher education.  She has make inquiries concerning the purchase of a food cart to sell hot mazmorra (a corn based dessert) in various sizes and quantities and prices so that it can be accessible to a wide range of customers.  She plans to change businesses and this is why she needs a loan in order to buy the mazmorra food cart.

The other group members alternate their household chores with retail.  They sell food, small farm animals, vegetables, soft drinks, beer, chicken and some run restaurants.

She is grateful for the loan granted and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy a food cart.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 59 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a preparar platos típicos, siendo su establecimiento en su casa que acondicionó para ser un restaurante. Es así que los fines de semana se intensifican las ventas de sus potajes, por otra parte, Lidia esta contenta por que sus clientes la buscan para que sea la encargada de elaborar bocaditos y demás platos para eventos sociales. Para ella el trabajo es muy gratificante, y más si sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio, ya que necesita de tiempo y dedicación al momento de preparar sus bocaditos. Para Lidia es una gran satisfacción dedicarse a lo que considera es su pasión, además las ganancias que percibe compensan su esfuerzo por lo que se ha propuesto para el futuro mejorar su cocina con mejores instrumentos. Es su noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, por ser una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes que son los ingredientes de sus platos típicos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 59 years old and lives with her two children in her own home.  For 11 years she has worked making typical local foods in her home, which she set up as a restaurant.  Sales of her stews increase on the weekends, and Lidia is happy because her customers hire her to make appetizers and other dishes for social events.  The work is very gratifying for her, especially if her children help her, since it takes time and dedication to prepare her appetizers.  It is a great satisfaction for Lidia to work at what she considers her passion.  Her earnings also make it worth her effort, and for this reason her goal for the future is to improve her kitchen with better equipment.

This is Lidia's ninth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she is responsible about her payments.  She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are very close-knit.  She would also like to thank the people who made this loan possible because it will be very helpful to her in the growth of her business.  Lidia will use this loan to buy the ingredients for her meals.

loans.use: Purchase products to continue making stews

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de queso, la socia elabora los quesos y luego los vende los días sábados en el mercado de Huancaro, la socia se dedica a este negocio ya varios años, la socia quiere mejorar e implementar el negocio de venta y compra de quesos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y moldes para producir los quesos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Isidro de Compone communal bank, which is located in Izcuchaca District, Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

The member's name is Angelica.  She is 48 years old, married, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her cheese business.  She makes the cheeses and sells them on Saturdays at the Huancaro market.  Angelica has done this work for several years, and she wants to improve and expand her business.  She is asking for the loan to buy cheesemaking supplies and molds.

She is grateful to everyone who is part of this loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Supplies and molds for making cheese

loans.name: Ventura Del Carmen

texts.es: Ventura del Carmen tiene 64 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y que disfruta mucho de tener este negocio como es una pulpería. Anteriormente había tenido experiencia con su negocio. Pues ha sido muy difícil mantenerlo activo, pues algunas veces no obtiene muchas ganancias. Esto no la entristece le proporciona mas ánimo para esforzarse y brindar un buen servicio. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: Ventura del Carmen is 64 years old. She is a very dynamic woman who truly enjoys running her business, which is a pulpería, or a small grocery store. She did not have any previous experience with this type of business, so it has been difficult to keep it going and sometimes she hasn't made much profit. This doesn't sadden her, though, but rather gives her more encouragement to put in effort and to offer good service. She has had this business for over 7 years and it is her principal source of income. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, detergent, and staple grains.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, detergent, and staple grains

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con enseñanza a niños del nivel inicial y primario, ella es profesora en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere mejorar y tener más material educativo para enseñar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material educativo para la enseñanza de los niños.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to community bank “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONES”. This bank is located in Izcuchaca district, in the Anta province and Cusco department.

She alternates her daily activities with teaching pre-school and primary school children. She is a teacher in the city of Cusco. She wants to improve and to have more educational materials for teaching. She is requesting the loan in order to buy education materials to use with the children.

Angelica is grateful for those who form part of her dream and she promises to repay in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy educational materials for teaching children

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Kirsy is the coordinator of her group Caminando con Jesus 3 & 4 (Walking with Jesus). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to watch television.

Kirsy is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for six months, starting with her husband's help. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling all kinds of clothes and different home-decoration items. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy a couch. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy home decorations and clothes

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Bertha; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene un carro que hace servicio interprovincial hacia la ciudad de Apurímac y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio de su carro. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar repuestos para el carro.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank. The bank is located in the Izcuchaca district, which belongs to the Anta province and the Cuzco province. 


The member's name is Bertha. She is 50 years old and a single mother of 2 children. The member alternates her activities between her daily activities and the transportation business. She has a car with which she does inter-provincial service from the city of and Apurímac. With this business she has been able to get her kids ahead. She wants to improve her car service and she has asked for a loan for car maintenance and car replacement parts. 


The member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan for car maintenance and to by replacement car parts.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
Maria de la Cruz tiene la edad de 56 años, es agricultora, vive con su hijo Eddy mayor de edad labora en Escasan y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. 

Doña Maria recibe sus ingreso de venta de leche y semovientes , además es dueña de una propiedad de 13 manzanas con titulo de dominio ubicada en la Colonia Los Angeles Nueva Guienea, valorada en C$ 60,000.00, esta misma es la Garantia del prestamos que solicita en AFODENIC mediante el apyo de Kiva, para ser  invertido en siembra de pasto, por lo que se dedica a esta actividad para garantizar  la alimentación del ganado en tiempo de verano, de esta forma mantener su hato ganadero en buen desarrollo y mejores rendimiento en carne y producción de leche a la vez  tiene otros pequeño negocio como es crianza de cerdo y aves de corral, es una mujer trabajadora, ejemplar en la colonia, con principio religiosos. 

Su mayor sueño es obetener mayores ganancias para poder agrandar su propiedad y de esta manera crecer su inventario y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de la Cruz is 56 years old.  She is a farmer who lives with her adult son, Eddy, who works for Escasan (a Nicaraguan veterinarian supply company) and helps her with the household expenses.

Maria receives her income from selling milk and livestock.  In addition, she is the deeded property owner of 13 manzanas, (about 23 acres), located in the Los Angeles Nueva Guienea neighborhood, and valued at 60,000.00 Nicaraguan cordobas.  She is using this property to guarantee the loan that she requests from AFODENIC, which is supported by Kiva.  She will invest the loan in the cultivation of pasture grass; this activity will allow her to secure food for her livestock during the summertime.  In this way she can maintain her cattle herd so that they develop well and so that she can get the best yield in meat and milk production.  Maria also has some other small businesses, such as raising pigs and poultry.  She is a hardworking woman who is a model in her community and who has religious principles.

Her main dream is to obtain better earnings so that she can expand her property and in this way increase her inventory of livestock and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to cultivate pasture grass

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 48 años, es casado y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años junto con su esposa decidieron abrir un restaurante turístico en las instalaciones de su propia casa, puesto que cuenta con amplios espacios, alrededor de áreas verdes, que le permitieron incursionar en este negocio. Su esposa es la que prepara los platos típicos, además es la encargada de buscar los contratos con los clientes, que por lo general hacen pedidos para que puedan elaborar banquetes, bufets y almuerzos para algunos eventos que se presentan; asimismo procura tener todos los productos e ingredientes que necesita para preparar dichos platillos. Su capacidad de administrar bien su negocio, le dado mucha ventaja para que su negocio alcance el sostenimiento, por tal motivo ha decidido intensificarse en este negocio y conseguir contratos más rentables. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, pero su esposa ha sido  una de las socias antiguas de su banco comunal que por motivos de salud temporal su esposo asume la titularidad del crédito, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias, asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sillas para que ya deje de alquilarlas, asimismo desea comprar una cocina industrial a gas.
texts.en:
Juan is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his two children in their own house. Ten years ago, he and his wife decided to open a tourist restaurant in their own home, since they had ample space and lived near the green spaces, and these circumstances permitted them to enter this business.
