His wife is the one who prepares the typical dishes, and furthermore, she is in charge of seeking contracts with customers, who generally place orders for them to prepare banquets, buffets, and lunches for the various events that occur. She also procures all the products and ingredients that she needs to prepare these typical dishes. Her ability to administer their business well has given it a great advantage so that it is reaching sustainability. For that reason, he has decided to increase his efforts in this business and obtain more profitable contracts.

This is his first loan with MFP, but his wife has been one of the oldest members of her community bank. Because of temporary health reasons, her husband has assumed responsibility for the loan. He is very happy to know that he has financial support, since they know that he is responsible in his payments. Furthermore, he is grateful to be part of his community bank because all its members are very united people. At the same time, he is thankful to the people who will be granters of the loan that he is applying for, since it will be very useful to him in the progress of his business. With the loan that he is seeking, he will buy chairs so that he can stop renting them, and he also wants to buy an industrial gas stove.

loans.use: Buy chairs and an industrial gas stove

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “LIBERTAD” está iniciando su tercer ciclo, en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Las señoras  se reunirán cada 28 días, durante seis meses para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas.  Las socias consideraron este plan de pago, con la confianza de que se conocen y que pagarán puntual.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Verónica como presidenta, la señora Rosa como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Judith.

La señora  Verónica es una mujer joven de 27 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, como presidenta de su asociación tiene la tarea de controlar  que la Mesa Directiva, Jefes de Grupo y socias de bases cumplan con los reglamentos acordados  al inicio del ciclo de crédito. Este es un gran desafío para ella, por que la señora Verónica cuenta con sólo un ciclo en la asociación. Ingresó a la misma gracias a la invitación de una señora.  Con respecto a su negocio, ella vende ropa, aprendió de su hermana hace cuatro años.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs 1000.-, para este ciclo ha solicitado Bs.2000.-, en ambos casos el dinero es destinado para la compra de mercadería.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación tenemos: venta de verduras, limpieza de ropa, tejido a máquina, venta de ropa, venta de artículos varios, compra y venta de cuero de res, tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The Liberty Comunal Association is starting its third cycle with the Panamericana Focal Center [which brings together over 100 communal associations]. It is composed of nine members. The women will meet every 28 days over the course of  six months to empower one another and make their payments. The members thought over this payment plan and are confident that they are familiar with it and will be punctual. The board of directors is composed of Veronica as president, Rosa as treasurer, and Judith as secretary. 

Veronica is a young woman of 27 years. She is married and the mother of three. As president of the association, she has the task of making sure the board of directors, group leaders, and members follow the terms agreed upon at the start of the loan cycle. This is a good challenge for her, because Veronica has been with the association for only one loan cycle. She joined the association thanks to a woman’s invitation. 

Her business is selling clothing. Her sister taught her how four years ago. Her first loan was for 1000 bolivianos, and this loan cycle she has requested 2000 bolivianos. In both cases, the money goes towards the purchase of merchandise. The rest of the members of the association have businesses where they carry out vegetable sales, clothes washing, machine knitting, clothing sales, blanket weaving, the sale of various articles, and purchase and sales of leather.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN D. LAS MERCEDES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Abdom; el es casado y tiene 2 Hijos; El socio se dedica a la agricultura, construcción y también tiene un carro que hace servicio hace la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo, el socio cultiva varios tipos D. verduras como zanahorias, tomates y cebollas y luego los venD. en el mercado D. Urubamba, el socio quiere tener una tienda para vender las verduras y le gustaría mejorar sus tierras D. cultivo. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para las tierras D. cultivo. 

Los otros socios  se dedican a la ganadería, venta D. verduras, venta D. carne, crianza D. animales, venta D. chicha.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the community bank "Virgen D. las Mercedes," which is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

One member of the bank is Sr. Abdom. He is married and has two children. He works in agriculture and in construction, and he also has a car that he uses for transportation service in the city of Ollantaytambo. He raises various types of vegetables, such as carrots, tomatoes, and onions, and then he sells them in the market in Urubamba. He would like to have a shop where he could sell vegetables, and he would like to improve his fields. He is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his fields.

The other bank members raise animals, sell vegetables, sell meat, and sell chicha (traditional Andean corn beer). 

This bank member is thankful to the people who form part of this dream through this means, and he promises to make his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and seeds for the cultivated land.

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es: Ana Judith tiene 29 años, pues su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general.  Ella es bien emprendedora y disfruta de tener este medio de vida para mantener a su hijo menor de edad. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos que son necesarios para su negocio, ella es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de interactuar con sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con este negocio. Este crédito es para la compra de productos como calzado, cosméticos, ropa, sabanas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Ana Judith is 29 years old and has a general store.  She is very enterprising and enjoys having this means of supporting her young child.  Most of her customers always ask for different products that are necessary for her business.  She is a very responsible woman and enjoys interacting with her customers.  She is currently continuing this business.  This loan is for the purchase of products like shoes, cosmetics, clothing, sheets, and other things.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Placida Alexandra

texts.es:
Placida de 39 años, , vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en una parte de su casa. 

Después que su esposo la dejo tubo que iniciar un negocio con sus ahorros para poder mantener a su hijo que aun estudia. Inicio haciendo cortes de cabello a sus vecinos y conocidos poco a poco incremento si capital de trabaja y adecuo una parte de su casa para ubicar hay el salón de belleza. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. Cada corte de cabello lo hace por un costo de $ 1.50 según sea el tamaño del cabello, así con los tinturados, planchados etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cremas para peinar, tintes, planchas. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio teniendo un local bien adecuado para todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Placida is 39 years old and lives in Primavera de Dura (a semi-urban area with an endangered environment in the outskirts of Guayaquil).  She had a small beauty salon in part of her house.

After her husband left her, she had to start a business with her savings in order to support her son who is in school.  She began giving haircuts to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Her capital slowly grew and she was able to put a beauty salon in her home.  She currently works from 8:00am to 4:00pm every day.  She does each haircut starting at $1.50 depending on the length of the hair, and dyes and ironing are more.  

With this loan, she would like to buy styling creams, dyes, and irons.  In the future, she would like to expand her business into a store that would be well-suited to all of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase styling cream, hair dye, and irons.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y la menor D. sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace más D. 8 años que tiene una ferretería, instalada en su misma casa, ya que contaba con un espacio amplio dentro del inmueble que pudo acondicionar para llevar a cabo éste negocio, considerando además que se encuentra ubicada en una zona céntrica. D. esta manera su ferretería cuenta con todo tipo D. materiales D. construcción, en el que fácilmente son almacenados en su casa, para no tener contratiempos al momento que el cliente requiera cierto producto. Su esposo es su principal apoyo que recibe, considera que este negocio le es rentable porque los clientes siempre solicitan D. sus productos, por tal motivo desea incrementar D. más mercadería en su ferretería. Este es su crédito número 23 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias, asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras D. este préstamo que le será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor D. tuberías para instalaciones eléctricas y D. agua potable.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her four children in their own house.  

For more than 8 years, she has owned a hardware store.  It is located in her home, because it has a large space insiD. that she could set up as the business and it is in a central location.  Her hardware store has all types of building materials, which are easily stored in her home, in case a customer needs a certain product at any time.  Her husband is her main source of support.  Her business is profitable because the customers always ask for their products, and for this reason, they want to proviD. more merchandise in the hardware store.

This is their 23rd loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support and that she is known as a responsible person with her payments.  She is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are very caring people.  She also thanks all of the people who contribute to this loan, that will be very useful to the progress of her business.

With this loan, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of tubes for electrical installations and for drinking water.

loans.use: Purchase tubes for electric wiring installations and drinking water

loans.name: Francia Ines

texts.es:
En el año 2006 Francia Inés P. de 34 años, renunció a su trabajo en una empresa, porque lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba para vivir cada día mejor,  e inició su historia emprendedora   cuando decidida emprendió su negocio de vender mercancía en miscelánea, alquilándole su casa a un familiar en un lugar cercano a su vivienda. Antes de iniciarlo Francia tuvo en cuenta los potenciales clientes de su alrededor, donde  encontró un colegio, por eso pensó en vender útiles escolares y todo lo relacionado con papelería como cartulinas, lápices bolígrafos, borradores, marcadores etc., así fue como dejó de pagar arriendo y su tía le permitió que se mudara para su casa y atendiera el negocio; así lo del arriendo que ya no pagaba  fue reinvirtiéndolo y poco a poco surtió su negocio con diversas líneas de productos. 
Gradualmente su clientela creció y por eso acudió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace más de 4 años y este es su tercer financiamiento. Con este apoyo logró aumentar sus ingresos y a nivel personal su autonomía  y el desarrollo de sus potencialidades pues en la actualidad está prestando un servicio adicional en el área de informática: ofrece clases personalizadas y con ello ha tenido mucha aceptación  en la comunidad. 
El crecimiento de la unidad económica ha permitido que toda la familia gire alrededor de ella en unidad, por eso su sueño es convertirla en un gran almacén y ayudar también a todos lo que a ella le han dado la mano.  Su credikiva es su tercer financiamiento y con  él comprará  mercancía para afrontar el fin de año, como detalles para el hogar, cosméticos y juguetes que empacará, para que sus clientes compren sus regalos de fin de año, con ello logrará incrementar su capital de trabajo y rotar su mercancía mas rápidamente, pues aprovechará para exhibir lo que requieren sus clientes en esta hermosa temporada navideña.
texts.en:
In 2006, Francia Inés P., 34 years old, quit her job at a company because she was not making enough to improve her standard of living. She then started her story as an entrepreneur when she decidedly began her business selling miscellaneous merchandise, renting out a house belonging to a relative near where she was living. Before starting her business, Francia took stock of the potential customers around her, where a high school was located. Therefore, she thought about selling school supplies and stationary products such as poster board, pencils, pens, erasers, markers, etc. She stopped renting the house and her aunt allowed her to move into her house and set up her business. In this way, the rent that she was no longer paying was reinvested and little by little she began to stock her business with various types of products. 

Gradually her clientele grew and so she joined the Mario Santa Domingo Foundation over 4 years ago. This is her third loan and with the others she managed to increase her income as well as her self-sufficiency. She was also able to develop her potential to the point that currently she is providing an additional service in the field of computer science -- she offers personalized classes and has had a lot of success with this in the community. The growth of her business has allowed her to support her entire family. Due to this, her dream is to convert her business into a large department store and to help everyone who has lent her a helping hand. This is her third loan with Kiva and with it she will buy merchandise to get ready for the holidays, such as home decorations, cosmetics, and toys that she will wrap so that her customers will buy their holiday gifts there. With this, she will be able to increase her working capital and rotate her merchandise more quickly in order to display what her customers need during this beautiful Christmas season.

loans.use: She will buy merchandise to offer during the holiday season, like home decorations, cosmetics, and toys which she will wrap, so that her customers will buy their holiday gifts there

loans.name: Grupo Brisas 3, 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Adriana is one of the members of the group Brisas 3, 4, 5 & 6 (Breezes). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two of their three children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to build her house and she did it already, with God's will. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work because by doing that, she can help her children.

Adriana is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around three years, starting first by looking for clients who wanted to buy meats on request and then she obtained the products. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of meat sales by buying 150 pounds of pork and beef. She will use the profits to save and to invest in her business for now.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy 150 pounds of meat

loans.name: Clari Marin

texts.en:
Clari lives with his partner (she is also pictured) and his 18-year-old son. They live in a rural part of the neighborhood of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, which occupies the northern section of the city of Chiclayo. Clari has lived in this area for over 12 years.

Currently Clari works in public transit. For four years, he has driven a moto-taxi in and around the city of Chiclayo, carrying passengers to work, on errands and to visit friends. This is a service that exhibits significant competition, but allows a certain level of flexibility and autonomy in the work, a fact that Clari appreciates.

The loan is requested in order to make repairs to the moto-taxi and purchase a number of accessories for it. The actions will reduce his ongoing maintenance expenses and he hopes to draw additional clientele. Clari has taken out loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past. He has always paid punctually and responsibly. He has an excellent credit history and our analysis has approved him for the loan.

loans.use: Repairs to moto-taxi and purchasing accessories

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 31 años, tiene una ferretería, , vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para ayuda con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a gastar sus ahorros en herramientas y venderlos a los vecinos del sector donde vive, poco a poco  con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo tener su propia “ferretería” lugar donde hay toda clase de herramientas y materiales de construcción. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 04h00pm de lunes a sábado. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas y tubos para su ferretería y así tener mas variedad para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener otra ferretería y asi tener varias tienda de herramientas.
texts.en:
Flor is 31 years old. She has a hardware store. She lives in Primavera de Duran (a zone on the outskirts of Guayaquil, where the ecology is in dissolution).

To help with family expenses, she began to spend her savings on tools and sell them to neighbors in the sector where she lives. Little by little, with effort and dedication, she managed to have her own hardware store, a place where there is every kind of tool and construction material. She now works from 8 am to 4 pm from Monday to Saturday.

With the loan, she wants to buy tools and pipes for her hardware store and thus have greater variety for her customers. In the future, she wants to have another hardware store and thus have a variety of stores.

loans.use: Buy tools and pipes for her hardware store.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old. He lives with his wife in the town of Campiña Mesones Muro in the disctrict of Ferreñafe. This is a community that has grown significantly over the years and has developed at a reasonable pace, allowing it to become a reasonably comfortable area.

The client is involved in public transport. He has more than 10 years of experience in the business. He drives a moto-taxi in and around the region, carrying individuals to work, stores or to meet friends. He also works in agriculture.

Carlos has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past. He has taken out a number of loans and always paid punctually and responsibly. He has requested the current loan in order to make repairs to his moto-taxi.  He hopes this will reduce his maintenance expenses and provide a higher ongoing income for him and his family.

loans.use: Repair his moto-taxi

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 46 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en una casa que esta a su custodia. Hace 9 años que tiene su restaurante, instalado en el interior de su casa, asimismo recibe la ayuda de sus hijas, que en su tiempo libre la ayudan en la atención y preparación de las comidas. Es así que sale todos los días a vender comida; su dedicación y su inclinación por la cocina hacen posible que su sazón sea del agrado de sus clientes, eso hace que su negocio se mantenga estable. Su clientela es por lo general obreros que laboran en construcciones, por lo que ha visto Marina que este negocio es muy rentable. Hoy se ha propuesto mejorarla de acuerdo a sus posibilidades en cuanto a la presentación de su local de ventas. Es su crédito número 20 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras de este préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de algunos ingredientes como menestras  y cereales por sacos que son lo básico para la preparación de su comida.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old and lives with her three children in her own home.  

For nine years she had her own restaurant, which is located inside her house.  Her daughters help her in the restaurant in their free time by preparing food.  This allows her to go out every day to sell food.  Her dedication and cooking skills make it possible for her to please her customers and maintain a stable business.  Her customers are mostly construction workers, so Marina has made sure the business is very profitable.  Now, she would like to improve her business according to the local opportunities.

This is her 20th loan with MFP, and she is very happy that she has a financial support and is known as a responsible person with her payments.  She is also thankful to be part of her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and caring people.  She also thanks the people who will make this loan possible, because it will be very useful in the progress of her business.

With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients like vegetables and cereals that are the basics for the preparation of her food.

loans.use: Purchase basic products to prepare her food

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre San Roque, las cuales debido a que todas las integrantes coinciden de que ésta oportunidad les servirá de medio para progresar, actualmente se encuentran en el noveno ciclo, integrada por  20   emprendedoras señoras, quienes se esmeran periódicamente para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de ellas es la señora Ana quien es muy trabajadora y responsables con todas las actividades emprendidas por el comité, como son la ferias, sorteos que las mismas realizan para recaudar fondos.
Ella tiene una despensa en su domicilio donde ofrece productos para uso del hogar.
Tiene una familia muy unida y todos la ayudan para la atención de los clientes, y en todos los emprendimientos que ella realiza.
El negocio que ella maneja es bien surtida y tiene todos los productos que los clientes solicitan y actualmente quiere aumentar la cantidad de mercaderías que ella ofrece como fideos, azúcar, enlatados, panificados, bebidas y otras mercaderías por lo que solicita el préstamo para concretar la compra.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "San Roque." The members, because they all agree that this opportunity will serve them as a way to progress, are now in their ninth loan cycle. They are 20 entrepreneurial women who regularly do their very best to increase their income and therefore offer a better life to their respective families.

All the members are very hardworking and have invested their loans in their respective business activities.

One of the members is Señora Ana, who is very hardworking and responsible in all the activities undertaken by the group, such as the fairs and raffles that they hold to raise funds.

Señora Ana has a shop in her home where she offers household products. She has a very united family, and everyone helps her attend to the customers and in all the ventures that she undertakes. The business that she manages is well stocked and has all the products that her customers request. Now she wants to increase the merchandise that she offers, including pasta, sugar, canned goods, baked goods, beverages, and other merchandise. She is applying for the loan to complete the purchase of these goods.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as sugar, pasta, flour, oil, baked goods, canned goods.

loans.name: Nacianceno

texts.en:
Nacianceno is 37 years old. He lives with his partner and their three school-age children in the neighborhood of Montegrande in the town of Reque.  Reque is a town located 20 minutes south of Chiclayo in the coastal plain of northern Peru. It is primarily rural with many small farmers raising cattle or other crops. Nacianceno’s home has electricity and running water from a local well.

The family participates in a number of businesses. Nacianceno raises animals and also drives a moto-taxi in the area. He is currently renting a moto-taxi because his moto-taxi has broken down. Nacianceno’s wife works as a field laborer. These activities yield a fairly stable income stream which they use to provide for their familial needs and for the education of their children.

Nacianceno is requesting the loan in order to make the necessary repairs to his moto-taxi so that he can continue using it and terminate the expense of renting the moto-taxi. This will be his first loan and his first experience with a financial institution. He has good references from the community.  

Nacianceno is grateful for the opportunity to access credit at a reduced cost as a result of the funding from Kiva.

loans.use: Make repairs to his moto-taxi
